story:
WHAT WE BELIEVE

 

‘There is nothing more free than being yourself.’

 

Who are you when you are totally being your true self?

Who would you become after 365 days of self-exploring with powerful questions that help you find your own best self?​

 

We believe that personal growth is a lifelong journey that requires daily effort. Each one of us is whole, creative, and resourceful. We already have within us what we need not just for coping, but for thriving in all circumstances. When we explore deeper and get closer to our inner self, we will hear the answers, insights, and inner wisdom from our essence.

 

This journey of exploration and self-discovery is engaging, fun, and exciting!

We believe that the 365 Days of Self-Exploring Questions app serves just the right purpose to help you along the way.  

 

A Desk Calendar version of 365 Days of Self-Exploring Questions is also being created at the same time (same content). We believe that these two inspiring products will help you find the benefits of who you truly are and bring them to your everyday life. The market price for the desk calendar is USD 20.50.

 

 

 

OUR VISION & GOALS

We are offering our app users the most innovative and integrated daily self-exploring, reflecting, and learning experiences with today’s technology.

 

We pride ourselves in delivering:

  • a daily powerful question stimulating deep thinking
  • a space freeing your thought, voice, and inner wisdom
  • valuable resources like famous quotes, readings, websites, and shared texts
  • a positive community to join, helping you connect and share your thoughts with others

 

1 Daily Question + 1 out of 3 Different Additional Resources (example below) 

 

We look forward to having you on board with our vision.

You may help us by supporting our goals, spreading the news, and being our ambassador for making daily self-enrichment possible.

 

 

ABOUT 365 DAYS APP

The app is launched as both FREE app (limited to daily question only) and PAID app (full access). The market price for an annual subscription is USD 8.99.

 

[Main Features]

  • A daily powerful question
  • A space write down or record your answers
  • Inspiration from famous quotes, readings, and websites

 

 

[Advanced Features]

  • Connect with others and share your thoughts
  • Collect ‘My Favorites’ list + ‘Like’ the daily question
  • ‘Like’ the daily thoughts that are shared by others

 

[Upgraded Potential]

  • Keep progress of daily questions answered + celebrate milestones with rewards
  • Contribute to the community by posting your own powerful question
  • 'Add comments' to others’ daily shared thoughts

 

[Development phases]

The app development is progressed in different phases:

  • Main feature: iOS, Android - will go live 1 Jan 2018 
  • Advanced feature (a): iOS, Android - will go live 1 Apr 2018*
  • Advanced feature (b): Desktop browser - will go live 1 Apr 2018*
  • Upgraded feature: All 3 platforms - will go live 1 Jan 2019*

 

* development implementation is dependent on total funds raised

 

ABOUT FUNDS RAISED

The amount will be used as per below: 

 

 

 

JOIN US IN MAKING IT POSSIBLE

Together we realize our shared passion, vision and goals in personal development. By participating in the project (depending on the participation level chosen), you get to: 

  • be the first to use this pioneering app with early release 
  • enjoy complimentary access to the full app
  • gift your friends and family with full access
  • e-calendar and desk calendar
  • USD 800 payback

 

We look forward to seeing you taking active participation by:

  • choosing the level of support corresponding to your desire!
  • providing us your feedback on the app in concept/feature design (link below),
  • sharing this campaign with your families, friends, and important contacts,
  • joining us on our Facebook page.

 

 

Please give your feedback on the 365 Days App

 

Join us on our Facebook Page

 

 

 

We appreciate your participation!

 

 

 

 

Credits

  • Music: www.bensound.com
  • Video: wordandrecord
  • 'Thank you'   image: Created by Patrickss, Freepik.com

story:
Short Summary

Thandi's Trippy Trips is a book about a South African girl who travels to different cities in the world. Each book has a consistent formula: (1) Thandi's curiosity is triggered, (2) She explores a city (3) She meets a new imaginary friend in each place, (4) At the end of her trip, she collects a souvenir and places it on her 'shelf of souvenirs'. Every book ends with the questions: "Where will Thandi go next?"

So far, there are three illustrated books, their equivalent coloring story books and a new book in progress: "Silicon Valley" special edition book, where Thandi explores tech.

  • I am an illustrator, visual designer, writer, self-publisher and business woman.
  • This campaign is purposed to reach the goal of being able to distribute these collectible books to children around the world - rich and poor. 
  • Contributors will help me to achieve a minimum amount of stock to keep per book released. At the moment, I do on-demand orders - which works out to be far more expensive to print.
  • These funds will hep me to afford maintaining the e-commerce website and printing (R7500), packaging (R600), shipping costs (R1200), product development (Toy Design & prototyping) and get some creative assistance (R10000) to expedite production. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • There are a vast number of perks ranging from $1 to $200, so, you can choose the one that suits you -Feel free to choose more than one ;)
  • There are a total of 9 perks to cater to different types of  backers.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, funds will go to the minimum viable product. The core is to print and distribute books, even of that means I need to continue printing on demand.

The Impact

  • The project is meant to support the growth of Thandi's Trippy Trips; For every one book sold, a book is donated to children in poor schools in South Africa.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

While this is one of the most exciting project I have involved myself in, it comes with its share of challenges:

  • Increasing printing costs.
  • Costs of development
  • Allowance for mishaps, for example, in the case that a buyer wants their funds back
  • Suppliers are always a risk and at the moment, we find ourselves at the mercy of suppliers.
  • Difficult South Africa market, which is cheaper to distribute to.
  • Stringent policies of bookstores - supply to store and get paid as customer buys the item.
  • Very receptive international market, which is more pricey to get to.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • One can also help, simply by signing up on our website:
  • Please also use the Indiegogo share tools to draw more people to this campaign.
  • Posting positive comments on our blog site.
  • Sharing news about our products.
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
BRING THESE STORIES HOME

 

70 Irish women a week travel abroad to access safe abortion services. NOT AT HOME is an archive of their stories.

 

This project was created with the intention of breaking the silence that has shrouded these experiences for generations. BRING THESE STORIES HOME, is a national campaign to bring the stories that NOT AT HOME has been gathering since April 2016 — and continues to gather — to every city, town and village in Ireland. As part of this campaign, we need venues all around the country to host NOT AT HOME and to provide the space in which these women’s stories can be seen, heard and reflected upon.

 

As with NOT AT HOME’s first showing at this year’s Dublin Fringe Festival, the piece will be accessible to those on all sides, those who are still undecided and those who currently feel unequipped to make an informed choice. This is not an attempt to preach to the converted, nor to shame anyone into taking a liberal position. In acknowledgement that the issue is complicated and complex, it is simply hoped that viewing this work will give every member of the Irish public, especially those in marginalised or remote communities, the opportunity to view women’s real, lived experiences in a quiet, reflective environment.

 

NOT AT HOME is the truth of a lived experience shared by thousands of Irish women and girls over decades. We believe that truth should be heard in every corner of Ireland. Before any vote is cast or any mind is made up, we believe this conversation has to happen. We believe she has a right to speak and we believe everyone has a right to listen.

 

To make this happen, we need you. 

We need support, we need rooms, venues and public spaces all around Ireland, but most urgently, we need money. Staff, artists, performers, screens, projectors, pens and a paper and sweat and tears. It all costs money. So we ask a lot of favours, we work longer for less because this is so important to us, but we won’t ever cut corners while we have been trusted to tell these stories, so we need money.

 

Give what you can, give us a tenner, or a fiver, or five grand if you have it, but if you think everyone needs to hear what Irish women have gone through, are going through and will go through until something changes, give something.

story:
I am Nikolett Pelles (27) from Hungary, and I came to theThe Netherlands in 2014 as a professional dancer a few years ago. I have had some chance to perform and work as a freelancer, but last year I have decided that I would like to take on a next level my profession and use it another way. So in September 2016, I started my  Dance Movement Therapy (DMT), Master education in Rotterdam at Codarts University for the arts, which has been a privilege for me to do. 

The reason why I started this financial collect goal is because, my financial situation, unfortunately, is not good enough to pay my school for the next year, which is 2000 euro /year.

This is the amount of money what I need to collect. I strongly believe studying Dance Movement Therapy is my way, and for this, I need YOUR support!

 

 I am not entitled to get any financial support from The Netherlands and due to I am in The Netherlands, I have to find my own solution. My family is in Hungary and they can not support me.

Furthermore, I also like the idea that by this crowdfunding, people will learn more about what is Dance Movement Therapy (DMT), and it will spread more knowledge between people. 

I would like to invite you to take a look at this great video by American Dance Therapy Association, where Nana Koch beautifully explain what is Dance Movement Therapy is.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mhoEjbvIEw8

And I would love to write what DMT means to me!

Learning to be a therapist starts with learning about yourself first, which is always a really interesting, and most of the time confronting, experience. Facing with your feelings and patterns and thoughts. If I think of where I was when I started this education and where I am now at the end of the first year I see gaining a lot of knowledge. The way how I receive and observe people is becoming more conscious, and I understand and help people better than I have been doing it before. I have seen and experienced so much,  surrounded by a wonderful group who are my classmates and my true friends, who I do not want to loose. I would like to continue this 3-year journey next to them. Supporting each other and being there for each other. It is a privilege, to be a part of it.  

Please be a part of my journey!

story:
Why StudyLock:

Coming from a family of educators, education has been a priority in my life.  I’ve always been taught that “knowledge is power and education is key”.  During a Christmas break in December 2016, I noticed how much time my kids, ages 8, 11 and 14, spent on their mobile devices.  To avoid being the “mean dad” who took away the phones, I thought of ways to make education fun and interactive with my kids.  From there,  StudyLock was birthed.  I worked with an extraordinary group of developers who helped me achieve my goal of educating youth and empowering parents while it making it enjoyable.  

 

Our Need:

Currently the app is made available for free through the Google Play Store.  In a short period of time, we have been able to reach 900+ users and impact the lives of these students through education innovation.  Our ultimate goal is to increase our market share via IOS operating systems and broaden our reach.  We are seeking to raise $10,000 which will go towards marketing, software enhancement and launching expenses.   

Our current users have provided positive and satisfactory feedback on the app. In several cases, parents have been able to identify areas of weakness and interest through the grading system and statistical data that’s available.  What was once seen as deterrence through overuse of cell phone has become a learning aid for students and parents alike.

The following features of the StudyLock app include but are not limited to:

STUDYLOCK FEATURES: 

  • Variety of Subjects – Common Core State Standard Questions are available in subjects such as Math, Science, History, Literature and other scholastic subjects.

  • Grading System – This feature allows you to track correct answers and identify students' strong and weak areas.

  • Tracking of Statistical Data - Parents have the ability to check how their child is doing by simply logging into the Parents Web Portal and look at the statistics and trends.

  • Gamification -  This includes various options to make the app more fun.  There is also a leadership board which will motivate teens to do better.

  • Prizes – Based on different levels of achievement, the app offers awards through the rewards-based system.

We believe we can reach our goal of $10,000.00 because of the value of education and its impact on the youth of tomorrow.  StudyLock takes on the responsibility of being a key contributor in making a positive impact on students and supporting educational goals.

We thank each viewer in advance for taking the time to read our campaign and contribute to the mission of making "Education First"

story:
Student Attendance 2.0

We need you to think back to when you were in secondary school. (9th-12 Grade) Remember how the instructor did roll call, every kid yelled a silly statement and five minutes of class was lost everyday?

....Believe it or not....

THIS STILL OCCURS!!!

We at Aqui L.L.C. are proud to introduce a new innovative way to take attendance. Using IoT Technology, we will save time, motivate students to be present and try our hardest to solve a continuous problem in education known as Chronic Absenteeism. You can learn more about how this issue effects the U.S. education system at this link: https://www.brookings.edu/research/chronic-absenteeism-an-old-problem-in-search-of-new-answers/ 

  • Aqui runs on 1 to 1 classroom devices (Chromebooks, Tablets, iPads, etc.) We automatically can log who is present. No Manual Input for Teachers. 
  • Students compete and earn points by being present. The more you show up, the more points earned, the higher your rank! Use the Aqui App on any mobile device to compare stats and turn class rivals into friends! 
  • The points accumulate into Free Tangible Goods approved by the PTO of your school! (Gift cards, dress down days, free school events, merchandise, lunch passes, etc.)

Remember, incentivized program often provide behavioral change. We seen a 21% increase in 9th grade attendance in our first low budget pilot! It is our duty to figure out why kids miss school and get them to attend for better outcomes. ASK YOURSELF: If your day job did not pay you, how often would you miss work? Or? Back in the day, if someone offered you free popular goods for coming to school, would you show up?

Please make a contribution to help us reshape the future. 

We Need Your Support for our First School!

Magnolia Science Academy 4: Venice/W. Hollywood, California; 187 6th-12th Students, 13 Teachers; Principal; Mrs. Lisa Ross; Superintendent: Dr. Caprice Young

  • A detailed explanation on how the collected funds will be used for a 4-month R&D phase starting Spring Semester 2018: 
    • IoT Equipment and Insurance: $4500
    • Student Philanthropy Cost: $4500
    • Installation Cost (Soft & Hardware): $3500
    • Advertising/Branding & Marketing: $3500
    • Running Capital: $2500
    • Traveling Expenses: $1500
  • Any contribution helps! Check out our unique perks! We are thankful and excited to have you on our team!
  • Funds if goal is exceeded or unmet will go towards Aqui L.L.C.'s working capital to run business operation to help schools solve Chronic Absenteeism. 

The Impact

This campaign is also a stepping stone for a minority-owned start up to open a round of funding. Your contribution gives us lead way to help low income students and take our business to the next level. The difference your contribution creates:

  • We will receive the necessary data needed to apply for a SBIR (Small Business Innovation Research) Education Grant to work on Chronic Absenteeism.
  • Prove to MCO Business Advisers and other investors to provide capital for our first round of funding.
  • Take Louisville's first minority-owned Ed Tech Venture to a National platform. 
  • Prove to school districts and other learning institutions that there is an opportunity to save instructional dollars and time using Aqui.
  • Position students in rural and urban areas with incentive based solutions to provide better academic outcomes, social behaviors, professional skills, etc.
  • Make it real for people, students, teachers, accelerators, businesses and communities to build trust on our brand. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow and Connect with us on ALL SOCIAL MEDIA ACCOUNTS: @SupportAqui :D
  • Check out our hard work on YouTube! Here's a link --> https://youtu.be/MDRcI-iaB1Q
  • Please share this campaign with individuals vested in Education . Help Aqui come to a school near you! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. www.SupportAqui.com We appreciate your kindness in advance. Let's make history together! 

 

*** FUN FACT: "Aqui" means "Here/Present" in the Spanish Language. Pronounced Ah-Kee.

Aqui runs on 1 to 1 classroom devices (Chromebooks, Tablets, iPads, etc.) We automatically can log who is present. No Manual Input for Teachers. 

Students compete and earn points by being present. The more you show up, the more points earned, the higher your rank! Use the Aqui App on any mobile device to compare stats and turn class rivals into friends! 
The points accumulate into Free Tangible Goods approved by the PTO of your school! (Gift cards, dress down days, free school events, merchandise, lunch passes, etc.)

Remember, incentivized program often provide behavioral change. We seen a 21% increase in 9th grade attendance in our first low budget pilot! It is our duty to figure out why kids miss school and get them to attend for better outcomes. ASK YOURSELF: If your day job did not pay you, how often would you miss work? Or? Back in the day, if someone offered you free popular goods for coming to school, would you show up?
Please make a contribution to help us reshape the future. 

We Need Your Support for our First School!
Magnolia Science Academy 4: Venice/W. Hollywood, California; 187 6th-12th Students, 13 Teachers; Principal; Mrs. Lisa Ross; Superintendent: Dr. Caprice Young

A detailed explanation on how the collected funds will be used for a 4-month R&D phase starting Spring Semester 2018: 
IoT Equipment and Insurance: $4500
Student Philanthropy Cost: $4500
Installation Cost (Soft & Hardware): $3500
Advertising/Branding & Marketing: $3500
Running Capital: $2500
Traveling Expenses: $1500



Any contribution helps! Check out our unique perks! We are thankful and excited to have you on our team!
Funds if goal is exceeded or unmet will go towards Aqui L.L.C.'s working capital to run business operation to help schools solve Chronic Absenteeism. 


The Impact
This campaign is also a stepping stone for a minority-owned start up to open a round of funding. Your contribution gives us lead way to help low income students and take our business to the next level. The difference your contribution creates:

We will receive the necessary data needed to apply for a SBIR (Small Business Innovation Research) Education Grant to work on Chronic Absenteeism.
Prove to MCO Business Advisers and other investors to provide capital for our first round of funding.
Take Louisville's first minority-owned Ed Tech Venture to a National platform. 
Prove to school districts and other learning institutions that there is an opportunity to save instructional dollars and time using Aqui.
Position students in rural and urban areas with incentive based solutions to provide better academic outcomes, social behaviors, professional skills, etc.
Make it real for people, students, teachers, accelerators, businesses and communities to build trust on our brand. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Follow and Connect with us on ALL SOCIAL MEDIA ACCOUNTS: @SupportAqui :D

Check out our hard work on YouTube! Here's a link --> https://youtu.be/MDRcI-iaB1Q


Please share this campaign with individuals vested in Education . Help Aqui come to a school near you! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. www.SupportAqui.com We appreciate your kindness in advance. Let's make history together!  *** FUN FACT: "Aqui" means "Here/Present" in the Spanish Language. Pronounced Ah-Kee.

story:
Meet Jaelyn, a 6th grader at Roots Middle School in Oakland, CA.  Next school year, Jaelyn is going to transform the lives of all 100 students in her grade.  Like most schools, the students at Roots segregate themselves across cultural lines.  After she attends a second summer at Camp Common Ground, she and 21 other second-year campers are going to lead change efforts that disrupt cycles of segregation at their school.

Last summer, Jaelyn came to Camp Common Ground to build meaningful relationships with peers from other racial and economic backgrounds.  That’s where she met Eliana, a white, Jewish girl, who attended Contra Costa Jewish Day School.  “Eliana is like a sister to me,” wrote Jaelyn in a post-survey where she describes her summer experience.

While Jaelyn and Eliana’s friendship is one example of how Camp Common Ground breaks down cultural barriers between youth of different racial and economic backgrounds, it’s merely a by-product of the work we do with youth. Jaelyn, Eliana, and our other youth leave our program understanding their own identity and privilege, the empathy skills necessary to build relationships with peers of different backgrounds, and social norms that keep people of different backgrounds from integrating.  

Jaelyn is committed to figuring out how to disrupt these norms at Roots.  If Jaelyn comes back to Camp Common Ground for second summer, she’ll return to Roots as an 8th grader prepared to engage her principal, teachers, and her peers to design a plan that will lead to greater integration at Roots between kids of different races, ability  levels, etc.  

This Giving Tuesday season, join Jaelyn and 21 other youth in breaking down barriers between people of different backgrounds!  By supporting one of them, you invest in the work they’ll do to disrupt cycles of segregation that we all witness daily.  Your donation is not just an investment in them, however, it’s an investment in a more integrated society a generation from now.

story:
Short Summary

The world's great literature, right in your pocket. 

 

Time's Arrow is a multimedia reading platform that brings the printed word to life for students of all ages, backgrounds, and learning styles. Designed as an exploratory landscape, Time’s Arrow allows students to move through literary history with the ease and pleasure of a stroll through a beautiful countryside. On this landscape, students will discover great works of storytelling from every walk of life, reflecting an updated and expanding view of the traditional literary canon. These works are presented alongside audio performances and animations of the texts, drawing students into the aesthetic and intellectual pleasures that a lifetime of deep reading affords. While this mode of literary presentation serves to properly welcome students into a world of reading, our value of multidimensional representation helps ensure students will discover something of themselves in what they find.

 

Currently, Time's Arrow is in the late stages of product development and testing with a goal to go live with a full literary and media library by this fall. We have begun collaborating with an ever-expanding network of educators, actors, artists, learning specialists, and musicians to that end, producing a diverse, dynamic, and integrated literature curriculum for students of all levels and backgrounds. We are actively seeking feedback, potential partnerships, and introductions to schools, educators, and leaders in edtech to help bring our vision to fruition.

At Time's Arrow, we have created a platform for oral and written storytelling that puts great works from the world over into context for students, presenting, performing, animating, and explaining the world's most enduring myths, poetry, novels, plays, and historical writing. We bring actors, educators, and artists together into one place with one purpose: to create best possible invitation to world literature. We believe the delivery mechanism for knowledge matters as much as the content. 

Whether you are a high school student reading your first great novel, or a weekend warrior making time for a beloved poem, Time’s Arrow let's you explore the best of world literature on a gorgeous, interactive, "natural landscape" style ecosystem. We are in the final stages of turning our prototype into a functional product, and are looking for a boost to get us across the finish line. 

My name is Allen Guy Wilcox. I am the founding artistic director of The Theater at Woodshill, a 501(c)3 non-profit theater company based in Central New York. I graduated from Middlebury College in 2005 and have lived in Brooklyn for 15 years. I am a writer and a private tutor and the founder of Time's Arrow. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $12,000. This money will be going to actors, animators, designers, and programmers who have been an integral part of building this product with a premium on quality. 

All unique donors over $50 will be granted a year subsciption to the service upon launch.

story:
My name is Wayne Crittenden. That's me in the picture above; with one of the teams that I had the privilege of coaching. Over the last 15 years, athletes have come and gone; but the system hasn't changed. There has been a ceiling on success in my community. After considering that this could be a problem in other places, I developed a plan for a network that could improve sports on all levels. Then I created a brand to support the network and all its participants. 

Finito Brand

There are countless brands in the apparel industry; but most do not have a clear meaning or a defined purpose. Two unique things about the Finito brand are its name and intent.

Finito is derived from the Latin word finire; meaning to finish. The name was chosen to encourage people to persevere. The brand motto is Winners Finish. Coming in 1st place isn't the only way to win, but quitting is a definite way to lose. 

The initial goal of the Finito was to become the largest sponsor of academic institutions and athletic programs in the United States. Upon further observation, it was realized that this brand can aid nonprofit organizations as well.

The Finito brand is currently being sold, exclusively, via the Furst Impressions store on Facebook, but large retailers are being sought to distribute a standard line.

​Finito is new; so it isn’t well known or profitable yet. The fastest way to grow the brand is to partner with as many communities as possible. Obtaining subscribers is probably the easiest way to spread the word and ensure success.

Subscriptions

Subscribers of the Finito brand will receive: 1) discounts on Finito merchandise, 2) priority access to the most current information regarding Finito and the FINAO Acaletic Network (FAN), 3) special invitations to the FAN webinars, meetings, and events, 4) access to the FAN weekly blog and radio program, and 5) valuable tips to help improve their community. Funding will be given to a sponsored school, team, or nonprofit organization on the behalf of each subscriber.

​JILAM FINAO will give $20, to a sponsored team, school, or organization, for every $10 raised in subscriptions. Subscribers will determine who the JFC will sponsor.

FINAO Acaletic Network (FAN)

The FINAO Acaletic Network was developed for two reasons. First of all, it will be used to connect scholars, players, schools, teams, and communities nationwide. More importantly, it will help students and players to reach their full potential.

This one of ten projects that are a part of the Younite States of America initiative; a true stimulus for the United States economy. 

The idea to develop a system (FAN) that can improve conditions within educational institutions and enhance the sports experience for players, coaches, and fans came from R.S. "Wayne" Crittenden. He is a former athlete, coach of youth sports, graphic designer, and the CEO of the JILAM FINAO Corporation. Mr. Crittenden also created the Finito acaletic (academic/athletic) brand to support the network.

JILAM FINAO Corporation

JILAM FINAO is a startup clothing company in Yuma, Arizona. It was established to design, manufacture, and distribute custom apparel and accessories for men, women, and children.

Future plans are to use profits from the Finito acaletic brand to purchase and convert the 191,000 sq. ft. multi-use building below into a sports center.

There will also be enough space for entertainment, food, and games. In addition to using this location as a training center, JFC plans to host large tournaments, fashion shows, and concerts; making it an all-inclusive event center.


Help Us Help You

Launching the FINAO Acaletic Network is the main priority. Funding of $100.000 will enable us to do this. If this goal isn't reached, $10,000 will still be enough to adequately debut and promote the Finito clothing line. Profits from the brand and subscription costs should eventually raise the necessary money to get the FAN started.

Visit our website to see how our subscription perks can benefit your community. 

 National Impact

This campaign can literally impact any community in the United States. This is just the beginning of our effort to show individuals how to circulate money throughout their communities more effectively. That will stimulate the economy and can reverse the effects of the ongoing global recession.

This has never been attempted before, but it will work because we will only be modifying what citizens already do daily.

The Biggest Challenge

Nothing is guaranteed. If no one supports the FAN and Finito, after we have raised the necessary funding, we all fail. It is unlikely that will happen though.

Our biggest obstacle will be spreading the word, so we ask that you share this great idea with your family, friends, and community.

Even if you cannot contribute, you still can help. Share this campaign via your social media, email, text, and whatever resources you have. Please use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you.

story:
TEACHERS:  I am a teacher and want to tell our story.  

Contributions can be anonymous: click box "hide my name from campaign page" 

I have written a book but need funds to self-publish. 

First 250 1st Edition books will be numbered in order of pre-order receipt.  

The book tells the story that includes these main topics:

TOPIC 1: What impact have certain mandates and groups had on the atmosphere surrounding public education, such as:

-  NCLB 

-  Elected officials 

-  Politics

-  Media

-  Group agendas

-  Business leaders

TOPIC 2:  There are a multitude of societal factors that are affecting our children that teachers increasingly must address. The book outlines some of the societal factors which need to be considered when reviewing and improving public education, including (but not limited to):

-  Basic needs not met (food, shelter, love, belonging) 

-  Sports as a priority 

-  Role models & ‘heroes’ 

-  Need to be entertained 

-  Disrespect 

-  Helicopter parents

-  Transients

-  Over-scheduled children

-  Sense of entitlement

-  Everyone gets a trophy mentality 

TOPIC 3: The need to view public education needs to be ‘big picture’ and holistic, not micromanaged, mandated, and piecemeal. Public education is like a huge eco-system where everything affects everything else. Teachers are only one factor in this ‘edu-system.’ These graphics, and more, are used to explain how societal factors effect education.

TOPIC 4:  What do teachers ultimately want? We want:

-  To be trusted as a professional 

-  Standards that everyone agrees upon 

-  Standards that do not change every couple years

-  Respect

-  To be a part of solutions

-  An active community in every child’s education

I am a teacher: not an expert, consultant, or business person. I want to tell a story from my point of view in the classroom. The book is written. I need funds to edit (I teach science) and all preparations to self-publish the book.

This book is just the beginning. I expect a lot of feedback and comments (good and bad!). Plans are to update the book to release the 2nd edition quickly. Plans also include more books to tell our story.

Any amount - or share with likeminded people – is greatly appreciated. To pre-order a book, choose a perk.

************************************************************************

It has gotten harder to teach. Public education, and teachers specifically, are criticized, blamed, and bashed. In the meantime, the kids have gotten harder to teach. Ever been told it was your fault when a student failed? Ever feel like it is your job to ‘fix’ a child? The influence of society on our children and schools is taking us to our limits.

My story details how the negativity has evolved against public education and teachers. Teachers are mandated, disrespected, and over-worked. Politicians, media, and parents criticize us. Society has created students that feel entitled, focused more on sports than academics, and need to be entertained to learn. Students worship athletes and stars so do not see need for school. Then there are those students that are hungry, homeless, neglected, abused, and/or unloved. Remember Maslow’s hierarchy of needs? Basic needs to be fulfilled before self improvement/education can occur.

However, we want what is best for the kids – THAT IS WHY WE TEACH. I want this book to start a conversation to take us into the future. I propose ways to look at public education differently, open/honest converstaions that include the influences of society so we can improving public education, with teacher voices at the table.

Help me self-publish this book;

Options:

1.  Contribution of any amount ($25 or more/less)

2.  Perk 1 includes $25 contribution toward publishing plus pre-order a book. The first 250 books will be numbered.

There are other perks for you to consider

I am a public school teacher, seventh grade Life Science. I have represented teachers at all levels (school, district, and state) and heard teachers react to the proposals for improving education. My book project is a culmination of listening to teachers speak and working in the classroom for more than 20 years. It seems everyone is telling schools and teachers how to improve, but I do not hear teachers in the conversations.

Teachers can only do so much. The book includes two stories:

1.  How do schools and students mirror society?

Students are coming to school in increasing numbers hungry, neglected, homeless, and unloved; SOCIETAL issues that teachers cannot overcome.  Some come to school feeling entitled or with sports as their priority/not education. Others come to school with a false sense of self-esteem from all those trophies gotten for just participating, while others will only learn if they are entertained. Parents are doing their homework and constantly telling us how we do not care about their child. We can only do so much with a larger population of children. We are reaching our limits to teach all children successfully.   

2.  How can we look at schools and students differently to include their realities in future education improvements?

Public Education is a single component of a complex American society and the children are a part of that society. As in an ecosystem, everything is connected and interdependent. Public education must be viewed as one part of an interconnected and interdependent network where everything impacts everything else. Systemic change, not band aids and mandates, is necessary.

My campaign is to raise funds to first publish the book detailing these two premises. Samples of the book are at my blog and in its the archives ( http://teachertimmullen.blogspot.com/ ) Then, I want to pursue a multi-staged effort to promote the idea that teachers are doing what we can to educate America's children but we are at a point that society must also take responsibility and contribute. Our children come to school with backgrounds, issues, and attitudes that will hinder school reform, teacher development, and/or any other school and teacher improvement efforts. Public school teachers are only a single entity within a complex and integrated society.

My plans are:

Phase 1 – Edit and publish book “Public Schools Mirror Society: Time to Stop Blaming Teachers." Funds will be used for a professional editor and publisher. (Edits, design, publishing, $6000)

Phase 2 – Create a platform and system for dialogue, to include a website with blog and letters/materials teachers can use to spread the word at their comfort level AND receive/process feed back on book to create 2nd edition based on teacher responses (website development, professional help, and maintenance, $4000)

Phase 3 – Use dialogue and stories generated for this book to start second book, "Teacher Stories: Stories of success, failures, passion, disenchantment, frustration, excitement, and more."

My single purpose is to be a voice for teachers.

Be a part of this campaign. It is more than just the book. Once the book is published, I expect a lot of feedback and comments which I plan to put into the 2nd addition, making it more robust. The communication system I plan to setup will facilitate communication to gather and publish teacher stories of success/failure, joy/frustrations, hopes/disenchantments, and whatever other themes that arise for teachers throughout the country. The voices of the teacher need to be more prevalent, shared, and integrated into conversations for improving public education in America. I have setup three accounts to me help spread the word. I want to hear your thoughts and ideas through these media sites:

1. Follow me on my blog,teachertimmullen.blogspot.com. 

Latest post is the "Table of Contents and Chapter 1."  Check out the archives for sample writings from book.

2. Facebook Group: Perspectives of a Teacher

3. Twitter: @Teacher_Tim

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Tim Mullen, PhD.

Tim Mullen has been teaching 7th grade Life Science for more than 20 years, choosing to switch from the corporate world into the more fulfilling career of teaching. An outstanding teacher in his field, he serves on the Teacher Advisory Councils for the superintendent of his school district  and for the Governor of Georgia, has served on the board and acted as president of the Professional Association of Georgia Educators, was named his school's Teacher of the Year on two separate occasions, and most recently was selected as a Hope Street Group National Fellow. Dr. Mullen has his PhD in interdisciplinary middle grades education from the University of Georgia, his BS from Penn State, is a National Board Certified teacher, and Georgia Master Teacher.

perk.************************************************************************It has gotten harder to teach. Public education, and teachers
specifically, are criticized, blamed, and bashed. In the meantime, the kids
have gotten harder to teach. Ever been told it was your fault when a student
failed? Ever feel like it is your job to ‘fix’ a child? The influence of
society on our children and schools is taking us to our limits.
My story details how the negativity has evolved against
public education and teachers. Teachers are mandated, disrespected, and
over-worked. Politicians, media, and parents criticize us. Society has created students
that feel entitled, focused more on sports than academics, and need to be
entertained to learn. Students worship athletes and stars so do not see need
for school. Then there are those students that are hungry, homeless, neglected,
abused, and/or unloved. Remember Maslow’s hierarchy of needs? Basic needs to be
fulfilled before self improvement/education can occur.
However, we want what is best for the kids – THAT IS WHY
WE TEACH. I want this book to start a conversation to take us into the future. I
propose ways to look at public education differently, open/honest converstaions that include the influences of society so we can improving public
education, with teacher voices at the table.
Help me self-publish this book; 
Options:
1. 
Contribution of any amount ($25 or more/less)
2. 
Perk 1 includes $25 contribution toward
publishing plus pre-order a book. The first 250 books will be numbered.
There are other perks for you to consider
I
am a public school teacher, seventh grade Life Science. I have represented
teachers at all levels (school, district, and state) and heard teachers react
to the proposals for improving education. My book project is a culmination of
listening to teachers speak and working in the classroom for more than 20
years. It seems everyone is telling schools and teachers how to improve, but I do not
hear teachers in the conversations. 
Teachers
can only do so much. The book includes two stories: 
1. 
How do schools and students mirror society?
Students are coming to school in increasing
numbers hungry, neglected, homeless, and unloved; SOCIETAL issues that teachers
cannot overcome.  Some come to school
feeling entitled or with sports as their priority/not education. Others come to
school with a false sense of self-esteem from all those trophies gotten for
just participating, while others will only learn if they are entertained. Parents
are doing their homework and constantly telling us how we do not care about
their child. We can only do so much with a larger population of children. We
are reaching our limits to teach all children successfully.   
2. 
How can we look at schools and students differently
to include their realities in future education improvements?
Public Education is a single component
of a complex American society and the children are a part of that society.
As in an ecosystem, everything is connected and interdependent. Public
education must be viewed as one part of an interconnected and
interdependent network where everything impacts everything else. Systemic
change, not band aids and mandates, is necessary.
My
campaign is to raise funds to first publish the book detailing these two
premises. Samples of the book are at my blog and in its the archives ( http://teachertimmullen.blogspot.com/ ) Then,
I want to pursue a multi-staged effort to promote the idea that teachers are
doing what we can to educate America's children but we are at a point that
society must also take responsibility and contribute. Our children come to
school with backgrounds, issues, and attitudes that will hinder school reform,
teacher development, and/or any other school and teacher improvement efforts.
Public school teachers are only a single entity within a complex and
integrated society.
My plans are:
Phase
1 – Edit and publish book “Public Schools Mirror Society: Time to
Stop Blaming Teachers." Funds will be used for a professional editor and
publisher. (Edits, design, publishing, $6000)
Phase
2 – Create a platform and system for dialogue, to include
a website with blog and letters/materials teachers can use to spread the
word at their comfort level AND receive/process feed back on book to create 2nd
edition based on teacher responses (website development, professional help, and
maintenance, $4000)
Phase
3 – Use dialogue and stories generated for this book to start second book,
"Teacher Stories: Stories of success, failures, passion, disenchantment,
frustration, excitement, and more."
My
single purpose is to be a voice for teachers. 
Be
a part of this campaign. It is more than just the book. Once the book is published,
I expect a lot of feedback and comments which I plan to put into the 2nd
addition, making it more robust. The communication system I plan to setup will
facilitate communication to gather and publish teacher stories of
success/failure, joy/frustrations, hopes/disenchantments, and whatever other
themes that arise for teachers throughout the country. The voices of the
teacher need to be more prevalent, shared, and integrated into conversations
for improving public education in America. I have setup three accounts to me
help spread the word. I want to hear your thoughts and ideas through these
media sites:
1.
Follow me on my blog,teachertimmullen.blogspot.com. 
Latest post is the
"Table of Contents and Chapter 1."  Check out the archives for
sample writings from book.
2.
Facebook Group: Perspectives
of a Teacher
3.
Twitter: @Teacher_Tim
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
About
Tim Mullen, PhD.
Tim
Mullen has been teaching 7th grade Life Science for more than 20 years,
choosing to switch from the corporate world into the more fulfilling career of
teaching. An outstanding teacher in his field, he serves on the Teacher
Advisory Councils for the superintendent of his school district  and for
the Governor of Georgia, has served on the board and acted as president of
the Professional Association of Georgia Educators,
was named his school's Teacher of the Year on two separate occasions, and most
recently was selected as a Hope Street
Group National Fellow. Dr. Mullen has his PhD in interdisciplinary
middle grades education from the University of Georgia, his BS from Penn State,
is a National Board Certified teacher, and Georgia Master Teacher.

story:
Please support us. Every donation will make the exhibition more exciting and you can get yourself a bargain at the same time.

‘All who truly love Lakeland are exiles when away from it.’

From the moment in 1930 when he first ‘stood transfixed’ by the beauty of the fells, Alfred Wainwright was driven to return again and again. His famous pictorial guides map out multiple routes to 214 summits now known simply as the Wainwrights. They have inspired millions to their own #wainwrightmoment.

This major exhibition dedicated to the legendary walker will use archives, original artefacts, film and interactive exhibits to recreate Wainwright’s world, reveal his unique methods, and explore his challenge to us.

Whether you want to visit all the Wainwrights in ten minutes, re-live his journey from the office to the fells, or get to grips with his creative techniques – this exhibition will inspire dedicated fell walkers and newcomers alike.

This project aims to create a much-needed Lake District attraction directly relevant to visitors' needs and interests.

Transforming the Keswick Museum and Art Gallery

The Keswick Museum and Art Gallery has recently been transformed into a bright and modern visitor centre. We now aim to match this with a transformation of its contents and the visitor experience. Alongside our ongoing care and display of the ever-popular Victorian collections, we will therefore introduce this new exhibition about the man who, through his innovative guidebooks and personal example, enabled access to the Lakeland fells for so many and inspired an enduring love for them.

Your support will help build a truly compelling exhibition

Help us create the truly hands-on, compelling and fun experience that we feel visitors deserve.

For walkers and countryside lovers any visit to Keswick and the northern Lakes will be exhilarating. This exhibition seeks to respond to that excitement and provide lasting memories which will enrich visitors' experience of the landscape. We depend on your support to let us bring the material to life.

Planned exhibition highlights

  • Share the awe of his first fell-top moment
  • Fly round all the Wainwrights in ten minutes in our mini cinema
  • Immerse yourself in our interactive Wainwright map
  • Get to grips with Wainwright’s creative methods
  • See original Wainwright drawings and his possessions
  • Find out what made Wainwright’s guides so special

All designed to inspire walkers and future generations to an ongoing understanding, love and care of the fells.

(AW photo Copyright Derry Brabbs)

story:
Short Summary

Founded by Pailin Pinckes, a native, Thai, citizen from Rayong. Pailin, who moved to America in 2011, taught herself English and learned the American culture with the help of her husband, Evan Pinckes. The Pinckes family, with their four, beautiful children, believed in the need and importance of returning to Thailand, to dedicate their lives to educate the underprivileged and to teach English with the hopes of bettering their lives. Since 2012 the Pinckes / Chanduaykit family, and English teacher volunteers have been working out of Wat Wutthawas (The local Temple) on a tight budget to help the local kids in the area. Our goal is to raise donations to start building freestanding permanent learning centers with full time teachers.

Making a difference

What distinguishes the Learning English Center from other English centers and schools, in Thailand, is we believe in giving back to the community. We will be offering six different classes, ranging from elementary school through college. Also, we will have a business class and classes for our senior citizens. The two areas of study, that we are most proud of, are for the elementary school children and the seniors, as they are without cost. Ideally, we wish that our entire English courses could be free at L.E.C. but we need to be able to sustain our programs to grow and keep our doors, open.

What We Need & What You Get

The Learning English Center is a non-profit organization, dedicated to the cause of better English education, in the Rayong Province. For this purpose, we support and will set up several small-scale projects, starting in the city of Klaeng, which is a district (amphoe) in the eastern part of Rayong Province. Through generous donations, dedication of low cost, native, English teachers, volunteers and interns, we will offer underprivileged pupils the extra attention and support they badly need. We will provide our participants with a special and valuable experience in one of the most beautiful areas, in Thailand. Our Goal is to open ten English centers, in the next 24 months.

The Impact

We want to change Thailand with the power of EDUCATION. Educating the underprivileged, in English, will give them a much better chance in the world, where the main language, in business, is English. Our programs are open to anyone aged six and up. We consider teaching and learning English, as a very strong asset. More importantly, working well with children, being flexible and teaching the children responsibility, will improve their lives. Speaking English in today's world is a valuable tool.

Risks & Challenges

Thailand has a population of around 67 million people, with the majority well below the poverty level. The English learning they receive, in school, if any, is so basic, that they’re deprived from a means of a better life. In a 60-nation ranking released in 2014, the Education First Institute put Thailand 55th on the English Proficiency Index. The ranking was based on the results of an Internet-based English Proficiency test, taken by 750,000 people, from 60 countries. All respondents were of working age. Reports show that people with greater English proficiency, have higher income. We at L.E.C, want to introduce English, to students, at a young age, to give them a better chance of succeeding, in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone can't afford to donate, but you can help, by telling our story. Please share our Indiegogo page, Facebook page, Twitter, our website www.learningenglishcenter.com , and our videos on YouTube, and get our name and our mission out there!

story:
Hey, thanks for taking an interest.

We are the Charterhouse Exoplanet Project, formed in the later part of 2014.
Our mission is to use the 18" reflecting telescope (affectionately known as Dudley) to detect transiting exoplanets. This work we intend to bring to the public by hosting outreach events, observing evenings, and research activities for schools. Its very difficult for amateurs & schools to get access to such a large observatory, so we want to help change that.
We hope that, with your help, we can put the Charterhouse observatory on the map as an outreach and research observatory of excellence!

To achieve our goals we need to get a few things

To make this project really successful there are a number of items of hardware which need some serious attention and even replacement.
1) Drive Motors: These are essential for the operation of the telescope. Without them, it is very difficult to move the scope, and impossible to track objects for a long time. We have made do for quite a number of years now, as one of the motors has not worked very well, making it difficult to find objects in the sky with the remote handset. We have been given a quote of roughly £250 to have them replaced, and will be our first upgrade.
2) Focus Assembly: Our second upgrade would be the focus assembly, this is the mechanism which allows us to pull the images of the night sky, into a crisp sharp image. This really is an essential feature for astronomy. The current focus assembly is very old indeed, and is in need of changing. The new assembly will give us the much needed extra travel, to be able to use our CCD camera for the detection of exoplanets, and to better enable the public to use the scope (the current assembly doesn't give much fine tuning ability) This equipment we anticipate costing around £250-£350
3)Auto-Guider: This is something which we have made do without until now, as the dodgy motor drive makes it somewhat redundant, but once the motors are fixed, then this will be a great feature. Auto-guiding uses another smaller telescope fixed to the main 18" and another smaller CCD camera. Software monitors how the stars are moving in the small scope, and feeds back to the motor drive to keep the field of view as steady as possible. This makes takes the tracking from good to superb! This will be an essential piece of equipment for very high precision research images, and will allow remote alignment if the telescope was to be set up for remote control. The cost of this is around £300-£400.
4) Focus Assembly Motor: Though not essential for the continued operation of the observatory, this motor drive allows the focus assembly to be controlled from a computer, allowing far more efficient imaging runs, and is one step closer to being able to automate the telescope, which could then become something which schools can "remote" into and control from anywhere. This equipment we anticipate to be around £350.
We plan to offer "thank you gifts" for donations of different magnitudes, ranging from branded stickers, to a evening at the observatory for you and you friends.
If we don't reach our goal on here, whats next? Initially it will be funded from our own pockets, we will also look toward the Royal Astronomical Society and asking for donations for members of the public attending events and lecture events held at the observatory.
If we manage to meet and surpass our funding goal then the money will go to attaining even more equipment that we will need as the project grows. For example higher resolution CCD for imaging, dedicated research computer, motorising the dome, buying a larger range of eyepieces... and so on.
 Excuse the pun but, 'the sky's the limit'!

What this project could become

Detection of exoplanets really is on the forefront of modern astronomy.The KEPLER space telescope already having found nearly 1500 in a tiny patch of the night sky. Professional astronomers are more and more frequently looking to amateurs for assistance, as the equipment they now use is easily as good, and more easily accessible. We look out into the cosmos with the hope that we might, one day, find a planet much like Earth, which we may be able to travel to in the future, or even, get visitors from!
Space science is the human races future, we need to invest in it and this research will be vital to inspire the next generation of space scientists.

Whilst also doing cutting edge research we also plan to give back to the community by running outreach workshops and allowing schools to use the scope to gather their own data, perhaps for those who are taking the GCSE Astronomy course.

By no means is this an easy task,

There will be many hurdles, we are working with an old telescope, even thought Dudley is a incredible piece of engineering things will break and need replacing.
But to help us through the hard times we have gained an incredible network of industry professionals, people that are at the top of their respective fields, to give us advice and steer us in the right direction. They have a lot of faith in us, so we must be on to something good.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to our cause then you can aid us in spreading the word about this project (via Facebook, Twitter and the Indiegogo share tools), tell your family and friends as they may be interested in donating. Also once we get a few of the items listed we can start running the talks, which will be run at a small fee, and I stress that all money collected goes back into the observatory, not into our pockets!
Thank you so much again for taking the time to read out campaign, this means a great deal to us and we hope you can be a part of it too.

They have a lot of faith in us, so we must be on to something good.   Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate to our cause then you can aid us in spreading the word about this project (via Facebook, Twitter and the Indiegogo share tools), tell your family and friends as they may be interested in donating. Also once we get a few of the items listed we can start running the talks, which will be run at a small fee, and I stress that all money collected goes back into the observatory, not into our pockets!
Thank you so much again for taking the time to read out campaign, this means a great deal to us and we hope you can be a part of it too.

story:
WHO I AM

It all started in the fall of 1983.  I’m an Israeli-born son of immigrant parents and was raised in LA since the mid 80s.  My childhood was spent playing music, starting at the age of 7.  From piano to trombone,then on to guitar, percussion, and ultimately bass, I had a holistic musical understanding that oscillated between formal lessons and self-taught intuitive explorations.  My folks divorced before my 13th birthday, and in my teens I started exploring more visual realms of self-expression via photography. In 2009 I discovered my obsession with Chinese tea culture and spent the better part of the next 4 years operating as a one-man-tea-business.

The past 15 years have been spent as a working musician, freelance visual artist, and entrepreneur.  In 2012, I developed an art/design workflow on my iPhone utilizing 10 brilliant apps that proved intuitive and exciting to use and reuse to explore akin to a graphic designer using adobe creative suite.  In 2013, I debuted my visual art in a group show along with the help of friends who work with creative technologies to present an art installation with corresponding augmented reality that operated as an app on a tablet with the purpose of providing further interaction through audio and visual play.  This art show proved a turning point, and months after discovered the role of the User-Experience Designer in society.

A User-Experience Designer is one who designs the human experience across online and offline platforms: websites, products, services, apps, you name it. When you hear "user experience design" think "designing user experience". 

These days are proving to be some of the most exciting, as I am about to become a first-time father this summer with my glorious partner Pamela.  In preparation for fatherhood, I am going into a full-time immersive at General Assembly from March - May 2015 with the intent to launch immediately into a new career in UX Design.


MY GOAL

To fund my tuition for the full-time 10-week User a Experience Design Immersive at General Assembly in Santa Monica, Ca.  The current costs amount to $9500.  


WHERE YOU COME IN

I’ve arranged this campaign to interface as a gift-exchange.  

There are several tiers of contribution amounts that equate to various gifts, such as:

• Visual Art of varying sizes

• Private Tea Ceremony for 4

• Discounted UX Design Services (deliverable as of summer 2015)

I’ve arranged this campaign to interface as a gift-exchange.  
There are several tiers of contribution amounts that equate to various gifts, such as:
• Visual Art of varying sizes
• Private Tea Ceremony for 4
• Discounted UX Design Services (deliverable as of summer 2015)

story:
Hello I am Rolo and I am Autistic- I have bought a bus to convert and have spent everything I have saved to purchase it. I need to  convert the bus/transit to enable me to deliver Autism talks, training, workshops and attend conferences nationally whilst making it warm, sound proofed and disabled friendly

A converted van is a necessity because as an autistic I am severely affected by sensory stimulus,have a spinal condition and after giving my time to people need a safe environment to recoup and rest-I can not use hotels. 


A van would serve as a mini office and enable me to travel further afield, sleep overnight and get to places and people that live in out of the way locations.Without it I can not reach those who need me. However I can not do the work myself so with your help I can put the proceeds towards paying for someone to do the conversion safely including insulating adding swivel chairs and an awning to give talks in the shade or out of the rain.Training from the van 

Extra money would also pay for teaching tools information and signboards fuel and any  additional costs

This is the first step of a bigger project called Autism Rolo (Nothing about Autism without Autism)

To date there are almost no post diagnostic services for adults diagnosed with ASC autism spectrum condition; I know this because I am one of them. I am working tirelessly to rectify this whilst tackling the stigma and discrimination in the way that Autism is percieved and excluded.

My passion and mission is to get on the road and start a conversation from an autistic perspective highlighting the huge talent pool that is going to waste due to the fear and misunderstanding of our neurodiversity. Secondly I wish to bridge the divide beteween us all and to celebrate differences, combining all our talents (both autistic and non autistic)which will serve to create a better neurodiverse society built on tolerance, understanding, knowledge and cooperation.

Getting out there is the best way forward

I will be able to achieve this by

▪ Giving talks and to other Autism charities whilst assisting in their training which I already do on a voluntary basis

▪ Providing talks seminars, workshops and training in both the public and private sectors

▪ Workshops for smaller groups 

▪ Visiting businesses large and small to encourage and promote employment of Autistic workers whilst providing practical solutions (only 15% of those diagnosed are in gainful employment)

▪ Attending Autism Conferences nationally

▪ Setting up flash workshops in public spaces( to my knowledge this has not been done before and I am excited )

▪ Adddressing mental health issue which means providing advise for both autistics and non autistics

1 in 3 us will have mental health issues at some point in our lives

Money pays towards purchase of transit van conversion costs

MOT, tax,insurance,vehicle recovery and fuel for 1 year

All help advice and support in any form would be hugely appreciated AutismRolo

story:
This campaign has been relaunched here  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/12-000-for-12-challenges-over-12-months-part-2


Over the next 12 months I will complete 12 challenges to raise $12,000 for the following amazing charities:

1. Lifestart http://bit.ly/1JnIKgk

2. Chris O'Brien Life House http://bit.ly/1ORbtIX

3. MS Australia http://bit.ly/1QMmT4k

4. Variety Club

5. St Vincent de Paul http://bit.ly/1JCcrKC


You can specify which charity you want to support or donate to all at once.


I am planning to complete the following challenges:


1. March 29 - Kayak for kids (18km harbour kayaking)
2. April 11 - Sydney to Ettalong Loop (150km bike ride)
3. May 9 - River Ride (200km bike ride)
4. June 24 - Alpe D'Huez x 2 (60km bike ride climbing and descending the famous mountain in France)
5. July 8 - Guildford to Brighton and back (150km bike ride)
6. Sept 19 - Sydney to Sackville Ferry Loop (150km bike ride)
7. Oct 10-11 - Ride to Conquer Cancer (200km bike ride)
8. Nov 1 - Sydney to Wollongong and back (180km bike ride)
9. Nov 14 - Sydney to Hunter Valley (200km bike ride)
10. Jan 25 2016 - Audax Alpine Classic (250km bike ride)
11. Jan 31 2016 - Palm Beach to Whale Beach - The Big Swim (2.8km ocean swim)
12. April 2 - April 16 2016 - The Variety Cycle - Sydney to the Great Barrier Reef (2100km bike ride)

story:
Short Summary

The Boulder Gymnastics Club at the University of Colorado is a club-level group of students who compete for the love of the sport. We are part of the National Association of Intercollegiate Gymnastics Clubs. We are made up of a supportive group of students with a large range of talents. Throughout the year we compete against other club gymnastics teams and culminate the season with a national competition against hundreds of teams across the US. 

Gymnastics provides us with an incredible physical and mental challenge, resulting in amazing accomplishments.  Our team builds camaraderie, promotes sportsmanship, teamwork, leadership, and is incredibly fun!

What We Need

Your donations would be greatly appreciated and will help us fund:

  • Travel to Nationals
  • Hotels for Nationals
  • Meet Registration
  • Coaching and Gym Tuition fees
These expenses can be very costly and are often prohibitive for a college student budget.

What You Get

We also are selling t-shirts through this page. All perks that are $30 or more will include a custom Boulder Gymnastics T-Shirt! We will send you an email at the end of the campaign to get the shirt size!

The Impact

With your help we can fund our trip to nationals so as many athletes as possible can join! You will also be promoting an awesome sport and it's gymnasts. Being a part of a collegiate team is invaluable and we greatly appreciate the support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to visit our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/bouldergymnastics?fref=ts

or Instagram account: bouldergymnastics_ 

for more information, pictures, and videos! Keep in touch through these portals to learn when we have gymnastics meets that you can watch!

story:
Hello everybody our campaign is not far from ending and we've just got 140,00 €. I think we can do better! And you? I ask everybody to give a contribution and share to all your friends asking to share and share.. I hope you will help us with this important project! I believe in you hope you want to believe in this project!

Ciao a tutti gli amici, la nostra campgna raccolta fondi è vicina alla fine e al momento abbiamo racolto solo 140,00 € Credo che possiamo fare di meglio e voi? Chiedo a tutti di dare il massimo per questi pochi giorni che rimangano in contributi e condividendo la campagna con tutti i vostri amici chiedendo loro di condividerla a loro volta. credo che possiamo farcela vi chiedo di crederci anche voi!

Thank you for support us!

We live and work in Tuscany. Our group aim is to rediscover and save to oblivion our history treasure by archaeological survey and activities. 
For the last thousand years, many different populations have lived and died in this part of Tuscany.

Several treasures, tombs and ruins have been found, AND LOST, in this area over the centuries.

We are asking for your help to rediscover these treasures, save them from Oblivion and share with the world! 

The Temple of Santa Vittoria, Pozzo della Chiana, Tuscany
During XVI sec. Vasari and his workers found, while building the Temple of Santa Vittoria, the foundations of ancient buildings. These misterious foundations are surrounded by many skeletons. 500 years later, still nobody knows, what is hidden under the Temple of Santa Vittoria.


Incoming projects:
Step #1
Survey the area around the temple of Santa Vittoria looking for the ancient building mentioned by Vasari.

Step #2
Survey the Plain of Scannagallo looking for the remains of 4000 soldiers that died in the famous battle of Scannagallo of the 2nd of August pf 1554.

Step #3
Survey the area around the village of Pozzo for the remains of other temples or ancient villages (3000-6000 years b.c.)

HELP US TO SAVE THE TREASURES TO SHARE THEM WITH THE WORLD!

story:
This fall we plan to send care packages to at least 150 students at HBCU, SUNY, CUNY and other higher education systems throughout the country. We believe these care packages relieve monetary stress for students while allowing them to maintain their focus on studying. EYTE plans to do everything we can to encourage and support students from Brownsville, Bushwick, Bed Stuy, Canarsie, Crown Heights and Flatbush communities of Brooklyn.

Our mission is to improve the lives of youth in underserved communities and facilitate their development into positive, contributing adults. We do this by encouraging the pursuit of higher education; healthy lifestyles and strong community ties.

EYTE offers various programs such as college tours, reading programs, separate boys and girls discussion group sessions, summer camps, sports clinics, and monthly parent meetings.

story:
Our Story

The Juving School lies at the foothills of Mount Everest in Nepal's Sagarmatha National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site. It is the only school within the district and serves 370 children.

A devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake ripped through Nepal on April 25th, 2015, followed by several aftershocks, the largest of which was 6.7 in magnitude. The widespread destruction is unimaginable. At The Mountain Fund our focus is now entirely on rebuilding and restoring life and dignity to the people of Nepal.

The Juving School is one of 54 schools completely destroyed by the earthquakes. Currently, it has no infrastructure, no classrooms, and no furniture. It is simply characterized by the 370 children coming here every day, coaxed by teachers and parents, who want to maintain a facade of normalcy. These children brave the long treks from home only to spend their day in makeshift tents, be it raining or freezing.  



You can make a difference!

We need your help to rebuild this school before winter sets in. The plans are ready. The new construction will source local materials as well as be earthquake resistant.

The Mountain Fund is an all volunteer, non-profit organization. We put 100% of donations on the ground and working in Nepal. 

We appreciate you taking the time to read about our project. All contributions are welcome and we encourage you to spread the word. Your generosity can make a tremendous difference but time is of the essence...

Thank you!

Samples of digital prints for contributions over $100

story:
In many rural villages in India where patriarchy is deep-seated, the place of many young women were thought to be strictly confined to the thatched walls of the kitchens. There were youths with potential, but disempowered by the very circumstances they were born into.

Yet, such is the norm that Project Gazaab seeks to transform, one story at a time. Not just limited to women, but youths in general, Project Gazaab is on a mission to empower the youth by inspiring, motivating, and equipping them to become entrepreneurs.

“The Honey Bees” is just one example of the many business ideas realized through Project Gazaab. Undertaken by 5 aspiring young ladies from Maharashtra, India in 2012, these girls won business capital through the Gazaab competition and have since undergone training and procured the necessary equipment needed to breed bees and extract their honey.

Today, these girls have become successful entrepreneurs, capable of earning a living and finding ground in an environment where odds were against them.

Here at Project Gazaab, we believe that many more youths have the untapped potential to contribute innovative ideas that can better their living conditions and possibly that of their communities. Hence, we are now shifting our eyes to the outskirts of Indonesia, Lembang. This year, Project Gazaab Indonesia 2015 seeks to empower the underprivileged youths of Lembang by imparting business knowledge and skills so that they are self-sufficient and can contribute to the economy in the area.

As a two-week service learning initiative, Project Gazaab educates the youth on creative problem-solving skills and business-related concepts. We then mentor them to turn their ideas into business plans through a business case competition. The winners of this competition are awarded seed funding to begin their journey as social entrepreneurs. We hope to continue widening their horizons by making them think beyond perceived boundaries.

Every dollar raised will go towards funding the businesses of our beneficiaries in Lembang, Bandung. With your help, not only will we create impact in the community, but also groom youths potential to make a difference.

Together, we empower others, today.

Project Gazaab aims to raise a minimum of $2500 to fund the businesses of our beneficiaries. This money will go directly to exceptional and entrepreneurial students of SMK Al-Musyawarah, SMA Al-Musyawarah and SMK45 Lembang. 

Each winning group of Project Gazaab would have different business proposals, and thus different funding needed. The money raised will help the winning groups to start up and run their businesses for at least a year. 

Contributors will receive a personalized postcard written by beneficiaries to recognize the impact their kind acts have left on someone else’s lives. In addition, Gazaab Indonesia also values accountability; every contributor will receive a quarterly report of the businesses of the beneficiaries and a personal Thank-You note from each of the Gazaab member.

How can a two-week program create a long-lasting impact?

The answer lies in creating a robust support structure for the beneficiaries  as well as an experiential learning journey for members.

Project Gazaab Indonesia II is not merely a community service program, but a sustainable service-learning project that serves as a platform for beneficiaries to empower the community through entrepreneurship and for Gazaab members to learn through serving. 

Creating an impact is not enough. We want to create animpact that lasts. Through post-project monitoring programs that we are developing, beneficiaries can rely on a support structure to grow their business. 

We are working with SOS Children's Village Indonesia, a well-known international organization that provides family-based care for at-risk children, and Satoe Indonesia, a student-run organization focusing on entrepreneurship development in rural areas, to monitor the progress of our beneficiaries even after we have concluded the two-week program in December. The post-project program also acts as a channel for us to connect and consult the beneficiaries without having to be physically present on the field.

Know someone passionate about our cause? Spread the word! Share this campaign and Like our Facebook page.
