story:
Foodologyoung.eu

La piattaforma web che racconta le buone pratiche sul cibo 

in Europa. 

Fatta dai giovani per i giovani                                                    

English version down

Foodologyoung.eu è un progetto di scambio giovanile promosso dalle organizzazioni Zagreus e Geyc, supportato dal programma Erasmus+ dell’Unione Europea che si svolgerà a Cosenza dal 22 al 29 Settembre 2015 con la partecipazione attiva al progetto di 40 giovani italiani e romeni. 

L’obiettivo di Foodologyoung.eu è quello di contrastare la diffusione di abitudini alimentari scorrette tra i giovani, orientandoli verso un consumo consapevole e rispettoso della natura e della salute.

I partecipanti avranno l’opportunità di confrontarsi in un ambiente interculturale, acquisendo competenze specifiche su: regimi alimentari, permacultura e agricoltura sinergica, Gruppi di Acquisto Solidale, filiere corte e prodotti a Km 0, economia alternativa, realtà attive sul territorio in tema di recupero della biodiversità e promozione delle buone pratiche alimentari.

Le attività svolte nell’ambito del progetto saranno documentate passo dopo passo in un apposito BLOG  www.foodologyoung.eu costruito secondo le moderne tecniche del digital storytelling.


Cosa ci serve - Cosa puoi fare 

Vogliamo fare di Foodologyoung.eu un’occasione unica per promuovere il nostro territorio e per creare delle relazioni proficue tra realtà che operano nel campo dell’agricoltura sostenibile a livello locale, nazionale ed europeo. Al di là dei seminari e delle attività già in programma, infatti,  stiamo cercando di offrire ai giovani, che parteciperanno allo scambio, l’opportunità di visitare alcune delle esperienze di social and rural innovation più significative avviate in Calabria.  E tu potrai seguire queste storie in tempo reale qui su www.foodologyoung.eu. Purtroppo non disponiamo delle risorse necessarie per spostare 40 persone. Ecco perché chiediamo il tuo contributo. Anche se piccolo, è estremamente importante per noi!

Nello specifico, abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere almeno la  somma di €800,00 per poter consentire a coloro che parteciperanno al progetto di visitare le seguenti realtà:

-  Casa del Carro  - Cultural Farm in Tortora, CS 

- Orto di Famiglia  - Community vegetable garden in  San Floro, CZ 

- L'Alveare - Agrama - Social Farm in Belcastro, CZ

I contributi ricevuti saranno impiegati per noleggiare un autobus di 53 posti per l'intera giornata del 24 settembre (Tortora) e 27 settembre (San Floro e Belcastro) e per il vitto in trasferta. Con il tuo contributo non dovremo tagliare le spese relative ai collaboratori!


Perché è importante contribuire?

L’attuale scenario globale è costantemente segnato da crisi di natura economica, ambientale, umanitaria. Ciò è principalmente dovuto al persistere di un modello produttivo senza regole, incentrato sullo sfruttamento intensivo delle risorse naturali, con tutto quel che ne consegue in termini di deterioramento dell’ecosistema e perdita della biodiversità. 

La buona notizia è che negli ultimi anni, grazie alla sensibilità, alla determinazione ed all’impegno di molti, stanno prendendo sempre più piede delle alternative concrete, implementate da realtà che operano “dal basso” con l’obiettivo di costruire un modello di sviluppo che metta i  diritti dell’uomo e della natura al proprio centro.  

Anche in Calabria/Italia sono nate varie esperienze.  In tutto ciò, Foodologyoung.eu rappresenta un contributo concreto, che punta a rafforzare le reti già esistenti e a crearne di nuove, coinvolgendo attivamente le giovani generazioni. 

e inoltre ...

Contribuendo a questa campagna, sosterrai le artiste che hanno realizzato le orginali cartoline "Good food makes...". Infatti il 10% del tuo contributo andrà proprio a loro!  Arianna Sacripanti; Chiara Lamieri; Hoppipolla; Marta Gomez 
(vai in Gallery)

Le difficoltà…

Sappiamo che fare una donazione ad un progetto sconosciuto e lontano geograficamente può creare una certa diffidenza, ma tu  potrai essere con noi per tutto il percorso su www.foodologyoung.eu 

Paypal potrebbe creare qualche difficoltà...lo sappiamo. Se vuoi darci una mano ugualmente e ricevere le nostre splendide e originali cartoline, vai sul nostro sito www.foodologyoung.eu e cerca How to Help per visualizzare modalità alternative  per sostenerci!


Cosa altro puoi fare?

Il tuo supporto, di qualunque natura esso sia, è importante per noi! Anche se non puoi contribuire economicamente, puoi comunque aiutarci a promuovere il progetto e a diffondere questa campagna di raccolta fondi. Spargi in giro la voce, posta il link di questa pagina sulle tue reti sociali, giralo ai tuoi contatti e, se hai idee da proporci o voglia di partecipare attivamente, mettiti direttamente in contatto con noi!

Grazie!

Credits: Campaign realized  by Maria Scalese, Arianna Sacripanti, Fortunato Greco ,   Elisa Palermo, Marco Fama, Maria Carmela Ranieri, Alessia Scalese. Video by Gio Guggiari.   Thanks for music to Stefano Bollani, Irene Grandi and Rita Pavone
***************************************

Foodologyoung.eu

The web platform that tells good food practices in Europe. 

Made by young people for young people.  


Who we are

Foodologyoung.eu is an exchange project for young people, presented and coordinated by the Italian organization Zagreus, in collaboration with the Romanian partner GEYC and funded  by Erasmus+ program. The exchange experience, for the 40 participants, consists of an active participation to the project, which will take place in Cosenza from the 22th to the 29th September 2015. The purpose of Foodologyoung.eu is to contrast the diffusion of unhealthy food habits among the young, guiding them to an aware and respectful behaviour towards nature and health. Share best practices related to food and rural tradition and rural innovation, comparing the experiences of the countries of origin of the participants. Promote a healthy lifestyle through the awareness of alternative. Transfer young people the importance of farmers knowledge and traditions. Improve digital story telling skills of the participants. Transfer knowledge on the principles and practices of sustainable agriculture.


What We Need & What You Get

We want that Foodologyoung.eu becomes a great opportunity to promote our territories and to create a network of relationships between people and organizations working in the field of sustainable agriculture at the local, national and European level.

Beyond the seminars and activities already planned in the program, we want to give to all participants of the exchange the opportunity to visit some of the experiences of social and rural innovation most significant undertaken in Calabria. Unfortunately we haven't the resources to move 40 people. That's why we are asking your contribution, although small, it is extremely important to us!

This are some of the interesting experiences in Calabria that we want to know and to tell their stories:

-  Casa del Carro  - Cultural Farm in Tortora, CS 

- Orto di Famiglia  - Community vegetable garden in  San Floro, CZ 

- L'Alveare - Agrama - Social Farm in Belcastro, CZ


The contributions received will be used to hire a bus of 53 seats for the whole day of September 24 (Tortora) and 27 September (San Floro and Belcastro) and the food for the day. With your help we will not have to cut the Human Resources  expenses!

You can follow the stories here www.foodologyoung.eu and of course, with your contribution you will receive our original amazing postcards "Good food makes ..." made by Italian young artists. 10% of your contribution will go to their own!  Arianna Sacripanti; Chiara Lamieri; Hoppipolla; Marta Gomez.        

(visit the Gallery)



Other Ways You Can Help

Paypal may create some difficulties ... we know. If you want to help us and get our beautiful and original postcards, go to our website  www.foodologyoung.eu and visit How to Help to find alternative ways to support us!

Any kind of support is important for us! Even if you can not contribute with money, you can still help us promoting the project and spreading this fundraising campaign through your social networks. If you have any ideas to propose, or you want to participate actively, you can get directly in touch with us!

Thanks!


Credits: Campaign realized  by Maria Scalese, Arianna Sacripanti, Fortunato Greco ,   Elisa Palermo, Marco Fama, Maria Carmela Ranieri, Alessia Scalese. Video by Gio Guggiari. Thanks for music to Stefano Bollani, Irene Grandi and Rita Pavone

story:
Engola in 60 seconds: 

Help us reach our new target of $750!

What is it?

An English app to help learners of English as a foreign language study in their own time.

Why is it special?

In our experience a lot of English apps make a basic mistake: they try to teach the whole English language via your phone, which as we all know is impossible - to speak a language well you need to practice it in real life, ideally with a teacher. 

Learners can use Engola to practice exactly what they want to know: by choosing topics where they have problems or where they want to improve. It can answer these sorts of questions:

  • What is the difference between 'used to' and 'get used to'?
  • Why can't we say "much money" when we can say "not much money"?
  • How do we really use the present perfect?

It will be free to download and free to use, and learners can select any piece of grammar that is causing them problems, check the topic and practice it. If they make an error, they can click for a specific explanation for that error, meaning they can learn from their mistakes and build their knowledge.

How much money do we need to start?

$500: with this we can make a mini-app so people can try our idea.

$1000: we can make an app for iOS, Android and Windows phones to explain grammar topics for intermediate level students.

Step 1: choose what to learn

Step 2: read the explanation


Step 3: test yourself

Step 4: let Engola teach you when you make a mistake

Step 5: see your results and keep learning!

  1. Simple, clear explanations 
  2. Search by topic or by language level with all important grammar covered
  3. A specific explanation for each individual question
  4. Practice or test mode
  5. Suitable for use with a language course or self study

Ten English grammar books in one tiny app!

I'm Jonathan, and I have been teaching English for the last seven years. A few months ago I was talking with my friend Peter, a computer programmer and one of my old students, about the best way to improve your English.

Peter said that now he had reached an advanced level in English but he still had some serious problems with parts of the grammar.

"That's totally normal." 

I advised him to sit down with a big grammar book and work through all the topics where he had some problems.

“It's a lovely idea,” he said, “But I'm too busy, I don't have time.”

“Well, why don’t you use an app instead? Everybody has a few minutes in their day when they can check their phone. There must be hundreds of English language apps available.”

He asked me to recommend one, but after a lot of searching we realised there wasn't much out there which could really help students learn, at least not without spending a lot of money on it first.

What we really wanted was a free, easy-to-use English learning app with all the grammar topics you need. An app which could actually teach you as you use it, allowing you to build your knowledge over time and learn from your mistakes.

So we decided to make it:

Why we need your help

We would like to make Engola 1.0 available and free for everybody and we are therefore asking if anyone is generous enough to support us.

The basic framework is in place, now we are asking for your support so we can work with a small team of native English teachers to complete the learning materials and launch the app.

What actually is crowdfunding and how can I help?

It is a new way to help get new projects started - if someone likes an idea, they can give a little bit of money to show their support for the project. You can also share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter. You can choose from one of the perks on the right to receive a reward for your contribution.

Is Engola a business, or just for fun? 

We want to give the first version of Engola away for free. However, in the future we would ideally like to start a company, and we may offer a more comprehensive learning programme in the future for a small charge. 

We really believe Engola will be useful for English learners and teachers  all over the world - if we get the support we need we expect to be able to launch the app for free downloading  in October 2016.
You can also get an Engola T-shirt :)


Other Ways You Can Help

It's not all about money! If you like our idea, please share our content, like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter,  or even just send us a message of support - all help is greatly appreciated!

story:
The ONE Truth Bus

For those of you that are familiar with the term 'Awakening' or at least the need to awaken to the ridiculous deception and tyranny that has controlled society, against it's will for 2000 years and want to know what to do - here we are!

  • I am a Spiritual Ascended Master who has 100% Brain Use, or full knowledge and comprehension of the elements of the Universe.
  • We can answer the questions: Who am I? Where do I come from? Why am I here? and Where am i going?.
  • We have a unique team of brilliant individuals who are able and willing to teach the highest dimensions of conscious thought known to man, and ultimately how to manifest your own desired Reality, with no interference.
Too many people are just sat there, through no fault of their own, with no idea how to progress when it appears that much of Society is against you. This is why we intend to change all this, and make the Elite information available to everybody.

What We Need & What You Get

Somebody has to get this thing started so:

  • We have asked for EURO100,000 so we can buy as many functioning, habitual busses that can escort us around Europe and beyond, spreading the word of the ONE consciousness and how it is related Scientifically and Spritiually.
  • Your donation to free humanity will actually free it by it's intention
  • You will learn how you can leave your job and become anything you want, with absolutely no limit whatsoever (in line with Universal Law of Love and bestowing upon others ahead of yourself, yet receive total abundance too)

The Impact

The single problem in the world today is the divisive tactics of the 3D mind. People are raising consciousness the world over and are awakening in their multitudes. People want change, and it is going to happen. It needs humility, grace, wisdom, knowledge and intelligence. We have that. We only exist to empower you and carry no agenda whatsoever, other than to assist the return to the ONE consciousness and bring the metaphorical 'Heaven to Earth'. We are not religious - we are spiritual human. beings and this is the path of the Evolution of Creation. Evolution is Creation. We will provide the Scientific Evidence and your own material world experienced proof.

Part of the absolute truth of the highest dimensions of consciousness known to man, is that the allegorical 'Second Coming of Jesus Christ' is not only a mathematical and consciousness based secret code, it is also a Reality. This wave of increased frequency hitting us wave after wave at the moment, is leading to a Schumann Resonance of 20,8hz hitting all spiritually conscious aware over the coming weeks. So you understand, low frequencies of negative emotions, anger, hate etc (the opposite of love!) are 7,83hz. The controllers of society can only rule the 7,83hz and are unable to control or manipulate higher dimensional thought. We are currently evoluting whilst millions don't even notice. Our job is to teach you these new powers and how to use them effectively to manifest a spiritually conscious world, we get to thrive in our own produced environment.

Our group represent a group of pre-awakened spiritual masters who can assist you in every walk of life to find out what you need to, in order to live eternally in the world you wish for. We will teach you the secrets to cure all known dis-ease known to man, providing your free will allows it. Dis-ease, means disease of the consciousness. There are many things to learn, and we are here for as long as it takes to teach. The wicked deception for centuries is coming to an end. This is the Apocalypse - what does Apocalypse mean REALLY?

An apocalypse (Ancient Greek: ἀποκάλυψις apokálypsis, from ἀπό and καλύπτω meaning "uncovering"), translated literally from Greek, is a disclosure of knowledge, i.e., a lifting of the veil or revelation.

Risks & Challenges

All risks and all challenges are dictated by your own conscious thought. Our team have no barriers and have absolute knowledge of how to work with every atom in existence.
It states on here that I have 217 facebook friends - this relates to my old 3D profile, it is closer to 1000 in the New Reality that I chose when I shifted from 3D to 4D...

There are many things to learn, and we are here for as long as it takes to teach. The wicked deception for centuries is coming to an end. This is the Apocalypse - what does Apocalypse mean REALLY?An apocalypse (Ancient Greek: ἀποκάλυψις apokálypsis, from ἀπό and καλύπτω meaning "uncovering"), translated literally from Greek, is a disclosure of knowledge, i.e., a lifting of the veil or revelation.   Risks & ChallengesAll risks and all challenges are dictated by your own conscious thought. Our team have no barriers and have absolute knowledge of how to work with every atom in existence.

story:
Help us make a difference in young lives!

The Challenge

op·por·tu·ni·ty (noun)

     1:  a favorable juncture of circumstances

     2:  a good chance for advancement or progress

All children have a right to live a childhood in which they thrive, develop, are protected and participate in decisions that affect them. But for millions of children around the globe, including the children in the orphanages we work with in Indonesia, the reality of childhood is very different. Many are victims of violence or exploitation. Some have only one parent who, in desperation, sends their young child into the labor force to help put food on the table. Others have no family at all and find themselves abandoned.

For many of these children, finding a well paying job is next to impossible, as they lack the skills required. While the orphanages provide basic food, shelter and protection, our Entrepreneurship Program provides the opportunity for children to learn life skills and training to be more competitive in the job market or enable them to start their own business. Our focus is on building self-confidence, communication skills, creativity and problem solving skills.

Program Successes
 Gearing up for our third year, we have already realized many successes: 
  • Provided a financial literacy program, art classes, and a Career Day seminar to 27 teens in Denpasar from November 2013 to June 2014.
  • Developed and implemented a pilot Entrepreneurship Program to 18 youth at the Widhya Asih Orphanage in Denpasar from July 2014 to January 2015.
  • Expanded the Entrepreneurship Program to a second orphanage, engaging 47 underprivileged youth.  Program dates January 2015 – December 2015.
  • Engaged teams of more than 25 volunteers.
  • Worked with local businesses on job placement activities.
We cannot continue these programs without your help.  As members of our global society, we believe you will recognize the value of teaching these children paramount entrepreneurial and life skills that will empower them to change their own lives and those of others.

Funds Needed

The initial crowd-sourced target of US$50,000 is a key milestone toward the cumulative target total of US$92,000. This figure represents the amount needed to:

1.  Implement the 2016 Entrepreneurship Program to a target group of 50+ children

2.  Expand the scope of the 2015 Entrepreneurship Program to introduce sustainability planning and new product development to the current 47 participants

3.  Integrate critical enhancements to the Entrepreneurship Program, including:

        a.  Fully developed seminar curriculum materials
        b.  eLearning platform
        c.  Virtual classrooms capabilities

4.  Development of Job Placement & Scholarship Service:  Stella’s Child will create a network of local business that will have access to the talent pool of children that have completed the Entrepreneurship Program and have also completed High School or University studies.  This will assist the youth in securing positions with companies subscribing to the top Corporate Social Responsibility standards as well as establish the financial backing for a scholarship program for postsecondary education.

Stella's Child is a non-profit public charity recognized under U.S. IRS Code 501(c)3 [Tax ID #46-2702648].  U.S. Federal regulation requires that 75% of all contributions be used for direct program expenses.  Stella's Child strives to allocate a minimum of 85% of all contributions to direct program expenses. 

All donations are tax deductible for U.S. donors and donors in countries with reciprocal agreements with the U.S.*

In the event that fundraising is in excess of the full expenses required to fund the program, surplus funds raised online will be allocated to 2017 programs as directed by our Board of Directors. 

*NB:  Please discuss details of tax deductions with your tax adviser.

Who We Are

We are a passionate team from around the globe who volunteer our professional skills to help underprivileged children attain brighter futures. We have each been deeply moved by the intelligent and capable children we serve and are committed to inspiring and empowering these youth through providing education, training and life skills they need to lift them from their circumstances.

So many of us live such fulfilling lives full of opportunity and hope. Let us come together and give that same promise of optimism to these deserving and hard-working children. We are confident your help will help grow this program that is changing lives now and into the future.

We believe this program is a rare opportunity to break the cycle of poverty by enabling underprivileged children to get jobs or start businesses where they can earn a fair wage and support their families. Ultimately, this gives them more independent and self-sufficient lives and enables better lives for their children.

Success of the program is largely attributed to a team of volunteers locally and around the globe. But the fact is we need steady funding to continue to offer high quality, innovative and targeted programming that will continue to create new opportunities for these young people.

You can make a difference! Thank you for your generosity and support.

story:
Short Summary

In the footsteps of telethons such as Jerry Lewis's "Show of Strength" or the PBS Pledgedrive, The Chicago Nerd Comedy Festival brings you an entertainment marathon night unlike any other!

This Indiegogo is to help us raise money for 826CHI, a FANTASTIC nonprofit writing and tutoring center for children ages 6 to 18 (http://www.826chi.org/) from people who may not be able to make it out to the show on the actual night, or who would like to donate more. 826CHI (and all 826 organizations) are amazing and deserve all of the support they can get. Help us help them!

What We Need & What You Get

If you donate, no matter the amount, you will get a shoutout on the #ChiNerdFest Facebook and Twitter accounts and your name will be included in the actual festival (either in programs or posted in the actual Thrust Theatre at Stage 773). You'll also get that warm feeling you get when you know you've done good in the world. 

The Impact

From 826CHI's own website:

"When you make a contribution to 826CHI, you are directly enhancing the education of thousands of Chicago students by helping us offer them free After-School Tutoring & Writing, in-class support, hands-on learning during our Field Trip program, and creative-writing Workshops during evenings, weekends, and throughout the summer. These services are provided free to students and teachers throughout the city, and your generosity plays a vital part in making it all possible.

There are few things more rewarding than helping a student realize the value of his education or the power of her writing and voice."


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money yourself, please share this link and also the July 15th event (https://www.facebook.com/events/1631057027108648/)! If it's after the July 15th event, then just tell people about this Indiegogo or even just directly about 826CHI. Every. Single. Thing. Counts!

story:
Who I Am 

I'm Elise Paul, fifth year PhD candidate in Human Development at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York. I have long-standing interests in adolescent and child well-being. Specifically, for my dissertation I am writing three empirical papers that aim to identify early psychosocial risk processes for suicidal thinking and behavior in adolescence. The papers have direct relevance to the formulation of public mental health programming and youth suicide interventions.

Upon completing my PhD next year, my goal is to work in the area of public mental health and suicide prevention. The World Health Organization (WHO) is my first choice for future employer. However, it is very difficult to become employed there, and the vast majority of WHO employees first worked as interns. I have been offered a prestigious 3 month unpaid internship at WHO in Geneva, Switzerland, but I need your help to make it happen! 

The Project

In 2014, the  WHO released the first ever World Suicide Report (link below), which outlines the scope of the problem of suicide as well as what countries can do to reduce suicide rates. Such a document is an important step in providing support to WHO member states, but further assistance is needed to help countries with plan implementation. If I am able to raise enough money, I will be the first WHO Mental Health/Substance Abuse and Suicide Prevention intern with a background in the subject, making my contributions especially pertinent. 

Link to the WHO World Suicide Report

http://www.who.int/mental_health/suicide-prevention/en/

The Impact

  • This project will make several valuable contributions to WHO's goals of improving mental well-being and reducing suicide rates around the world. 
  • In addition to helping WHO with its goals, participating in this internship will provide me with the experience and connections that are essential for obtaining future employment in public mental health.

What I Need 

  • Since financial support for my PhD is in the form of a teaching assistantship, I will need to register in absentia for the spring semester and thus earn zero money. I need your help!
  • I need to raise $5,700 to pay for my flight (~$950), housing (~$1250 a month x 3 months = $3,750), and food ($500 per month x 3 months = $1,500) while I am in Geneva.
  • Anything you can contribute helps. Even if I don't reach my entire goal, I will still use anything that you can contribute! 

Risks & Challenges

  • Other than raising enough money, I do no foresee any challenges or risks to completing this project. My proven abilities to work independently and consistently, as well as my background in suicide prevention make me well-suited to succeed in this internship.  

  • In the link below you can find more information about my academic accomplishments, including a current Curriculum Vitae. 

    http://www.human.cornell.edu/bio.cfm?netid=ekp39

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a monetary contribution right now, please share this campaign with others!

story:
Short Summary

Peace of Thread, Inc., founded in 2012, is a non-profit (501c3) based in Clarkston, Ga., a suburb of Atlanta, that is a hub for refugee resettlement.  We have employed women from Iraq, Burma, Afghanistan, Pakistan and Somalia (read the story here). Right now, we are bursting at the seams. We are turning away women-in-need that are looking for jobs. We have just received a generous donation of industrial sewing machines, equipment and supplies. To be able to use the donation, we need a building!

  • While we have many needs, this campaign is to specifically address one key need : MORE SPACE. Currently, we are split between a space in Snellville, Ga. that houses our fabrics and a small room at an apartment complex in Clarkston that serves as a current local training center for the refugee women. After three years of watching a property on E. Ponce de Leon in Clarkston, Ga., the perfect central location we've been dreaming of has come up for rent.  We want to open a larger central training center for refugee women that will continue teach the skill of sewing and provide jobs to these vulnerable women.

  • Our hearts are moved by the refugee crisis across the world. After harrowing journeys, only a few are chosen to be relocated to the United States as refugees. When these families do land, many of them have PTSD, depression, and a whole host of other issues. Our mission is to create jobs with a peaceful environment for vulnerable women. We have being doing this for 2.5 years and we are asking for your help to to do this in the BEST way. We want to see our refugee friends become self-sufficient, without having to rely on government assistance.  As women of Peace, our purchases of Peace of Thread bags sew directly into the lives of these vulnerable woman.  The funds from these purchases provides financial assistance to educate and empower her entire family.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to move to a larger more influential location and accept this amazing donation, we need:

  • $2000 a month for rent & utilities to rent a property off of E. Ponce de Leon, in Clarkston, Ga. For this reason, we are looking to raise 1 years rent = $24,000.
  • Any money raised above and beyond our goal will go to sponsor a woman. It costs $500 to train and provider her with the proper supplies.
  • By donating, you get to partner with us to create hope and peace in the lives of these vulnerable women as they are adapting to their new lives in the United States.

The Impact

Have you stopped in front of your T.V. listening to the reports of the war in Syria? Did you read Malala's book? Do you care about ending sex trafficking?

The refugee situation in Clarkston, Ga. is no different. We as women, can be a voice for other women. 

As conflicts rage on, the refugee crisis continues to grow bigger and has become a worldwide crisis. In Clarkston, Peace of Thread is positioning itself to not just give a woman a fish but to teach her to fish for a lifetime.

You TOO can become a voice in this crises:

  • You will be a part of creating a center for vulnerable women in need
  • Your will us expand the numbers of employees
  • You can be an active part in supporting fashion that gives forward


Risks & Challenges

We've had many challenges in our journey, but feel blessed and prepared to make this move.

  • Our biggest challenge is funding for a larger space to accommodate more volunteers and vulnerable women.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can you help us share this on Facebook/Instagram with your friends? Every voice is important and we'd love your help in making some noise.
  • Tell your blogger friends about us
  • You can support a woman and purchase bag at www.peaceofthread.com or https://www.etsy.com/shop/PeaceOfThreadBags

story:
The mission of Espace OPOKO is to empower the young people of the communities of Bambama and Sibiti, in the Republic of Congo, to help them take charge of their own lives. Due to structural poverty, young people in these rural areas often don’t have role models to look up to. At ESPACE OPOKO, our tutoring programs create role models by teaching these young people life skills and academic skills that will turn them into productive members of our society.

Students from these communities, due to them having to travel a great distance to get to school, live far away from their parents. To make matters worse, they often don’t have cell phones or other means of communications to communicate with their parents. In Sibiti, many of these students don’t have family who can help them or guide them. Faced with those difficulties, many of those students drop out of school to go back home and live with their parents. This needs to change.

The lack of money and communications makes it even harder for those young students to stay in touch with their parents. When homesickness, hunger and poverty interferes with the students ability to learn, they often drop out and go back home to live with their parents. Sadly, they end up sacrificing their future and the future of our community. At ESPACE OPOKO, we believe that supporting these young students with valuable resources and sound advice is the right thing to do. It is our firm goal to ease the suffering of these students, help them to remain in school and learn valuable life skills that will make their successful tomorrow.

These are the goals of our mentoring programs:
1. Teach young people life skill that will allow them to lead productive lives as members of our community
2. Improve their grades at school
3. Reduce or eliminate dropouts caused by lack of support at school
4. Help our young people to become life learners through continuous learning and improvement
5. Create a pool of role models in the community that can assist others to solve the problem in the community
6. Create and strengthen partnership between, parents, teachers and students
7. Increase parent’s involvement in the education of their children.

story:
St. Kizito Gayaaza Primary School

I spent the summer of 2014 in a town called Masaka, Uganda. There, I worked at a local primary school, helping to develop a program which incorporated sports and fitness with English language learning.

    The aim of the program was simple: take English learning beyond the classroom. Students would play soccer, netball, and volleyball while communicating in English.

    Since the launch of the program, English exam scores are up at Gayaaza, and students are having fun, all while staying active and fit!

    Our Needs

    Gayaaza Primary School needs funding to continue to the program. It's teachers, staff, and students are some of the hardest-working people in the world, but resources at the school and the surrounding area are lacking.

    • I want to raise $1,000 to help support the school.
    • The school needs additional equipment, including balls, nets, and uniforms.
    • Additionally, the school needs funding for school-day meals, grounds maintenance, and more.
    • Even if the $1,000 goal is not met, all funds received will be disbursed to Gayaaza.

    Where Your Money Goes

    With a small donation, you could help a child stay physically active and engaged in learning.

    Funds will be transferred to Gayaaza Primary by the Foundation for Sustainable Development, a globally recognized development nonprofit, which operates in Masaka. Their team of workers will ensure not only that the funds reach Gayaaza Primary, but that there is full accountability and transparency throughout the process. There is a 15% fee for FSD services, but this is necessary given the complications of sending funds to rural Uganda.

    You can be sure that the money you give will help a child at Gayaaza Primary.


    About Me

    My name is Benjamin Jarvis. I have an MPA specializing in Nonprofit Management and International Development from Indiana University. I lived and worked in Masaka, Uganda from May to August 2014.
story_txt:
St. Kizito Gayaaza Primary School
 I spent the summer of 2014 in a town called Masaka, Uganda. There, I worked at a local primary school, helping to develop a program which incorporated sports and fitness with English language learning.  The aim of the program was simple: take English learning beyond the classroom. Students would play soccer, netball, and volleyball while communicating in English. 
Since the launch of the program, English exam scores are up at Gayaaza, and students are having fun, all while staying active and fit!  

Our Needs
Gayaaza Primary School needs funding to continue to the program. It's teachers, 
staff, and students are some of the hardest-working people in the world,
 but resources at the school and the surrounding area are lacking. 

I want to raise $1,000 to help support the school. 
The school needs additional equipment, including balls, nets, and uniforms. 

Additionally, the school needs funding for school-day meals, grounds maintenance, and more.

Even if the $1,000 goal is not met, all funds received will be disbursed to Gayaaza.



Where Your Money Goes
With a small donation, you could help a child stay physically active and engaged in learning.Funds will be transferred to Gayaaza Primary by the Foundation for Sustainable Development, a globally recognized development nonprofit, which operates in Masaka. Their team of workers will ensure not only that the funds reach Gayaaza Primary, but that there is full accountability and transparency throughout the process. There is a 15% fee for FSD services, but this is necessary given the complications of sending funds to rural Uganda.You can be sure that the money you give will help a child at Gayaaza Primary.

About Me

My name is Benjamin Jarvis. I have an MPA specializing in Nonprofit Management and International Development from Indiana University. I lived and worked in Masaka, Uganda from May to August 2014.

story:
The Founder/Director


Joe L Brown has been a youth pastor for 35 years, husband of one wife for 30 years, father for 24 years, and founded the Christian Youth Film Society 21 years ago. Brown recently answered God's call to lead the Christian Youth Film Society full-time. "After all these years of teaching kids to walk in faith - trust God - obey His Word; now I get to practice what I preach!" says Brown. "It's quite scary to leave a 35 year career as a church youth pastor and step into the unfamiliar world of building a non-profit. But it's also really exciting to see God's plan unfold before my eyes and know He loves me enough to grow my faith."

  • Movieguide’s 2014 Report to the Entertainment Industry indicates that the public overwhelmingly prefers to see movies with positive Christian content and values. According to Movieguide's 10-year study (2003-2012) of all major movies released by Hollywood, movies with very strong Christian worldviews averaged $73 million in revenues, but movies with very strong Non-Christian worldviews averaged only $21 million.
  • Young people are inherently creative and want to tell compelling stories. Our Festivals, Film Camps, workshops, and events help guide young filmmakers and celebrate their gifts and talents. We help students learn to stand strong in their faith and values while telling faith-filled stories with excellence.
  • Your donations will help us continue serving young people, discovering and developing their talents, influencing their culture, and bringing light into the film industry and community.

The Need

The Christian Youth Film Society has gotten bigger than I ever imagined. I believe God has called me to lead the ministry full-time. Many friends and family affirmed this decision, so I left my cushy and lucrative job as Youth Pastor and stepped out in faith that God would provide. I still get to work with youth, focusing on a specific field where there's great need and great potential. The film industry needs strong Christian missionaries to bring the light of Christ. We encourage talented young people who are called by God to take the faith into a career in film.
As God guides, He provides. Will you allow Him to provide through you? Here are a few points of need:
  • The Festivals require staff, venue rental, awards, promotion, and technicians.
  • Workshops, Events, and Film Camps need staff, promotion, venue, materials, mentors, and equipment.
  • Film Camps in Youth Correctional Facilities will be offered free of tuition, and also need staff, materials, mentors, and equipment.
  • Overall operating costs include staff, equipment, office, communications, insurance, travel, education, and promotions.
  • Our team is careful to use resources wisely as good stewards of all God has entrusted to us.

The Perks

    We want you to donate. We want you to pray. But we also want you to have fun while giving and praying for this great ministry. So we've gathered some fun items and experiences to perk up your donation:
    1. $1 - GO FACEBOOK Send us a photo of yourself and we'll post it in the "Backers" album of our FaceBook page and website. We'll pray for you and let the whole world know how much we love you!
    2. $5 - STICK AROUND We'll send you a beautiful, official sticker that would look really cool on your car window.

    3. $10 - POSTER In addition to the getting your photo on our FaceBook page and a sticker, you'll get an awesome 11in. x 17in. Festival 2016 poster for your wall.
    4. $20 - AUTOGRAPHED POSTER Get the awesome 11x17 Festival 2016 poster but also with autographs from a few young filmmakers who just may be famous someday! Of course, you'll also get items 1-2.
    5. $30 - FLASH DRIVE Get all the above items plus an 8G CYFS flash drive loaded with award-winning movies from previous Festivals.


    6. $50 - COOLER BAG A genuine, limited, custom cooler bag with four stickers because you're cool, and we want to thank you for sticking with us! Plus you'll get the above items 1-5.

    7. $70 - T-SHIRT You'll get all the above plus you can rock the coolest shirt ever and represent CYFS. Logo on left chest, "Making Movie Makers" on left sleeve, and "CREW" on back because you'll be part of our awesome support crew!

    8. $80 - CREDITS Now it's getting real, so in addition to all the above (items 1-7), you'll get Associate Producer credit on our website and in our next promo video!

    9. $125 - VIP It's totally cool to walk up to the front door and say nonchalantly, "I'm on the list." At this level you get two VIP Passes to attend the 2016 Christian Youth Film Festival as our very special guests with popcorn, drinks, and early access to walk the red carpet. Plus you'll also get items 1-7.

    10. $150 - FILM CAMP You'll get to attend one of our Bakersfield Film Camps. Learn from Hollywood pros how to make a movie from script to screen. Plus you'll get items 1-7.

    11. $175 - CAMP SHIRT This patterned Port Authority shirt is otherwise reserved for the directors on our board. But at this level you'll get to wear it without being bored! Plus you'll get items 1-6.

    12. $350 - EXTRA We love you so much right now we want you in a movie! We'll arrange for you (or a photo of you if you can't come to a shoot) to appear as an "extra" in one of the student movies! Plus you'll get items 1-8.

    13. $500 - ACTING This is your chance for a big break! Study at the feet of the gifted acting coach Clay Banks for three sessions in Hollywood, California. Plus items 1-8!

    14. $650 - LIFE GUEST You my friend are a true believer! So we're going to give you two lifetime general admission tickets to all future Film Festivals, forever! Includes generous snack bar credit plus items 1-8!

    15. $1,200 - LIFE VIP You'll get two lifetime VIP passes that include the exclusive FOX Theater backstage dinners at each Festival. Plus items 1-8!

    16. $2,500 - DWTS That's DINNER with the stars! You and a guest are invited to join us in Hollywood for an intimate and delicious dinner with Bobby Downes, Kevin Downes, Dean Batali, or Jim and Dawn O'Keeffe. Plus you'll get items 1-8. (We'll arrange the dinner date and provide luxury ground transportation from Bakersfield area to Hollywood.)

    17. $5,000 - YOSEMITE Two days and nights at the home of industry legends Coleman and Carel Luck and a day in Yosemite National Park. You'll get to enjoy beautiful country, brilliant conversations, and needed relaxation. (We will provide ground transportation from Bakersfield area to the Yosemite area.)


    18. $7,500 - NAME IT Your generosity knows no bounds! Choose anything you want from our list of perks items 1-12. We'll shout your name from the rooftops or we'll keep you somewhat anonymous if you'd like. Either way you'll have our deepest gratitude!

    19. $10,000 - YOUR TOWN This one hits close to home, literally! Since you love this ministry so much and want to encourage more young filmmakers, we'll work with you to develop a Christian Youth Film Festival in your area. This will take lots of work so get ready to roll up your sleeves with us.

    The Impact

    The Christian Youth Film Society is making a difference. Many of our students have entered film schools and universities. Many have pursued careers in the industry. Many have become media ministers in their churches. This program works!

    • Young people are challenged and equipped to stand strong in their faith in the face of darkness and attack.
    • Our graduates are working in the industry, bringing hope and truth, influencing key decision-makers and creative professionals.
    • With your help and as God leads, we plan to take the film camps and festivals to other cities and countries.

    The Risks

    It takes much time and dedication to work with youth. Our Executive Director, Joe Brown, needs adequate salary and benefits to stay connected and influential in the film industry, church ministries, and youth culture. He's proven his dedication and effectiveness through 35 years of successful youth ministry while building the Christian Youth Film Society. Now, as God has called him to lead the CYFS full-time, he will work diligently to build a strong financial and prayer support base through presentations, grant writing, and sponsor cultivation.

      The Help

      There's more than one way to help. Not everyone can contribute financially. But everyone can pray and share. Please let others know using the Indiegogo share tools. Please pray for wise stewardship, effective ministry, and faithful service. And please call, write, text, beat a drum, send smoke signals, or otherwise contact us and let us know how we can serve you too. Thanks a million, and God bless you!

story:
Hello I'm Clyde! I'm a changemaker, a scholar student of international relations, NGO volunteer, musician and videomaker. My dream is to start an NGO to connect the world for third world society like Philippines.


Since 2010, I work as a volunteer of social projects.


Through NGO-sponsored trips, I have successfully collaborated with organizations in Europe to bridge global ideas for our third-world society.


Despite no funds, I had a successful "global idea" task, I was assigned as project manager for Europe-Philippine Teacher internship program last August 2014. My intern was Simon from Germany.


Due to my consistent social involvement and intercultural activities, I was selected by the government to represent Philippines as a youth goodwill ambassador of Japan in Tokyo last May 2014.


And I'm not rich, my trips are sponsored, and my projects are not paid because it's voluntary work. 

I do it for passion. That's why I need your help.


I would like to have a headquarters/hub in Manila for project development, brainstorming, media production, and to welcome foreigners where they can sit and share ideas, know more about Philippines and meet good Filipinos.

And I need your support because I'm still a student, I can't afford the expenses.

The funds shall be allocated for

  • Office/headquarters rental fee
  • Equipment
  • Media production (langauges, social project coverage)
  • Website
  • Government registration
  • Budget for projects (we have 5 projects ongoing)
  • Ideas implementation

The headquarters will be strategically located in Manila (safe and near university). Available to foreigners visiting Philippines. This will help us to learn a wide range of global perspective for our projects and cooperate with international community helping the locals.

story:
Trans Women of Color Speak out in Phoenix

Phoenix based transgender woman of color advocate Monica Jones is planning a panel discussion and event to highlight the injustices faced by members of her community in Arizona and to be inspired by the leadership of advocates such as Lourdes Ashley Hunter (the Trans Women of Color Collective) and Miss Major Griffin-Gracey (the executive director of the San Francisco-based Transgender Gender Variant Intersex Justice Project). The event will take place in Spring 2016 in Phoenix, Arizona and will include a remembrance of Kandis Capri, a transgender woman murdered in August 2015. The event will raise the profile of the rights of transgender women in Arizona and contribute to call for change and justice.

Monica Jones garnered national and international attention when she challenged her arrest by Project ROSE under the discriminatory "intent to manifest  prostitution" statute. The charges against Monica were dropped after years of struggle, including multiple court appearances and pressure at the global level at the United Nations. However, Monica was an advocate for her community long before this arrest and has continued building campaigns for transgender rights since her victory in own case. Specifically, Monica has been deeply involved organizing regarding the death of Kandis Capri and in advocating for the rights of trans communities and sex workers at the United Nations.

What We Need & What You Get

Monica has researched local sources of funding to host the event and panel but many institutions she could potentially call on have already been affected by policing and harsh policies against the transgender community in Phoenix. She is seeking to raise $5000 which will cover travel costs for her speakers and event fees for a venue and other elements to make the event open and welcoming to the community.

Our perks include:

  • t-shirts from the Best Practices Policy Project, from Monica Jones own campaign "Real Feminists support Transwomen of Color and Sex Workers" and hard to find "Stand with Monica" tees;
  • films by leading advocate filmmakers (such as A KISS FOR GABRIELA) and books from transgender authors;
  • postcards and stickers;
  • and much more to come!

Donations are tax deductible , minus the value of the perk. This would be the ideal time to lower your tax bill in 2016 and support what you believe in. Thanks to Best Practices Policy Project for helping us with non-profit support.


The Impact

Leadership by transgender women of color has been growing nationally and this event will connect the transgender community of Phoenix to national organizing. Audiences in Phoenix will be inspired by the presence of transgender leaders from some of the most important campaigns for rights nationwide.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in Phoenix we encourage you to attend the event in 2016 and share the word. If you have some art works or other perks that would help the campaign we would love to include this. And please everyone stay strong in your commitment to the leadership of transgender women of color nationwide and globally. Our updates will also provide ideas on how you can support other leaders of color from the transgender communities.

story:
Ms. Frances

For more than 30 years, Ms. Frances has been a long-standing contributor to the Capitol Hill community, educating young children with her guidance and expertise. 

The Capitol Hill Cooperative Nursery School (CHCNS), also known as, “Simply Ms. Frances,” continues to thrive under her tireless leadership.  We are asking for support from our loyal alumni family to meet our fundraising goal by the end of May.

We have engaged in a number of fundraising efforts since September, but we need your help in reaching our $10,000 goal this spring. This goal will guarantee our commitment to Ms. Frances’ retirement fund and ensure the solvency of this valuable program for future years. Will you help us today?  

No amount is too small, and every amount is appreciated. CHCNS is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization fully licensed by the District of Columbia, and all donations are tax deductible. 

Thank you for helping us to educate our youngest generation on Capitol Hill.

story:
Welcome to the world of studying smarter, not harder!

You have entered an area where Study Smart is the name... and it is also, the game.

We are here to improve students' study habits in a vibrant, educational way!
We have successfully secured a backer who is ensuring the Study Smart Board game will be out in schools and homes by May 2016. The biggest thanks to Noel from the New South Wales Parent Council for your vision to have a board game in every one of your 300 schools.

However, we thought we would take it another step further... by taking the player components online!
This will be great for students who have challenges with writing, reading and maths as it will allow them to use a dropdown menu to choose options rather than write or calculate by hand. We have seen mock ups in action working fabulously with dyslexic students and slow processors.

Here is a sneak preview - all 8 seconds of it!) of the board on the printing press... And check out Updates and Gallery for more production previews!

Our aim is now to get a board game into every school in New Zealand and Australia plus as many homes as we can. Then the world!

But wait - if you don't know me, my team and what we have already successfully created, keep reading. (If you do know and would like to see the extras we are hoping to provide please scroll down to the green-blue headings - with another $2000 we can ensure students with learning challenges can play the game online and benefit from the ideas and tips)


Study Smart is a game of life and skill and can be played at home or in school.  It has been designed especially for secondary and tertiary students looking to improve grades and exam results. Study Smart teaches you how to study, with both life skills and learning skills. It teaches you how to communicate effectively, how to wait for your turn in life and how to win and lose. Not only is it a great family activity, it teaches you and your kids excellent skills that they need in order to pass their exams with flying colours.

The board game encompasses memory skills and strategies, tips on how to learn, how to set up a study environment that works, tips on exams, how to get motivated and, perhaps most importantly, what not to do, in the form of Uh-Oh cards. The idea is to teach you how to study smarter rather than harder. Exams are not meant to make a nervous wreck out of you, they are meant to push you forward in life with confidence.

All around the world teachers ask students to “go home and study” however they do not tell them how. Our mission is to ensure every student knows how to study smart to pass their exams. 

I’m Karen Boyes, designer & facilitator of the Study Smart workshops and webinars. I have previous designed an app: iStudyAlarm which students throughout the world are using to assist them in their study and keep them focused and on task. I have produced two rap songs, mini study videos and 2 books; 27 Study Tips for Success (now on it’s 12th reprint) and Study Smart e-book.  I have spent 21 years researching and refining my knowledge of how the brain learns and remembers and have presented this information in 18 countries.

Several years ago I started developing this game for students to learn how to study. It had been sitting on my shelf and I last year I pulled it out to play with students. They loved it. Not only were they engaged and focused while playing - they also were learning how to study, and practising all those ‘old fashion’ skills of taking turns, discussing, co-operating and being social. 

I see this game being used in classrooms - teachers might use it for study classes, form classes, wet lunchtimes and as a full on instruction on study skills - without the teacher needing any in-depth knowledge of neurology or brain functioning (the foundation of the tips within the game.)

This game will also be great in family homes, playing together as a family. Not only to teach the ideas for the students, it will give parents the confidence to know how to help their students at home. 




The object of the game is to get the highest marks in all of your subjects. 

So how does the game work? Each player is issued with a player profile. This states their current subjects, grades and the target to become an A+ student. Each player takes turns to move around the board and lands on one of 6 options; Learning Styles, Memory Strategies, Motivation, Study Tips, Study Environment and Uh-Oh’s. 

They then pick the corresponding card from the centre of the board, read it aloud so all players have the benefit of learning the tip. Each card has a tip and how many subject the players marks will increase if they use the tip. They then spin the spinner to find out how many marks they may increase. The player then adjusts their grades accordingly and also must record 3 tips from each category on their master sheet. The winner is the person that has an A+ grade for each subject and 15 tips (3 in each area) recorded on their player sheet.


In the Box:

  • The Game Board
  • 15 Study Tips Cards
  • 15 Environment Cards
  • 15 Memory Cards
  • 15 Learning Style Cards
  • 15 Motivation Cards
  • 15 Uh-Oh Cards
  • 6   Player tokens
  • 14 Player profiles
  • 1   Die
  • 1   Spinner
  • 6   Pencils
  • 1   Pad of Player Sheets 


Our original goal was to fund the making of the game - and with the NSW Parent Association's support, we have done that! The game is now currently at the printers! Now we have new goals in place to increase students' abilities to study smart (see below for our exciting stretch goals!)
Did you see the video above? Click here to watch...



Now we have some NEW stretch goals:

1. Create an online player sheet. This is great for students who have challenges with writing, reading and maths as it will allow them to use a dropdown menu to choose options rather than write or calculate by hand. I have already seen a mock up working fabulously with dyslexic students and slow processors.

The online player sheet can also be used to speed up the game. The concept of the game is to learn the tips and strategies.

2. Have a game in every school. With over 300 games all ready going into NSW schools, our goal is to have a game in every intermediate, junior high and secondary school in New Zealand and Australia. Please help us by pledging to buying or donating games to a school. 


The rules are simple to follow. The goal of each player is to become an A+ student with 15 individual study tips recorded on their game sheet. 
Quick Start Rules:
1.  Place Study Tips, Learning Styles, Motivation, Exams, Memory and UH-OH! cards on the board.

2.  Sit the Study Smart spinner in the centre of the board.
3.  Distribute the player sheet (A4 Page) to each player.
4.  Have each player collect a playing piece and deal one Study Smart profile card to each player.
5.  Transfer all details from the Study Smart profile card to your playing sheet.
6.  Roll dice to see who goes first
7.  Start playing Study Smart.

Remember…
·  To win the game you have to increase your marks to 85% in each subject and have 3 tips recorded in each area on your player sheet.
·  Read cards out loud so every player can learn the tips.


We are based in New Zealand - Down under - a land of beauty, grandeur and the most expensive postage in the world! We are looking at alternative shipping for the games as with all the cards, pieces and the board, the game will weigh approximately 1.8kgs. We are exploring sending a bulk shipment to hubs around the world and having them shipped from there. We already have an Australian distributor ready to go!

All orders within New Zealand will be couriered for $8.50 per game
Australian orders are estimated at $8.50 per game
Asian countries are estimated at $50 per game
USA & UK orders are estimated at $50 per game

For other areas please message us for a quote.


The Study Smart Board game has been tested with over 300 students of all ages and abilities. Here is some of the feedback from students and teachers...


"This game was so much fun - I learned so much - I can't wait to try out the tips in my next assignment." 14 year old student

"Great learning tips and easy to understand." 16 year old student

"Truly -I didn't want to play - however once I started I could not stop - I just had to find out all the tips - they are fantastic!" K. Miller aged 12

“…all the girls gave the game an ‘excellent’ rating and all would recommend it to future senior students!”  Mary Field-Dodgson, Careers Adviser, St Catherine’s College, Wellington

"I was first introduced to Karen Boyes' Study Tips and hints way back in 2001 while at High School and what a difference it made! I learned how to get organised with my study - using colour to engage my brain, breaks every 20 minutes, how to get motivated etc. I continue to use these tips almost 15 years later. I am now a teacher myself and on the verge of finishing my Masters, Karen Boyes is part of that success!! Her tips work!!" Katherine Sullivan

"These tips will have an impact on my daughter's entire life with regards to how to study. You have made it easy, clear, well structured. " Daniella, Mum of 14 year old


Recent Radio Interview: To learn about the MOST important study tip - please  click here to hear Karen being interviewed by Time Management specialist Robyn Pearce. 




Everybody needs to know how to learn effectively and how to study without getting stressed out. At the end of the day all an exam is, is a test of your memory. If you can learn how to memorise information effectively, you can pass your exams with ease. 

Please tell people about me, about what I am trying to do. Spread the word amongst your friends, your social media followers, anyone you know. Point them in the direction of my websites so they can get to know me and find out what I’m all about and, if there is still any doubt about my abilities to make this work, point them in the direction of the books I have written and the app I developed: 
• Creating An Effective Learning Environment
• 27 Study Tips for Success 
• The Ultimate Study Pack & Study Smart Flip book
• iStudyAlarm app 

Whatever you can do to help is greatly appreciated and I thank you, from the bottom of my heart.
story_txt:
Welcome to the world of studying smarter, not harder!You have entered an area where Study Smart is the name... and it is also, the game.We are here to improve students' study habits in a vibrant, educational way!We have successfully secured a backer who is ensuring the Study Smart Board game will be out in schools and homes by May 2016. The biggest thanks to Noel from the New South Wales Parent Council for your vision to have a board game in every one of your 300 schools.However, we thought we would take it another step further... by taking the player components online! This will be great for students who have challenges with writing, reading and maths as it will allow them to use a dropdown menu to choose options rather than write or calculate by hand. We have seen mock ups in action working fabulously with dyslexic students and slow processors.


Here is a sneak preview - all 8 seconds of it!) of the board on the printing press... And check out Updates and Gallery for more production previews!

Our aim is now to get a board game into every school in New Zealand and Australia plus as many homes as we can. Then the world!
But wait - if you don't know me, my team and what we have already successfully created, keep reading. (If you do know and would like to see the extras we are hoping to provide please scroll down to the green-blue headings - with another $2000 we can ensure students with learning challenges can play the game online and benefit from the ideas and tips)



Study Smart is a game of life and
skill and can be played at home or in school.  It has been designed
especially for secondary and tertiary students looking to improve grades and
exam results. Study Smart teaches you how to study, with both life skills and
learning skills. It teaches you how to communicate effectively, how to wait for
your turn in life and how to win and lose. Not only is it a great family
activity, it teaches you and your kids excellent skills that they need in order
to pass their exams with flying colours.
The board game encompasses memory
skills and strategies, tips on how to learn, how to set up a study environment
that works, tips on exams, how to get motivated and, perhaps most importantly,
what not to do, in the form of Uh-Oh cards. The idea is to teach you how to
study smarter rather than harder. Exams are not meant to make a nervous wreck
out of you, they are meant to push you forward in life with confidence.

All around the world teachers ask students to “go home and study” however they do not tell them how. Our mission is to ensure every student knows how to study smart to pass their exams. 


I’m Karen Boyes, designer & facilitator of the Study Smart workshops and webinars. I have previous designed an app: iStudyAlarm which students throughout the world are using to assist them in their study and keep them focused and on task. I have produced two rap songs, mini study videos and 2 books; 27 Study Tips for Success (now on it’s 12th reprint) and Study Smart e-book.  I have spent 21 years researching and refining my knowledge of how the brain learns and remembers and have presented this information in 18 countries.Several years ago I started developing this game for students to learn how to study. It had been sitting on my shelf and I last year I pulled it out to play with students. They loved it. story:
The big problem

Aren't you tired of cellular phones (smart or otherwise) that spy on you? Did you know that with almost all "modern" phones a skilled hacker or an overzealous government can hack into your phone over the air and not only siphon off all of your contact lists and pictures and what have you, but also surreptitiously turn on the microphone - without you ever knowing it - and listen in on whatever is happening at your dinner table, in your living room, in your bedroom or wherever your phone happens to be when, as far as you know, it's just sitting idle? These same spying phones also actively volunteer your exact GPS location (much more precise than needed for cellular network operation) to any hacker or governmental entity who knows how to request it - and there is absolutely no way to disable this self-incrimination feature.

The reason why these corporate-made phones are able to betray the interests of the end user and serve someone else's interest instead is because they run proprietary software, also known as firmware. Proprietary software is software that is owned and controlled by someone other than its user, with the user being denied the ability to understand how it works, let alone modify or improve it.

A better way

Over the past decade a few small companies and community initiatives have tried to fix the problem of phones running proprietary software that works against the user. But only one of them got it right: Openmoko. The original Openmoko GTA01 and GTA02 phones whose production ended in 2009 had a vitally important user freedom and empowerment feature which is completely missing in all of the more recent projects and designs: a baseband processor that can run free software (firmware) instead of the proprietary kind.

Many community long-timers are familiar with the word "baseband", and cringe upon hearing it. The so-called baseband processor, also known as the modem or the radio processor, is the part of every cellular phone (smart or otherwise) that is responsible for connecting to the cellular network and making the device work as a phone. The reason why a lot of us cringe at hearing that word is because traditionally these cellular basebands have been the bastion of closedness and proprietary software. In every phone that has ever been made to the present day with the single exception of Openmoko GTA01/02, the baseband is the most closed and proprietary component, the component whose internal operation the user is absolutely forbidden from understanding, let alone improving. It is also naturally the component that is ideally suited for the insertion of privacy-violating backdoors by various shady entities.

The reason why Openmoko's baseband is so special and so different is because it was built using chips from Texas Instruments, as opposed to Qualcomm or Mediatek. The latter two companies are the ones that make the baseband processor chips used in virtually all mainstream phones made today. The prospects for being able to run free software (the kind of software that protects and empowers you instead of spying or otherwise working against you) on chips made by Qualcomm or Mediatek (and thus on any phone built with those chips) are extremely bleak: absolutely no technical documentation for the workings of these chips is available to mere mortals, and even if we got our own free firmware image built, the chip will most likely refuse to run it by way of its cryptographically locked bootloader.

But the older baseband chips from TI that were used by Openmoko are different in two major ways:

  1. These chips were made before cryptographically locked bootloaders were invented, hence they lack this malicious feature;
  2. Through what may have been an act of divine intervention - we may never know - we, the free software community, now possess all technical documentation that is necessary in order to run our own free software on these GSM baseband chips from TI, 100% complete - and we even have the full source code for TI's official firmware to use as a reference. (All materials in question are gathered on our FTP site.)

While Openmoko, back in the days when they existed as a company and produced phones, shipped their phones with an official baseband firmware version that was just as proprietary as any other, they did so only because of legal restrictions, and any end user can very easily replace this proprietary baseband firmware with a free version.

The problem WE need to solve

What Openmoko produced in the late 2000s seems like the perfect solution to the problem of closed proprietary phones with closed proprietary basebands - but there is one problem with this solution. The problem is that Openmoko phones are no longer made: the last production batch was in 2009, and all remaining surplus has now been fully exhausted - and none of the newer post-Openmoko initiatives have retained the feature that matters, Openmoko's Calypso modem.

The solution to THIS problem is obvious: we need to produce a series of new phones with the same TI Calypso baseband as used by Openmoko, the only cellular baseband chipset that currently exists in the world that can run fully free, fully functional firmware as opposed to the closed and proprietary kind. (The chips themselves are still available as surplus on the Chinese markets in very large quantities.)

What we are doing

Our long-term goal is to produce an entire family of GSM phone/modem devices that are based on the Calypso chipset and thus can run free firmware. (In fact, free is the only kind of firmware that will ever exist for our devices - no proprietary firmware is possible, as we are buying the chips on the surplus market and NOT entering into any NDAs with anyone.) The devices we envision producing include:

  • A basic non-smart phone for those who dislike smartphones, yearn for a simpler phone that is specifically designed for talking to human beings rather than data, but wish to be free from proprietary software and from being spied upon.
  • A free-software baseband modem module that can be incorporated into free-software smartphone designs by other teams.
  • A standalone GSM/GPRS modem (with additional sweet capabilities like CSD) for use with laptops, with either USB or plain old serial interface.

But we need to start small. Right now we are working toward building our first proof-of-concept modem prototype, which will simply be the modem section of Openmoko's GTA02 phone extracted and separated from the rest of the design and built on a board by itself. It'll be powered from a lab bench power supply emulating the battery and both Calypso UARTs (interfaces for programming, control and data) will be brought out on headers.

We seek to replace Openmoko's triband radio front-end with a quadband one (making a GSM device anything less than quadband means that someone would have to be excluded, and we do not wish to exclude anyone), and this prototype board we currently seek to build will allow us to validate and prove our quadband design before we reuse it as a building block for more complex hardware designs approaching a final product.

We are a non-profit organization (although unfortunately not officially recognized as such yet), and we do not believe in the doctrine of "intellectual property". Absolutely everything we have produced in the past and will produce in the future, including the present family of projects, is in the public domain, free for anyone in the world to use as they see fit without asking us for permission. We apply this principle not only to software, but also to hardware: all design work is being done in public source repositories, and whenever we have a board design ready to be physically produced, we release the finished schematics, BOM, gerber files and editable PCB sources into the public domain via our FTP site. In other words, we create a ready-to-build design, but absolutely do not mind if someone else takes our work and runs with it into commercial production. We want you to "pirate" our work!

Free firmware choices

The Free Software community greatly values diversity and freedom of choice, and free firmware for phones with Calypso baseband processors is no exception. At the present time there is not just one but two independent free software projects seeking to produce fully free and fully functional GSM baseband firmware that can replace the proprietary kind: one is our own FreeCalypso and the other is OsmocomBB. The two free firmware projects have somewhat different focus: OsmocomBB focuses on facilitating GSM hacking and security research, whereas our own FreeCalypso project seeks to produce free firmware for everyday use by ordinary end users.

When we build our own Calypso phones and modems that will run free firmware on the baseband processor, the choice of which free firmware to run remains with the user. While we naturally promote and support our own implementation, there will never be any obstacle to running OsmocomBB (or any other free firmware implementation that may appear in the future) on our hardware.

Our qualifications

The principal developer behind this project has been working toward the goal of a cellular phone free from proprietary software since 2011. Between 2011 and 2013 I gathered (through painstaking and meticulous scavenging) the most critical parts of our extensive collection of hardware documentation and reference source code that is now amassed on our FTP site (it never stops growing though), and since 2013 I've been working on the free firmware project linked above.

But software/firmware work alone can only take us so far: now that the supply of pre-existing phones with the Calypso baseband chipset has been exhausted, it is time for us to build our own hardware with this chipset in order for the world at large to be able to benefit from our work.

In the case of Open Source Hardware development, my experience is that I have designed and built my own SDSL modem that serves my own Internet connection; you can read about that project, download all related design files (released free to the world as always) and see pictures of the gadget here. Thus I consider myself as qualified as anyone else for the job of building phones and modems with a free Calypso baseband.

What we need money for

Our modem design will be based on the one in Openmoko's GTA02 phones. More specifically, we are copying many important aspects from Openmoko's original PCB layout. When we started this crowdfunding campaign at the beginning of April, Openmoko's original PCB layout files seemed to have been irretrievably lost. However, on April 10 we were very pleasantly surprised by Mr. Sean Moss-Pultz, the original founder of Openmoko, who was able to dig up a surviving copy of these files!

Had these PCB layout files not been found, we would have had to recover the layout by reverse engineering (slicing a sacrificial board to reveal and image its inner layers), and that venture would have cost us about $6000. Coming up with a way to cover that high cost was the original reason why we started this crowdfunding campaign, and that cost is what our goal figure has been based on.

However, now that we have recovered the original PCB layout files and don't need to spend $6k on reverse engineering, the campaign goal figure no longer has any significance. Whatever amount we manage to raise, be it small or large, will be used to help the project team - our core team members are currently having a very hard time, and the hardship is expected to last several months. It is very difficult to work on a free software or hardware design project while struggling to survive, so by helping the humans behind the project, you will be helping the project itself.
