story:
Your contribution can make a lot of difference. Help us continue the work of supporting and encouraging our community to live active lifestyles. You can be a part of making these projects successful. 

The Projects...

  1. Bike Shelters at Blue Heron School in Port Townsend and Chimacum Creek Primary School (Materials: $12,350)

These shelters are a community-wide effort and will provide a safe and dry place for students to store their bicycles so they will ride more often. Neither school has any covered outdoor space, so those who walk will soon have a place to wait out of the rain. We received a $2,500 grant through WSU from an Oregon State University obesity prevention project called GROW HKC (Healthy Kids and Communities) but need much more. Construction started in mid April at Blue Heron and we have over $10,000 of design, engineering, excavation, concrete, labor and miscellaneous labor and hardware donated by dozens of businesses and volunteers. The ribbon cutting ceremony will be Friday, May 1stat 2:30pm, a wonderful kick-off for National Bike Month. The Chimacum Bike Shelter will hopefully start in early summer, depending on fundraising.

Conceptual design by Terrapin Architects


2.  Bike Repair Station  (Materials & Labor: $2,200)

Many of us have needed a little extra air or wanted to tighten up a bolt on our bike when all the bike shops were closed or out of reach. Once we’ve built and installed our custom bike repair station, anyone with a bike in need will have 24/7 access to the tools they need to keep their bike going. This bike repair station is custom made for Port Townsend and will be located on a busy bike commute route, where anyone can use it.


3.  Mountain Bike Skills park (Design & Planning: $4,000)

How can we create hours of fun, training and exercise for people of all ages and skill levels? What project has the potential to bring many different types of people from various backgrounds together to build something that promotes active lifestyles? A bike park of course! We already have a concept design with public input and a civil engineer. We are exploring a possible location in Port Townsend with the City and other non-profit groups. With seed money we will be able to complete the preliminary design process, get more community input and support, and then apply for larger construction grants on the state and national levels.


4.  Bike Programs for Kids and National Bike Month Promotion (Materials & Labor: $1,450)

For the past two years, we have educated over 300 kids in two school districts how to ride safely. Without our training, these students would not know how to signal properly, negotiate intersections, and ride on the right side of the road. With your donation, we can continue running classes in the Port Townsend and Chimacum School Districts. Help us work towards making bike ed a permanent part of our local school systems. 

Help build a stockpile of promotional banners, posters, and other media that we can use year after year so everyone knows that May is National Bike Month. We’ll work with others to coordinate and promote bike to school day, bike to work week, and other activities that encourage our community to cycle now and then into the summer. Let’s support even the most timid of cyclists to put as much time as they can on their saddle during the month of May. 


Who We Are…

We are the Jefferson County ReCyclery with a mission to promote bicycle use for a healthier and more sustainable community. We are a 501(c3) non-profit organization in Port Townsend, WA. We run numerous programs throughout the year including our Saturday Community Shop Day, where members can work on their own bikes with professional supervision. We hold bike education and safety programs in 2 school districts using a fleet of 60 bikes of different sizes for middle school students. We allow those who volunteer for 25 hours in the shop to then build their own bike with used parts in our Earn- a- Bike program. We are a full service bike shop with rentals and bikes to borrow as well. We keep anything useful from old bikes for reuse and OUT of the landfill. We offer Women’s Bike Nights in order to get women more involved in biking.

Our Summer Youth Apprenticeships offer young people a $200 stipend while they get an employment experience with responsibility in a bike shop, learn how to repair bikes, and get inspired to motivate other students to ride more often. Visit us on our website at www.ptrecyclery.org.

Risks and Challenges...

All of these projects are crucial for the health of our youth, our community and the environment. They all require money and as a small non-profit in a small community with lots of other worthy causes, raising money is often a challenge. We have supporters who are willing to lend money at no interest if we need it for cash flow, but we would rather not do that. If we do need temporary loans, we still need to be able to pay them off. Please donate – SOON! We have eager volunteers but we especially need more money for materials.

Other Ways You Can Help…

1. Tell your friends about this campaign. Use Twitter, Facebook or just regular email! Post a link with our indiegogo campaign embedded in your post.

2. Help us find unused bikes so we can refurbish them and provide low-cost bikes.

3. Volunteer at the shop with Kris Day, our shop manager. Volunteer with one of our bike ed classes in the schools with Chauncey Tudhope-Locklear (Chimacum) or Kees Kolff (Port Townsend). Drop by to see us at the shop, send an email, or fill out a volunteer application on our website http://ptrecyclery.org/volunteer.

4. Become a member! We are a membership-based organization and cannot survive without members! Please become one at http://ptrecyclery.org/membership/email. Your membership entitles you to 10% off new parts and services at our retail shop in Port Townsend. You can also attend any of our Community Shop Days on Saturdays for free. You also get our ReCyclery Newsletter and keep in the know of what we are doing.

5. Become a donor by logging into our website and clicking on the donate button.

6. For more information, contact our volunteer, outreach and membership manager Aliina Lahti at info@ptrecyclery.org or contact board president Kees Kolff at kkolff@olympus.net

Thank you so much for your support!

7. Last but not least, Pedal on!
story_txt:
Your contribution can make a lot of difference. Help us continue the work of supporting and encouraging our community to live active lifestyles. You can be a part of making these projects successful. 
The Projects...

Neither school has any covered outdoor space, so those who walk will soon have a place to wait out of the rain. We received a $2,500 grant through WSU from an Oregon State University obesity prevention project called GROW HKC (Healthy Kids and Communities) but need much more. Construction started in mid April at Blue Heron and we have over $10,000 of design, engineering, excavation, concrete, labor and miscellaneous labor and hardware donated by dozens of businesses and volunteers. story:
Short Summary

Hello! 

My name is George Beaton and I am the Club Captain of Dundee University Mens Basketball Club for the coming year 2015/2016. I will be organising and running the basketball club for the coming season. 

The club is run by a committee of students who help keep the club going year after year. Our committee has 16 members and the club has approximately 80 players spread across 3 teams. With the next academic year looming, the team is expected to grow to around 100 players. We are a very ethnically diverse club with members from the UK, Brazil, Latvia, Malaysia, Taiwan, Egypt, Nigeria, Spain, Bulgaria, Greece and more. 

The Club began in 1967 and has had a great sense of community and brotherhood. We have bi-annual reunions where old members and new come together to celebrate the successes and the memories from the near half century history of the club. 

With the number of members growing and growing we are becoming more financially dependant on students, within and out-with the team, to help keep the club registered and able to pay the leagues we play in. 

This year, with numbers expected to be higher than ever, money has become an increasing pressure and that is why we have created this page to help put the team back into a secure standing for the next few years to come. 

What We Need & How it Helps

  • The club expenses throughout the year:

    - Basketball Scotland Registration (£25 per member annually) = £2750
    - Registration of the teams to the BUCS league = £100
    - Registration of the teams to the Tayside league = £100
    - Referee fees for the year (£18 per game) = £1008 
    - Equipment (balls, jerseys, bus rental) = £536 approx. 
(each player also has to pay for individual memberships to the Sports Union to use the facilities which vary between £90 - £160 depending on what facilities each player wants access to). 

  • The club does its own fundraising events to raise money for the club as well.

    - We have an annual Bridge Run where we run across the tay bridge in our underwear to raise money for the club and raise awareness for testicular cancer. 
    - We hold fundraising events on university campus, such as bake sales, give it a go, skills challenge etc. 
    - We arrange themed social nights where members are encouraged to help donate extra money to the club on top of whatever they already raise.

The Impact

  • Money raised not only benefits the students within the club but also other students on campus. We hold sessions where we encourage students who are shy or are intimidated to come along because of self confidence or personal issues like weight (or other various reasons) to come and just experience the club which is great because we reach out to people in need of community amongst the campus. 
  • We have an annual sports fair where we advertise our club and go looking around campus halls for students who are too nervous to come along and we encourage them to participate. On most occasions, students either join our club or stay part of the community. 
  • Recently, we have increased our club from 2 sub teams to 3 to meet the needs of our growing members. With number expected to grow 33% next year, we may need to add a 4th team to create more playing opportunities but this will come at a cost to the club which is why your donations will help.

Risks & Obstacles

  • If the club grows too large, we won't be able to fund the club and subsequently we will have to start sending players away (which is something we are greatly opposed to because it will destroy the community we have) or run the club in bankruptcy.
  • Our alternative options are to increase the number of fundraising events but, as we are a student club, a great deal of our members don't have a great deal of time. Amongst the undergraduate students in the club are a vast amount of PhD students who even see playing as a luxury in their stressful schedules.
  • We are also looking for sponsorship from various companies or find individuals who would like to support the club in exchange for potential advertising opportunities.
  • The aim for this fundraising is to not only support the club this year through its expansion but also through the next few years, giving it a stronger financial foundation to flourish upon.

Other Ways You Can Help

All donations are gratefully appreciated and go a long way for the club. However, even reading through to this point is much appreciated as you have taken the time to learn who we are. If you don't have the money to donate you can help us by sharing this page so that we can be seen by others too! 


Thank you for reading and we are entirely grateful for your help and interest.


Kind regards

George Beaton 

Club Captain

Dundee University Mens Basketball Team

Kind regards

Dundee University Mens Basketball Team

story:
Quienes somos.

Juan José Santana es mi nombre, estudié ciencias de la comunicación gracias a una beca que conseguí por jugar basketball. Conseguir la beca no fue fácil, me esforcé por varios años para mejorar mi juego y me mantuve con un nivel aceptable en el aspecto académico, pero además de eso, mi buena suerte tuvo mucho que ver.

Mi historia no es una especial, de hecho es lo contrario, de esto me di cuenta cuando ingresé al equipo representativo de la UDLAP y noté que varios de mis compañeros habían transitado un camino similar para llegar ahí.

El caso de Josue Ruiz Ochoa es uno de ellos. A pesar de contar con un inusual talento para jugar, Josue muchas veces encontró obstáculos en su vida que intentaron desviarlo de su destino en este deporte. Muchos de estos obstáculos podrían haberse presentado para otros jugadores y eso es precisamente lo que queremos evitar mediante la implementación de un programa sólido de reclutamiento, denominado Tu Futuro Basketball (TFB).

Josue es el creador de TFB, un programa de reclutamiento que pretende brindar de estructura al deporte ráfaga de nuestro país, creando un puente entre el recluta talentoso y la institución de educación superior que tiene una beca disponible para él.

TFB se encuentra en su segundo año de actividades, buscando consolidarse gracias a alianza estratégica con la Liga ABE (Asociación de Baloncesto Estudiantil). En su primer ciclo, TFB logró generar el puente entre una decena de estudiantes atletas e instituciones universitarias, gracias a la exposición que el programa obtuvo en el evento principal, denominado Elite Camp.

En nuestra campaña queremos unir a la comunidad basketbolera en México, que las diferencias entre entrenadores, jugadores, instituciones y ligas puedan dejarse de lado por un momento, y que podamos convencer a todos los que integran esa comunidad de que TFB es un programa beneficioso para el deporte nacional.

 

Las aportaciones que se hagan nos ayudarán a darle un empujón al programa, estableciéndolo así como el único en el país y asegurando que cientos de prospectos talentosos puedan año con año gozar de un espacio para mostrarse ante reclutadores y entrenadores universitarios. Creemos firmemente que esto tendrá dos efectos positivos, el primero de ellos consiste en fortalecer de manera importante el basketball nacional, ya que si mejores atletas están presentes en la Liga ABE, mejores atletas egresarán y posteriormente ingresarán al basketball profesional, alimentando después a la selección nacional, en ambas ramas. El segundo efecto positivo tiene que ver con la preparación profesional que los estudiantes atletas gozarán al estudiar en universidades de prestigio en México, las cuales participan en la Liga ABE y están siempre en búsqueda de los mejores elementos para integrar sus programas.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes.

 

Nuestra meta es reunir  10 mil dólares, cantidad correspondiente aproximada a 175 mil pesos mexicanos. TFB ha funcionado hasta el momento gracias al esfuerzo de un escaso staff, que se ha movido con esfuerzos económicos propios, y para continuar con el impulso que se generó ya, buscamos obtener un empujón de nuestra comunidad.

 

Son tres necesidades que cubriremos con el recurso recaudado.

La primera es la creación y mantenimiento de la plataforma en línea de TFB. Esta plataforma permitirá una interacción sencilla entre reclutas y reclutadores, entrenadores y prospectos, en general se perfila como una red de información en la que la comunicación entre instituciones e individuos será posible.

 

La segunda necesidad es el correcto desarrollo del Elite Camp, evento donde los mejores reclutas muestran su talento con miras a integrarse a un programa universitario.

El tercer sector donde se invertirá recurso es en la organización de campamentos de evaluación alrededor de la República Mexicana, en lo que será la primera etapa de nuestro tercer ciclo anual, con énfasis en visitar comunidades en las que no hemos estado presentes en los primeros años de trabajo, localidades en las que la práctica del basketball está en auge, pero también visitar comunidades económicamente desfavorecidas.

 

Nuestras recompensas están pensadas para todos aquellos que el basketball los mueve, los apasiona.

Más allá de nuestro eterno agradecimiento por contribuir con nuestra causa, quienes colaboren podrán recibir desde kit deportivos oficiales de TFB, hasta presencia física y en imagen durante nuestro Elite Camp. A nuestra campaña se han unido en etapas tempranas colaboradores como Spalding México, 143buzzgame y Dezzo, además del artista mexicano Chaket Gómez de Bver Studio (bverstudio en Instagram), quienes han contribuido con productos oficiales para recompensar a nuestra comunidad.

 

Si no se lograra la meta total, nuestros fondos de igual forma serán de gran ayuda y se destinarán a la creación de nuestra plataforma y al desarrollo del Elite Camp.

  El impacto.

Tu Futuro Basketball refleja el espíritu de superación que tiene el basketball mexicano. El ayudarnos logrará que:

 

-La comunidad basketbolera en México se una bajo un mismo proyecto, en beneficio exclusivo del deportista y de la competencia.

-Se cimente una estructura de reclutamiento sin precedentes en el deporte de nuestro país.

-Más y mejores atletas consigan la exposición necesaria de sus talentos ante reclutadores universitarios.

-Un reclutamiento eficiente para las instituciones universitarias a bajo costo.

-TFB llegue a todos los rincones de México, consiguiendo un censo completo del talento juvenil. 

Riesgos y desafíos.

Estamos conscientes que al finalizar la campaña estaremos fortalecidos, sin embargo nuestra batalla por establecer a TFB como un programa exitoso de reclutamiento no termina ahí. Actualmente, a la par de esta campaña, estamos ejecutando varias acciones para asegurar que nuestro programa siga funcionando.

Establecernos como una Asociación Civil es el primer paso para solventar económicamente nuestro proyecto. 

La implementación de un ambicioso plan de mercadotecnia está en puerta, con lo que lograremos darnos a conocer a nivel nacional, buscando en paralelo el apoyo de la iniciativa privada.

La diversificación de nuestro giro está en planes, con ejecución de reclutamiento en otros niveles del basketball mexicano.

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar.

 

Algunas personas simplemente no pueden hacer aportaciones económicas, pero eso no significa que sean incapaces de contribuir con nuestra causa.

El pasar la voz y compartir nuestra campaña mediante las herramientas de Indiegogo es también valioso para TFB.

Gracias por tu apoyo. Recuerda, el futuro del basketball mexicano depende de todos.

 

Who are we?

My name is Juan José Santana, I studied communications science because I was granted a scholarship due to my basketball skills. Getting that scholarship wasn’t easy, I put a lot of effort for a few years so I could improved my game, and I also kept an acceptable academic level, besides all of that, it was luck that got me where I wanted to be.

I realized that my story was not unique as soon as I got in the basketball team, in fact, a lot of my teammates went trough something similar.

Josue Ruis Ochoa is one of them. Spite of having an inusual talent to play basketball, Josue found a lot of obstacles in his life that tried to prevent him from getting his dreams fulfilled.

This scenario could’ve been the same for other players, and that is precisely what we are intended to avoid by implementing a solid recruitment program that we named Tu Futuro Basketball (Your Future Basketball).

Josue came up with this program that tries to bring some structure to mexican basketball, that closes the gap between a talented prospect and the college or university that has an available scholarship for him or her.

TFB is currently in its second year of activities, establishing itself due to a strategic alliance with ABE League (Association that organizes collegiate basketball in Mexico). In its first year, TFB successfully linked 10 student/athletes to universities or colleges, all because of the exposure generated at TFB main event, Elite Camp.

In our campaign we want to unite the basketball community of Mexico, that all differences between players, teams, coaches and leagues can be put aside once and for all, so that everyone is convinced that TFB is a beneficial program for sports around the nation.

Your contributions will aid us to give the program a big push towards becoming the one and only recruiting system in the nation, assuring that hundreds of prospects can have a window to show their talents to the eyes of scouts and college basketball coaches.

We firmly believe that this will cause 2 positive effects on basketball; a stronger and better collegiate competition that later will fortify the profesional league and national team. The second positive effect has to do with better college education brought to student/athletes, that later will reflect on better and stronger profesionals in all walks of life.  

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET.

Our goal is to reach 10K dollars (around 175K mexican pesos). So far TFB has been kept afloat due to the effort of a small staff and their economic posibilities; in order to continue we look forward to have the support of our community.

 

There are 3 needs that are going to be satisfied with the contributions made here.

Creation and maintenance of an online platform. This platform will allow an easy interaction between all basketball related actors. It will became a network where the communication among individuals and institutions will be possible.

A well developed Elite Camp, event where the top recruits will show their talent, with the goal of becoming a student/athlete in one of the many universities that are looking for talented young people.

A full scale tour of evaluation camps around the nation, in what will be the first stage of our third year. We will be looking to reach new locations but also locations where the opportunities are most needed.

Our perks are designed for those that loves basketball as much as we do.

Beyond our eternal thankfulness, those who contributes to our cause will receive something basketball related, from a TFB official kit to Elite Camp tickets, there are many options.

 

Since early stages of the campaign planning we have been blessed with the support of brands such as Spalding Mexico, 143buzzgame and a few professional basketball players and design artists, all of whom have contributed with official merch so we can reward our community.

If the goal is not reached, the contributions raised will nonetheless help us and will be destined to the creation of our platform and materialization of our Elite Camp.

 

THE IMPACT

TFB is a perfect example of the spirit of overcoming that characterizes mexican basketball. Helping us will cause:

-A never-seen-before united basketball community in Mexico under one project, which is beneficial exclusively to the sportsman and sportsmanship.

- An unprecedented sports scouting structure in our nation.

-More and better athletes that will gain exposure so they can show their talents to college coaches and scouts.

-An efficient scouting for colleges and universities at a low cost.

- TFB to reach a complete coverage and census of the national basketball youth talent.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We are aware that when we conclude the campaign we will be fortified, however our battle will not be completed.

As we are doing this crowdfunding campaign we are also taking measures to secure that our program will thrive.

Establishing a NGO is our first step towards economic strength for our program.

The implementation of an ambitious marketing plan is near. With it, we will attract national attention of sponsors within the private enterprise.

Diversification of TFB is in development as we speak, wheter in other levels of basketball or other sports.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can’t contribute with money, but that doesn’t mean that they are unable to help our cause.

Spread the voice and share our campaign using the indiegogo tools available, it will be helpful too!

Thanks for your support and remember, mexican basketball future is up to all of us.

Quienes somos.
Juan José Santana es mi nombre, estudié ciencias de la comunicación gracias a una beca que conseguí por jugar basketball. Conseguir la beca no fue fácil, me esforcé por varios años para mejorar mi juego y me mantuve con un nivel aceptable en el aspecto académico, pero además de eso, mi buena suerte tuvo mucho que ver.
Mi historia no es una especial, de hecho es lo contrario, de esto me di cuenta cuando ingresé al equipo representativo de la UDLAP y noté que varios de mis compañeros habían transitado un camino similar para llegar ahí.
El caso de Josue Ruiz Ochoa es uno de ellos. A pesar de contar con un inusual talento para jugar, Josue muchas veces encontró obstáculos en su vida que intentaron desviarlo de su destino en este deporte. Muchos de estos obstáculos podrían haberse presentado para otros jugadores y eso es precisamente lo que queremos evitar mediante la implementación de un programa sólido de reclutamiento, denominado Tu Futuro Basketball (TFB).
Josue es el creador de TFB, un programa de reclutamiento que pretende brindar de estructura al deporte ráfaga de nuestro país, creando un puente entre el recluta talentoso y la institución de educación superior que tiene una beca disponible para él.
TFB se encuentra en su segundo año de actividades, buscando consolidarse gracias a alianza estratégica con la Liga ABE (Asociación de Baloncesto Estudiantil). En su primer ciclo, TFB logró generar el puente entre una decena de estudiantes atletas e instituciones universitarias, gracias a la exposición que el programa obtuvo en el evento principal, denominado Elite Camp.
En nuestra campaña queremos unir a la comunidad basketbolera en México, que las diferencias entre entrenadores, jugadores, instituciones y ligas puedan dejarse de lado por un momento, y que podamos convencer a todos los que integran esa comunidad de que TFB es un programa beneficioso para el deporte nacional. Las aportaciones que se hagan nos ayudarán a darle un empujón al programa, estableciéndolo así como el único en el país y asegurando que cientos de prospectos talentosos puedan año con año gozar de un espacio para mostrarse ante reclutadores y entrenadores universitarios. Creemos firmemente que esto tendrá dos efectos positivos, el primero de ellos consiste en fortalecer de manera importante el basketball nacional, ya que si mejores atletas están presentes en la Liga ABE, mejores atletas egresarán y posteriormente ingresarán al basketball profesional, alimentando después a la selección nacional, en ambas ramas. El segundo efecto positivo tiene que ver con la preparación profesional que los estudiantes atletas gozarán al estudiar en universidades de prestigio en México, las cuales participan en la Liga ABE y están siempre en búsqueda de los mejores elementos para integrar sus programas.
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes. Nuestra meta es reunir  10 mil dólares, cantidad correspondiente aproximada a 175 mil pesos mexicanos. TFB ha funcionado hasta el momento gracias al esfuerzo de un escaso staff, que se ha movido con esfuerzos económicos propios, y para continuar con el impulso que se generó ya, buscamos obtener un empujón de nuestra comunidad. Son tres necesidades que cubriremos con el recurso recaudado.
La primera es la creación y mantenimiento de la plataforma en línea de TFB. Esta plataforma permitirá una interacción sencilla entre reclutas y reclutadores, entrenadores y prospectos, en general se perfila como una red de información en la que la comunicación entre instituciones e individuos será posible. La segunda necesidad es el correcto desarrollo del Elite Camp, evento donde los mejores reclutas muestran su talento con miras a integrarse a un programa universitario.
El tercer sector donde se invertirá recurso es en la organización de campamentos de evaluación alrededor de la República Mexicana, en lo que será la primera etapa de nuestro tercer ciclo anual, con énfasis en visitar comunidades en las que no hemos estado presentes en los primeros años de trabajo, localidades en las que la práctica del basketball está en auge, pero también visitar comunidades económicamente desfavorecidas. Nuestras recompensas están pensadas para todos aquellos que el basketball los mueve, los apasiona.
Más allá de nuestro eterno agradecimiento por contribuir con nuestra causa, quienes colaboren podrán recibir desde kit deportivos oficiales de TFB, hasta presencia física y en imagen durante nuestro Elite Camp. A nuestra campaña se han unido en etapas tempranas colaboradores como Spalding México, 143buzzgame y Dezzo, además del artista mexicano Chaket Gómez de Bver Studio (bverstudio en Instagram), quienes han contribuido con productos oficiales para recompensar a nuestra comunidad. Si no se lograra la meta total, nuestros fondos de igual forma serán de gran ayuda y se destinarán a la creación de nuestra plataforma y al desarrollo del Elite Camp.
  El impacto.
Tu Futuro Basketball refleja el espíritu de superación que tiene el basketball mexicano. El ayudarnos logrará que: -La comunidad basketbolera en México se una bajo un mismo proyecto, en beneficio exclusivo del deportista y de la competencia.
-Se cimente una estructura de reclutamiento sin precedentes en el deporte de nuestro país.
-Más y mejores atletas consigan la exposición necesaria de sus talentos ante reclutadores universitarios.
-Un reclutamiento eficiente para las instituciones universitarias a bajo costo.
-TFB llegue a todos los rincones de México, consiguiendo un censo completo del talento juvenil. 
Riesgos y desafíos.
Estamos conscientes que al finalizar la campaña estaremos fortalecidos, sin embargo nuestra batalla por establecer a TFB como un programa exitoso de reclutamiento no termina ahí. Actualmente, a la par de esta campaña, estamos ejecutando varias acciones para asegurar que nuestro programa siga funcionando.
Establecernos como una Asociación Civil es el primer paso para solventar económicamente nuestro proyecto. 
La implementación de un ambicioso plan de mercadotecnia está en puerta, con lo que lograremos darnos a conocer a nivel nacional, buscando en paralelo el apoyo de la iniciativa privada.
La diversificación de nuestro giro está en planes, con ejecución de reclutamiento en otros niveles del basketball mexicano.
 
 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar.
 
Algunas personas simplemente no pueden hacer aportaciones económicas, pero eso no significa que sean incapaces de contribuir con nuestra causa.
El pasar la voz y compartir nuestra campaña mediante las herramientas de Indiegogo es también valioso para TFB.
Gracias por tu apoyo. Recuerda, el futuro del basketball mexicano depende de todos.
 
Who are we?
My name is Juan José Santana, I studied communications science because I was granted a scholarship due to my basketball skills. Getting that scholarship wasn’t easy, I put a lot of effort for a few years so I could improved my game, and I also kept an acceptable academic level, besides all of that, it was luck that got me where I wanted to be.
I realized that my story was not unique as soon as I got in the basketball team, in fact, a lot of my teammates went trough something similar.
Josue Ruis Ochoa is one of them. Spite of having an inusual talent to play basketball, Josue found a lot of obstacles in his life that tried to prevent him from getting his dreams fulfilled.
This scenario could’ve been the same for other players, and that is precisely what we are intended to avoid by implementing a solid recruitment program that we named Tu Futuro Basketball (Your Future Basketball).
Josue came up with this program that tries to bring some structure to mexican basketball, that closes the gap between a talented prospect and the college or university that has an available scholarship for him or her.
TFB is currently in its second year of activities, establishing itself due to a strategic alliance with ABE League (Association that organizes collegiate basketball in Mexico). In its first year, TFB successfully linked 10 student/athletes to universities or colleges, all because of the exposure generated at TFB main event, Elite Camp.
In our campaign we want to unite the basketball community of Mexico, that all differences between players, teams, coaches and leagues can be put aside once and for all, so that everyone is convinced that TFB is a beneficial program for sports around the nation.
Your contributions will aid us to give the program a big push towards becoming the one and only recruiting system in the nation, assuring that hundreds of prospects can have a window to show their talents to the eyes of scouts and college basketball coaches.
We firmly believe that this will cause 2 positive effects on basketball; a stronger and better collegiate competition that later will fortify the profesional league and national team. The second positive effect has to do with better college education brought to student/athletes, that later will reflect on better and stronger profesionals in all walks of life.   WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET.
Our goal is to reach 10K dollars (around 175K mexican pesos). So far TFB has been kept afloat due to the effort of a small staff and their economic posibilities; in order to continue we look forward to have the support of our community. There are 3 needs that are going to be satisfied with the contributions made here.
Creation and maintenance of an online platform. This platform will allow an easy interaction between all basketball related actors. It will became a network where the communication among individuals and institutions will be possible.
A well developed Elite Camp, event where the top recruits will show their talent, with the goal of becoming a student/athlete in one of the many universities that are looking for talented young people.
A full scale tour of evaluation camps around the nation, in what will be the first stage of our third year. We will be looking to reach new locations but also locations where the opportunities are most needed.
Our perks are designed for those that loves basketball as much as we do.
Beyond our eternal thankfulness, those who contributes to our cause will receive something basketball related, from a TFB official kit to Elite Camp tickets, there are many options. Since early stages of the campaign planning we have been blessed with the support of brands such as Spalding Mexico, 143buzzgame and a few professional basketball players and design artists, all of whom have contributed with official merch so we can reward our community.
If the goal is not reached, the contributions raised will nonetheless help us and will be destined to the creation of our platform and materialization of our Elite Camp. THE IMPACT
TFB is a perfect example of the spirit of overcoming that characterizes mexican basketball. Helping us will cause:
-A never-seen-before united basketball community in Mexico under one project, which is beneficial exclusively to the sportsman and sportsmanship.
- An unprecedented sports scouting structure in our nation.
-More and better athletes that will gain exposure so they can show their talents to college coaches and scouts.
-An efficient scouting for colleges and universities at a low cost.
- TFB to reach a complete coverage and census of the national basketball youth talent. RISKS AND CHALLENGES
We are aware that when we conclude the campaign we will be fortified, however our battle will not be completed.
As we are doing this crowdfunding campaign we are also taking measures to secure that our program will thrive.
Establishing a NGO is our first step towards economic strength for our program.
The implementation of an ambitious marketing plan is near. With it, we will attract national attention of sponsors within the private enterprise.
Diversification of TFB is in development as we speak, wheter in other levels of basketball or other sports. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Some people just can’t contribute with money, but that doesn’t mean that they are unable to help our cause.
Spread the voice and share our campaign using the indiegogo tools available, it will be helpful too!
Thanks for your support and remember, mexican basketball future is up to all of us.

story:
Though this campaign has ended, we still need your support on GoFundMe

Meet Charles

Charles hails from a remote fishing village a day's journey from Ghana's capital, but left at a young age in hopes of going to school. Charles had the chance to study with teachers from around the globe, igniting his passion for learning, and for sharing the wisdom and cultures of West Africa with the world.  

By the time he entered high school, Charles was committed to bringing educational opportunities to other kids like him.  He mobilized friends and neighbors to establish a library in a remote town near his family's home.  Then, he worked with a student visiting from China to electrify the library with solar power.

Charles Dreams Big in the Face Obstacles

After completing high school, Charles set his sights on college.  With hard work, and a little luck, he was accepted to a top U.S. university to study sustainable design and construction management.

But then, his visa was denied. Never one to be defeated, Charles vowed, if he couldn’t go to college, he would bring college to Ghana.

Charles is working to pursue this dream with Ben, a strategy consultant, former Dartmouth admissions officer, and international education NGO director.

To know Charles is to believe in Charles - he has the power to change the lives of others in his community, country, and the globe.

Constructing a Sustainable Education & Retreat Center

Now we’re building a sustainable education center and retreat in the scenic mountains of West Africa, nestled below a waterfall in the heart of a wildlife sanctuary. Charles and dozens of community members have been developing new skills as they learn-by-doing under the mentorship of experts from Ghana, the US, and Canada. 

Help Us Finish Construction & Come for an 8-day Escape

This project, though not yet complete, is already changing lives. Charles has helped local workers save and invest in family businesses, send their daughters to school, and pay for long-deferred medical care. Upon completion of construction, the center will be home to an intimate retreat only during the cool summer months.

The rest of the year will host educational programs to support health, literacy, skills training, entrepreneurship, the arts, and more. We dream that the physical space we are building becomes an incubator for global ideas, driven by the talent of the region.

Charles’s college fund is nearly depleted.  But our house is not yet finished. We need $28,000 to complete the next phase of our project—materials and labor for the windows, doors, and the finishing of walls, floors, and ceilings. After we succeed with this phase, we will work towards sustainability enhancements like solar power and a rainwater catchment system. We need your help.  

Join us on this Life-Changing Journey

Make your contribution to not only generate memories of a lifetime, but also empower local communities by helping us to deliver a world-class education both through the construction process with on-the-job learning as well as long-term educational programs at the center.

Your deposit will go towards a visit to West Africa with us, when you will enjoy relationship-driven experiences. You'll explore alongside local community members as you: 

  • Learn from the wisdom of local leaders as you feast together on dishes and drinks prepared from the freshest ingredients harvested from neighboring farms.
  • Try your hand at preparing local dishes, from pounding fufu to frying kelewele.
  • Under a sky filled with more stars than visible nearly anywhere else on earth, join your newfound family around the fire with a village elder who shares stories of ancestors and warriors of the land, and of the sacred waterfall in the distance.
  • Wake up each morning to coffee grown in the surrounding wildlife sanctuary, as you  watch the sun rise over the falls.
  • Discover the challenges and joys of farming, from foraging for mushrooms to harvesting cassava.
  • Drum on the djembe and learn to dance to local rhythms.
  • Make crafts with local artisans, from weaving baskets to shaping pottery.

The possibilities are endless in a region where culture meets adventure - from weaving intricate kente to exploring vast caves.  Where will your adventure take you?

The details - so you have no worries

Our team is here to help ensure your adventure is fun, safe, and memorable.  Together Charles and Ben bring over a decade of experience leading programs for over 100 undergraduate and graduate students as well as alumni from around the world to experience this incredible region.  

Ghana is one of the safest countries on the African continent, and we take appropriate precautions to ensure your safety during your visit. We will work with you to get your Ghana visa. You only need to arrange your flight and international medical and travel insurance. Our guides receive Red Cross first aid training, and we work alongside a network of medical professionals. Our routine safety precautions also include food sanitation and road safety.

If our goal is met, we aim to complete construction in early 2019, and will be ready to welcome international guests that summer, when temperatures in our community are in the low 70s to mid 80s. If construction of the center is delayed, we will offer you the option to attend at a later date, or, if your balance is paid, you are still welcome as our guest in the community, and alternate accommodations will be arranged.

Flights from New York City to Accra are approximately 10 hours.  Your flights is not included, but we are happy to work with you to arrange appropriate air transit.  Our team will meet you at the airport in Accra, Ghana, ready to welcome you on your journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help, but can’t make it to West Africa?

  • Use Indiegogo to share this opportunity with your friends, family, and those you think who would find this experience rewarding.
  • Connect us with teachers and experts in education, medicine, design, and engineering to come lead hands-on activities with the local community.

If you are interested in visiting but funds are a challenge right now, we can offer the following:

  • Group rate for 12 people for a perk of $8250, or $750 per person for 11 people, giving the 12th person a free spot if you work to get 11 other people - the 12 participants will only need to cover the $950 balance per person after $1000 per person deposit
  • Images and stories you can use for fundraising for your trip

We are eager to greet you when you arrive in West Africa. Show your commitment to experiencing this incredible region by depositing today!

story:
LRN.FM is the best liberty-oriented audio streamed 24/7 online and via satellite, for free.  Our current satellite coverage includes North America, Central America, and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Anyone with a cheap dish and receiver can receive LRN.FM and the ideas of freedom.

We'd like to expand that to include the rest of the globe. 

In many parts of the world, cable TV installations are non-existent or uncommon due to their high up-front and ongoing cost.  Satellite is the most common form of audio/video entertainment in these areas.  It's common for homes to already have the Ku-band dish and "Free-to-Air" receiver.  For many of the 4 billion people in the world who have no internet (over 50% of the world's population), Free-to-Air is a lifeline to the world, uncensored by the state.

Free-to-Air means that no subscription is needed to receive the channels.  They are TV or radio channels broadcast "in-the-clear", direct-to-home.  Some satellites, like Galaxy 19 over North and Central America (where LRN.FM has been heard since 2009) have hundreds of Free-to-Air channels.


Who is listening?

Meet Ako.

Ako lives in Cameroon, Africa, where LRN.FM has been available on satellite since 2012.  He says everyone has Ku-band dishes in Cameroon.  He has personally introduced at least two hundred of his friends to our programs and says they listen and meet regularly to discuss the topics they hear on LRN.FM.  You can listen to one of our interviews with Ako here.

Ako is involved with the SCNC, a secessionist group in the English-speaking area of Southwest Cameroon.  The press is heavily restricted there, which is why many people in the country (who don't even have access to the internet) use Free-to-Air satellite receivers - to get unfiltered information and ideas from many global sources.  LRN.FM is the only channel on Free-to-Air advocating the ideas of liberty 24/7, and these ideas are inspiring people like Ako to take action.  However, we are only reaching two continents so far.  We can do more, with your help.  

Who is broadcasting?
I am Ian Freeman, the creator and program director of LRN.FM.  I also host Free Talk Live, heard seven days a week live on the network.  LRN.FM features dozens of liberty-oriented shows, both in live and podcast form, uncensored.  LRN.FM was founded in 2009 for two reasons.  First, to introduce existing liberty-minded people to new shows.  Second, to provide programming to free radio stations.  Both of those things have been and continue to be accomplished.  My new goal is to expand the availability of the satellite feed  to reach new ears globally with our ideas.

In addition to getting our signal direct-to-homes globally, I have been contacted by more than one underground FM radio station operator in North America who is taking their audio feed from our satellite channel.  Obviously given their clandestine nature, if a small number are contacting me, it's reasonable to presume there are many more who do not want to be "on the radar", and certainly not listed on our website as a radio affiliate.  These heroic activists are broadcasting the ideas of liberty into their communities 24/7.  That's great activism, made possible by our Ku-band "Free-to-Air" feed.


What's possible?

Between people around the world like Ako tuning LRN.FM in on their in-home satellite systems, to people listening in their car thanks to an AM/FM rebroadcast of our signal, there are already thousands of people in North and Central America as well as Sub-Saharan Africa, that are hearing the ideas of liberty - many for the very first time!  Our next step is to expand to Europe, the Middle East, and North Africa, all by adding one new satellite.  More on that below.

Sure, anyone worldwide can listen anytime at LRN.FM, but in order to do that, they'd need to have access to the internet and know to look for us.  The internet is likely something you take for granted.  However, billions of people on Earth have no internet.  Direct-to-home satellite reaches those people, affordably.  New ears will find the message of liberty, as people are frequently "scanning the band" and sampling new channels.  That's how Ako found us.  Then, he spread the word to his friends.

I think it's really exciting that the ideas of freedom are reaching some of the poorest, most oppressed places on earth.  I'm even more excited by the idea that we could be reaching more people around the globe via satellite, with your assistance.


How much will it cost?

At this time, the plan is to expand our satellite footprint to include Europe, the Middle East, and some of North Africa.  The "Hotbird" satellites accomplish this task and will put our channel in a neighborhood of hundreds of Free-to-Air TV and radio channels.  Hotbird is the best place for a Free-to-Air channel to be in these areas, hands-down.

To get on Hotbird will cost about $12,000 per year.  It's more expensive than both our African and American satellites combined, but Hotbird is much more popular.  Hotbird's estimated households with Free-to-Air receivers in its reception area are over 130 million (compared to maybe 5 million on our current American satellite, Galaxy 19.)

If we can raise $24,000, that will pay for a year of satellite time on all three satellites, Galaxy 19, SES-5, and Hotbird 13.  


    What You Get

    The satisfaction of knowing your dollars are helping reach people worldwide with the ideas of liberty, plus your name (unless you prefer anonymity) will be placed on our Satellite page on LRN.FM.  If you'd prefer more recognition, check out the perks like naming a satellite channel or getting an exclusive Platinum AMP pin.


    What if we raise more than is necessary?

    There are two reasons why we may end up raising more than is necessary to fund a Hotbird channel for three years.  First, I may be able to negotiate a better price on the channel than the quote I was given.  Second, we may raise more than the goal, which would be awesome.  In either case, some of the extra funds will go to fund more FTA satellite system installs in Africa.

    If we fail to raise the goal, funds will be distributed to continued operation of the existing signals in North and Central America and Sub-Saharan Africa.


    Prefer to donate bitcoin?

    Send BTC contributions to 1AkZUyVHtVsU6ZmAu1iSDhYiXbqFgKqzbt 


    Can't afford to give?

    Please share this fundraiser on your favorite social media and also share LRN.FM!

      Thanks for your consideration!
      Ian Freeman
      Program Director, LRN.FM

Meet Ako.

Ako lives in Cameroon, Africa, where LRN.FM has been available on satellite since 2012.  He says everyone has Ku-band dishes in Cameroon.  He has personally introduced at least two hundred of his friends to our programs and says they listen and meet regularly to discuss the topics they hear on LRN.FM.  You can listen to one of our interviews with Ako here.

Ako is involved with the SCNC, a secessionist group in the English-speaking area of Southwest Cameroon.  The press is heavily restricted there, which is why many people in the country (who don't even have access to the internet) use Free-to-Air satellite receivers - to get unfiltered information and ideas from many global sources.  LRN.FM is the only channel on Free-to-Air advocating the ideas of liberty 24/7, and these ideas are inspiring people like Ako to take action.  However, we are only reaching two continents so far.  We can do more, with your help.  



Who is broadcasting?

I am Ian Freeman, the creator and program director of LRN.FM.  I also host Free Talk Live, heard seven days a week live on the network.  LRN.FM features dozens of liberty-oriented shows, both in live and podcast form, uncensored.  LRN.FM was founded in 2009 for two reasons.  First, to introduce existing liberty-minded people to new shows.  Second, to provide programming to free radio stations.  Both of those things have been and continue to be accomplished.  My new goal is to expand the availability of the satellite feed  to reach new ears globally with our ideas.In addition to getting our signal direct-to-homes globally, I have been contacted by more than one underground FM radio station operator in North America who is taking their audio feed from our satellite channel.  Obviously given their clandestine nature, if a small number are contacting me, it's reasonable to presume there are many more who do not want to be "on the radar", and certainly not listed on our website as a radio affiliate.  These heroic activists are broadcasting the ideas of liberty into their communities 24/7.  That's great activism, made possible by our Ku-band "Free-to-Air" feed.What's possible?Between people around the world like Ako tuning LRN.FM in on their in-home satellite systems, to people listening in their car thanks to an AM/FM rebroadcast of our signal, there are already thousands of people in North and Central America as well as Sub-Saharan Africa, that are hearing the ideas of liberty - many for the very first time!  Our next step is to expand to Europe, the Middle East, and North Africa, all by adding one new satellite.  More on that below.Sure, anyone worldwide can listen anytime at LRN.FM, but in order to do that, they'd need to have access to the internet and know to look for us.  The internet is likely something you take for granted.  However, billions of people on Earth have no internet.  Direct-to-home satellite reaches those people, affordably.  New ears will find the message of liberty, as people are frequently "scanning the band" and sampling new channels.  That's how Ako found us.  Then, he spread the word to his friends.I think it's really exciting that the ideas of freedom are reaching some of the poorest, most oppressed places on earth.  I'm even more excited by the idea that we could be reaching more people around the globe via satellite, with your assistance. How much will it cost?At this time, the plan is to expand our satellite footprint to include Europe, the Middle East, and some of North Africa.  The "Hotbird" satellites accomplish this task and will put our channel in a neighborhood of hundreds of Free-to-Air TV and radio channels.  Hotbird is the best place for a Free-to-Air channel to be in these areas, hands-down.To get on Hotbird will cost about $12,000 per year.  It's more expensive than both our African and American satellites combined, but Hotbird is much more popular.  Hotbird's estimated households with Free-to-Air receivers in its reception area are over 130 million (compared to maybe 5 million on our current American satellite, Galaxy 19.)If we can raise $24,000, that will pay for a year of satellite time on all three satellites, Galaxy 19, SES-5, and Hotbird 13.    
What You Get The satisfaction of knowing your dollars are helping reach people worldwide with the ideas of liberty, plus your name (unless you prefer anonymity) will be placed on our Satellite page on LRN.FM.  If you'd prefer more recognition, check out the perks like naming a satellite channel or getting an exclusive Platinum AMP pin.


What if we raise more than is necessary?
There are two reasons why we may end up raising more than is necessary to fund a Hotbird channel for three years.  First, I may be able to negotiate a better price on the channel than the quote I was given.  Second, we may raise more than the goal, which would be awesome.  In either case, some of the extra funds will go to fund more FTA satellite system installs in Africa.
If we fail to raise the goal, funds will be distributed to continued operation of the existing signals in North and Central America and Sub-Saharan Africa.


Prefer to donate bitcoin?
Send BTC contributions to 1AkZUyVHtVsU6ZmAu1iSDhYiXbqFgKqzbt 

Can't afford to give?
 Please share this fundraiser on your favorite social media and also share LRN.FM!

 Thanks for your consideration!Ian FreemanProgram Director, LRN.FM

story:
Make Education a Life-long Difference in a Child’s Future – Fund a Scholarship!

We are looking for progressive and enlightened supporters with a world view who recognize that quality education creates a better path to life success.

Located in the multicultural community of Uvita, Escuela Verde (the Green School) has for seven years been creating alternative educational opportunities to the public school system of Costa Rica. We prepare children, pre-school to grade 8, to be literate, bi-lingual, resourceful and independent.

So Much Need

So Little Extra

So Hard to Decide

So Make your donation timeless:

The Planet, The Rain Forest, and Kids!

Daily thousands of acres of rain forest are lost, endangering the well-being of Mother Earth. The planet must be protected FOR our kids and BY our kids. 

Escuela Verde is a multilingual school located in the lush rain forest of Costa Rica 's verdant Southern Pacific coast. We educate local children to value, respect and understand it's unique place on the planet. Without such an education, we have little hope of sustainable growth and development alongside the last tropical rainforests of Central America .  

Escuela Verde teaches modern science and timeless respect for nature. The keys to our future. 

Help our kids learn to love and truly care for the rain forest and the Earth.

Help us raise a generation of kids who can take care of themselves and

the Earth upon which ALL LIFE depends. 

Donate and help sponsor a local child in need now.

To assist families in need in our community, we provide scholarships to children whose families may otherwise not be able to afford the annual tuition.  Without access to a better education, many young men and women are consigned to a life of general labor. These scholarships will provide opportunities to greatly enhance the futures of these children and their future families, creating more rewarding careers and life choices.

Your funding of a scholarship fund will cover 70% of a student's tuition
for two semesters (one year).  This will cover school fees, classroom books and
learning materials.  For accountability and to foster engagement in their child's education, the families of the students are responsible for 30% of the tuition and 20 hours of school volunteer work.

We are looking to raise $34,000 USD that will support 15 annual scholarships.

Your contribution will enable a family to have the first child to graduate from high school or even college.  In the end, your contributions will be an investment in a better world for all of us. By funding scholarships, you will help overcome one of the barriers to a better education and better life.

 You personally know how education has positively impacted your life. Now it's time to be the catalyst to show how education can make a difference not only to this child but also multi-generationally. Your donation will help us maintain our goal of at least a 50% Costa Rican student body.


Please contribute any amount that you can.  We have great perks for large contributions. But even $20 will have an impact on the future of a child. And if you are unable to contribute, then tell your friends and families about our need for scholarship funding.

Escuela Verde

Green, Growing, Giving

story:
BrainWare SAFARI has already helped tens of thousands of students, as well as many adults, build their cognitive skills.  And now we’re ready to take it to the next level.  We plan to release the newest version of BrainWare in Fall of 2015.

What are cognitive skills?  Cognitive skills are the processes the brain uses to take in, understand, manipulate, store and retrieve information from the outside world.  They include processes like sustained or divided attention, short-term or working memory, visual span or visualization, as well as auditory, sensory integration and other skills.  BrainWare SAFARI develops 41 cognitive skills in all, making it the most comprehensive program of its kind.  More information on cognitive skills.

What makes BrainWare SAFARI different?  Besides being comprehensive, it develops skills in a highly integrated way, like cross-training for your brain.  That makes it effective and creates sustainable improvements in cognitive functioning that transfer to academic performance and everyday life.  Another big difference – BrainWare SAFARI uses the best practices of video-game technology to make the program engaging – a key to getting great results.

How well does the program work?  When BrainWare SAFARI is used according to the recommended protocol (3 to 5 times per week, 30 to 60 minutes per session, for 10 to 14 weeks), it has been shown to increase cognitive skills dramatically, in peer-reviewed published research and field studies.  In published research, students improved their cognitive ability by over 4 years and their academic ability by almost 2 years in 12 weeks.  More info on BrainWare SAFARI research.

What’s next?  The next stage for BrainWare SAFARI means new technology to make it completely web-based so it can be used on any computer, tablet or mobile device.  It also means a new set of graphics that will appeal more to teens and adults.  We also have a few new tricks up our sleeves to make the program even more engaging and effective than ever!.  Be part of the campaign and we will keep you posted on all this and more!

How can you help?  Choose one of the contribution levels you see on the right.  If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support in taking BrainWare SAFARI to the next level!

Team Links:

Roger Stark, CEO

Betsy Hill, President and COO

story:
Short Summary

The Ely Folk School (EFS) wants to build community by providing learning experiences that celebrate the wilderness heritage, art, history, culture, and craft of the people of northern Minnesota. Located in the town of Ely, Minnesota, at the edge of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, EFS will showcase the skills and talents of local artists and craftspeople. Folk Schools are designed to create community in a hands-on, experiential learning environment.  We have the property lease, and are working on the schedule of classes, so it's REALLY HAPPENING!

What We Need & What You Get

Our start-up costs include utilities, lights, furniture, teaching supplies, cleaning supplies, etc. Money raised by donations will be helpful in grant applications that require community involvement and matching funds.  You will receive the satisfaction of knowing you invested in a community of teachers and learners that many people will benefit from in future! Thank you.

The Impact

The establishment of an excited learning community on the main street will help strengthen the local economy of Ely.  An investment in EFS is an investment in rural America, an investment in community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to contribute, that's ok, you can help us by spreading the word or volunteering with EFS. You can find us on Facebook under Ely Folk School and on the web at www.elyfolkschool.org.

story:
We need your help for our annual service adventure trip!

We are going to spend 13 days in Panama, seven of which will be dedicated to helping host a Biocultural Design Learning-Adventure Seminar in the Mamoní Valley Preserve. We will spend a couple of nights in the local village of Cangandi as guest of the chiefs, experiencing a cross cultural exchange.  We will also explore how nature and the arts, especially music, can reconnect us with nature.  The remaining days will be spent helping Earthtrain with their gardens, and exploring the local rivers and beaches.


There is no way to recreate these kinds of priceless experiences in the classroom. Teenagers need to expand their realities by experiencing first-hand the realities of other people and cultures that are vastly different from their own and have lots of challenging adventures along the way. We have seen students' lives change in amazing ways that would never have happened if they stayed at their desks.

We have been offered an amazing deal through Earthtrain, but it’s still an expensive trip. 

Your donations will also help support our Living Wisdom School, a revolutionary and unique school system. We offer students from around the world training in yoga and meditation, holistic student development, experiential learning, an individualized curriculum and a values-based education that addresses mind, body, heart and soul! Our service and adventure trips are a way for us to test ourselves in the real world and to share our gifts with the world.

Of course, our learning never stops. Other themes on our trip include: Teamwork, Leadership, Character Training, Environmental Awareness, Nature Education, Self-Discovery and Values like: Compassion, Self-Expression, Self-Expansion, Positive Thinking, Solution Consciousness, Selflessness and More!

Help us help the Mamoni Valley Preserve! Support our school!

Thank you for your support!

~~~

Risks and Challenges

We’re working hard to make this trip happen. If we don’t raise enough money, it will mean endangering future opportunities for students at our school to experiences amazing opportunities around the world. We don’t want this to happen.

In the past, we’ve learned Spanish so we could help children in an orphanage in La Paz, Mexico, visited the Polestar Community on the Big Island in Hawaii where we worked in their organic garden, learned to play marimbas, and experienced lava flows up close and personal!  We have served dozens of America’s National Parks in California and the Southwest, and served at Best Friends Animal Sanctuary, the largest no-kill shelter in America.  We also participated in an eco-community in Quebec, and even went on pilgrimage to India to visit the Dalai Lama. Alumni from our school remember these experiences for a lifetime – experiences we need to make sure are available for generations to come!

~~~

About Living Wisdom School

Living Wisdom Schools are dedicated to helping students prepare for life’s challenges through joyful learning. We’re holistic educators that offer children non-sectarian, universal values and spiritual traditions from different cultures around the world. Here’s an excerpt from a committee report by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC) committee report after evaluating our school.

“The school provides an exceptional caring and safe environment for students and staff. Teachers demonstrate caring concern, respect, and high expectations for each student. Individual differences are respected and honored. The learning environment is student-centered with tools for maturity and successful living as a top goal.  The modeling of respect and lifelong learning by staff members makes this goal well understood for students.  Staff and student commitment to service and responsibility for the community and its members are reflected in student kindness, helpfulness and support of each other and other community members.”

Living Wisdom Schools supports teenagers, during what we call the “Will Years”, by engaging students in challenging and expansive activities like our two-week Service and Adventure Trips. Our high school students come from around the world to participate in these once in a lifetime experiences.
