story:
What if you could help 10,000 Catholic families inspire their kids to live more fully in the love of Christ? What if you could hand all those parents books and digital resources that made it easy for them to pray, celebrate grace, love God and neighbor, and talk about God with their kids? What if you could give all those kids beautifully crafted storybooks that told great stories of faith?

Team up with Peanut Butter & Grace, and we'll do all that and more by the end of the year.

Making Family Faith Formation As Simple as a PB & J

The research is unambiguous: The way that parents live out the faith at home is far and away the number one predictor of kids’ future faith practices. And yet, even among parents who say that passing the faith on to their kids is “very important,” as few as 30 percent actually do anything at home to meet that goal. (See more about the importance of family-based faith formation.)

What can we do to support these parents? We can give them resources that make it super simple to start living out the faith with their kids, right here and right now.

That’s what Peanut Butter & Grace books and digital resources are created to do. They’re:

  • Practical: Rather than asking parents to “teach” their kids “about” a faith that they might not know too well themselves, Peanut Butter & Grace coaches parents toward practicing the faith with their kids in everyday life and using that experience as a starting point for learning more about why we do what we do as Catholic Christians.
  • Grab-and-go: Instead of super-complicated lesson plans, parents get started practicing the faith with their kids right away.
  • Focused: Families focus on the essentials of following Christ in the company of the whole Church.

The bottom line: Family faith formation should be as simple
as making a pb & j sandwich.


Here’s what we’ve already accomplished

We’ve already done a lot since launching on January 1. The numbers tell the story:

  • 4,800: The number of individuals who have visited our website, pbgrace.com.
  • 800: The number of people who have “liked” our Facebook page.
  • 150: The number of people subscribing to The Bread, our weekly family faith formation newsletter.
  • 3: The number of books we’ve published.

All of these efforts have generated a warm and enthusiastic response (just look at the testimonials in the “Why People Love Peanut Butter & Grace” section below).






Here’s a rundown of the resources we’ve already created:


77 Ways to Pray with Your Kids: A Guide for Catholic Families
Seventy-seven super-short articles introduce parents to the many different ways that Catholics pray, explaining how to practice each way with kids of different ages. (See full description)

The Bread

The Bread is a weekly family faith formation planner that helps families connect to the feasts, events, and Sunday Scripture readings for the upcoming week. It’s posted to the pbgrace.com website and e-mailed to subscribers every Friday. (See The Bread)

The Illuminated Rosary: The Joyful Mysteries
The books in the Illuminated Rosary series help families pray the rosary together by giving kids more than sixty works of sacred art to meditate on—one for each Hail Mary and Our Father of the rosary. The Joyful Mysteries is the first book in the series. (See full description)

The Illuminated Rosary: The Sorrowful Mysteries
The Sorrowful Mysteries is the second book in the Illuminated Rosary series. (See full description)


What we’d like to do

With your help, we’d like to do even more for Catholic families in the coming year by creating these new resources:

Raising Catholic Kids: Your Guide to Talking about God, Celebrating Grace, Doing Good, and Praying with Your Kids (working title)
This is every parent’s must-have sourcebook for how to implement the whole range of core Catholic practices with kids of all ages.

A Catholic Family Hearthbook: A Treasury of Foods, Stories, and Traditions Celebrating Catholic Holy Days throughout the Year (working title)
Traditions, stories, and meal plans for celebrating the major feasts of the Church year, with full color photos throughout.

The Bread 2.0
The Bread, but revamped with input from parish family life ministers and made available as a PDF for downloading and photocopied distribution.

The Little Flower: A Parable of St. Thérèse of Lisieux
Even little people can do great things for God, as the young Thérèse Martin discovers in this children’s picture book. (See full description)

The Ultimate Catholic Bucket List, Teen Edition: 101 Things Every Catholic Teen Should Try Before They Die, or Turn Twenty (Whichever Comes First)
This book offers teens a wide variety of core Catholic practices for teens to “try out,” either on their own or in a friendly competition with classmates using the point system included in the book.

The Illuminated Rosary: The Glorious Mysteries
The Glorious Mysteries is the third book in the Illuminated Rosary series.

The Illuminated Rosary: The Luminous Mysteries
The Luminous Mysteries is the fourth book in the Illuminated Rosary series.

Wit, Wisdom, & Wet Wipes: Musings on Parenthood by Catholic Bloggers (working title)
Practical advice, insightful personal reflections, and humor from the top Catholic parenting blogs.

Look with Your Heart
A children's picture book about looking for God's presence in all things, even when He seems far away. Written by Christian Broadcast Network writer and producer Audra Haney and illustrated by Tracey Arvidson.

Join us in reaching 10,000 Catholic families

Together, we can help 10,000 Catholic families start practicing the faith at home by getting these books and digital resources into the hands of parents. Here’s how funding from this IndieGoGo campaign will make it possible to reach that goal by March 2016:

1. Making books and resources
About $6,000 will go toward paying for images and artwork, manuscript development and editing, and miscellaneous fees and expenses directly tied to making books (e.g., imprimatur and ISBN fees, print set-up fees, and so on).

2. Mailing sample books to people who can spread the word
About $2,500 will pay for the cost of mailing sample copies of books to 350 people who can spread the word: bookstore owners, top Catholic bloggers, and key Church leaders at the parish, diocesan, and national levels.

3. Going viral
Online advertising is both affordable and easy to target to relevant audiences. $1,500 will help us reach our goal of 5,000 “likes” on our Facebook page and 1,500 subscriptions to The Bread within one year.


Let’s do even more: Our “stretch” goals

There are about 1.5 million Catholic families in our target audience, which is good motivation to go above and beyond our campaign goal. Here's what else we'd like to do:

4. Get even more sample books out
Sample books fuel word of mouth and get resources to families right away. Raising $2,500 more than our campaign goal will help us send out another 350 books to people who can spread the word.

5. Network at conferences
Let’s network and get the word out by attending key conferences, including the World Meeting of Families in Philadelphia (September) and the National Catholic Youth Conference in Indianapolis (November). $1,200 will get us to these conferences, which will undoubtedly spark ideas for new ways to help Catholic families do the faith with kids at home.

6. Acquire artwork for more children’s picture books
Storytelling is one of the key ways that parents and grandparents pass the faith on to kids, which is why we’d like to follow up The Little Flower with another picture book by CBN producer Audra Haney, Look with Your Heart. $2,500 acquires the art we need to jumpstart this project.


Why people love Peanut Butter & Grace

About 77 Ways to Pray with Your Kids:

I am having fun with this book [77 Ways to Pray with Your Kids], lots of great ideas on bringing [the] Catholic faith into our lives on a daily basis. It has inspired and given me all kinds of ideas on better catechizing the whole family. A must for Catholic families who want more than a Sunday Faith.
—Debra Ann Matchell

It’s not easy to be a Christian parent, and it’s not easy to pray. 77 Ways to Pray with Your Kids cuts straight to the most important aspects of these challenges, offering wisdom, humor, and a treasury of ideas.
  —Sarah Reinhard, author of Catholic Family Fun and blogger at SnoringScholar.com (Read Sarah's review in National Catholic Register)

. . . when it comes to praying with the kids, we need a guide that is practical, simple, and easy to incorporate. This book is that guide, and I cannot recommend it highly enough!
  —Leila Miller, Little Catholic Bubble

Solid, creative, useful, practical and helpful.
 —Leif Kehrwald, Vibrant Faith Ministries

About The Joyful Mysteries:

It’s just ingenious and so simple! The most beautiful book, in which every page corresponds to one bead of the Rosary and showcases one work of sacred art upon which to meditate! It’s the perfect First Communion gift. . . . (read full review)
—Leila Miller, Little Catholic Bubble

This book is absolutely beautiful! My kids love being able to keep up with the beads at the bottom and I love being able to meditate on the mysteries using the artwork to keep me focused. Please keep the wonderful books coming!
—Emily Nielsen

We used this book to say our rosary on the day of the March For Life, and the kids sat quiet and engrossed by the lovely artwork, a different painting for each bead of each mystery. Highly recommended.
—Cat Hodge

I just bought the Joyful Mysteries, my boys (5 & 6yrs) and I have been using it for the past 3 nights at bedtime! In fact, I let them stay up a bit later than usual last night & told them no books, straight to bed! But they insisted we had to see our “Mary Book”, so I caved! I love that the pictures really get them to understand each Mystery….—Vicki Oberle

The Joyful Mysteries came Saturday, and we were just blown away by it. Absolutely beautiful. The artwork is stunning, the whole presentation of the mysteries, how to pray the Rosary, the listing of the artwork at the end, all are done with such excellence.
—Barbara Allaire

Thanks for the beautiful Joyful Mystery book!  I bought one about 2 months ago and [my husband] loves saying the rosary with me following the pictures as well as the prayers.  He never understood the rosary, never had learned how or why it was said, but we try and say it everyday following the book, at least for Lent.  So, it not only teaches children, but people 85 and older too.

—Phyllis Duris


Got questions?

You can check out the questions and answers page at Peanut Butter & Grace (pbgrace.com/faq), or contact Jerry Windley-Daoust at (507) 452-5399.
story_txt:
What if you could help 10,000 Catholic families inspire
their kids to live more fully in the love of Christ? What if you could hand all those parents books and digital resources that made it easy for them to pray, celebrate grace, love God and neighbor, and talk about God with their kids? What if you could give all those kids beautifully crafted storybooks that told great stories of faith?Team up with Peanut Butter & Grace, and we'll do all that and more by the end of the year. 
Making Family Faith
Formation As Simple as a PB & J
The research is unambiguous: The way that parents live out
the faith at home is far and away the number one predictor of kids’ future
faith practices. And yet, even among parents who say that passing the faith on
to their kids is “very important,” as few as 30 percent actually do anything at
home to meet that goal. (See more about the importance of family-based faith formation.)
What can we do to support these parents? We can give them resources
that make it super simple to start
living out the faith with their kids, right here and right now.
That’s what Peanut Butter & Grace books and digital
resources are created to do. They’re:


Practical: Rather than asking parents to
“teach” their kids “about” a faith that they might not know too well
themselves, Peanut Butter & Grace coaches parents toward practicing the faith with their kids in everyday life and using that experience as a starting point for learning more about why we do what we do as Catholic Christians.

Grab-and-go: Instead of super-complicated lesson
plans, parents get started practicing the faith with their kids right away.


Focused: Families focus on the essentials of following Christ in the company of the whole Church.

The bottom line:
Family faith formation should be as simpleas making a pb & j sandwich.
Here’s what we’ve
already accomplished
We’ve already done a lot since launching on January 1. The
numbers tell the story:

4,800: The number of individuals who have visited our
website, pbgrace.com.

800: The number of people who have “liked” our
Facebook page.



150: The number of people subscribing to The
Bread, our weekly family faith formation newsletter.

3: The number of books we’ve published.

All of these efforts have generated a warm and enthusiastic
response (just look at the testimonials in the “Why People Love Peanut Butter
& Grace” section below).
Here’s a rundown of the resources we’ve already created:

77 Ways to Pray with
Your Kids: A Guide for Catholic FamiliesSeventy-seven super-short articles introduce parents to
the many different ways that Catholics pray, explaining how to practice each way
with kids of different ages. (See full description)The BreadThe Bread is a weekly family faith formation planner that
helps families connect to the feasts, events, and Sunday Scripture readings for
the upcoming week. It’s posted to the pbgrace.com website and e-mailed to
subscribers every Friday. (See The Bread)The Illuminated
Rosary: The Joyful MysteriesThe books in the Illuminated Rosary series help families
pray the rosary together by giving kids more than sixty works of sacred art to
meditate on—one for each Hail Mary and Our Father of the rosary. The Joyful Mysteries is the first book
in the series. (See full description)

The Illuminated Rosary: The Sorrowful MysteriesThe Sorrowful Mysteries is the second book in the Illuminated Rosary series. (See full description)What we’d like to do
With your help, we’d like to do even more for Catholic
families in the coming year by creating these new resources:
Raising Catholic Kids:
Your Guide to Talking about God, Celebrating Grace, Doing Good, and Praying
with Your Kids (working title)This is every parent’s must-have sourcebook for how to
implement the whole range of core Catholic practices with kids of all ages.
A Catholic Family
Hearthbook: A Treasury of Foods, Stories, and Traditions Celebrating Catholic Holy
Days throughout the Year (working title)Traditions, stories, and meal plans for celebrating the
major feasts of the Church year, with full color photos throughout.
The Bread 2.0The Bread, but revamped with input from parish family life
ministers and made available as a PDF for downloading and photocopied
distribution.
The Little Flower: A
Parable of St. Thérèse of LisieuxEven little people can do great things for God, as the young
Thérèse Martin discovers in this children’s picture book. (See full description)The Ultimate Catholic
Bucket List, Teen Edition: 101 Things Every Catholic Teen Should Try Before
They Die, or Turn Twenty (Whichever Comes First)This book offers teens a wide variety of core Catholic
practices for teens to “try out,” either on their own or in a friendly
competition with classmates using the point system included in the book.
The Illuminated
Rosary: The Glorious MysteriesThe Glorious Mysteries
is the third book in the Illuminated Rosary series.
The Illuminated
Rosary: The Luminous MysteriesThe Luminous Mysteries
is the fourth book in the Illuminated Rosary series.
Wit, Wisdom, & Wet
Wipes: Musings on Parenthood by Catholic Bloggers (working title)Practical advice, insightful personal reflections, and humor
from the top Catholic parenting blogs.Look with Your HeartA children's picture book about looking for God's presence in all things, even when He seems far away. Written by Christian Broadcast Network writer and producer Audra Haney and illustrated by Tracey Arvidson.
Join us in reaching
10,000 Catholic families

Together, we can help 10,000 Catholic families start
practicing the faith at home by getting these books and digital resources into the
hands of parents. Here’s how funding from this IndieGoGo campaign will make it
possible to reach that goal by March 2016:
1. Making books and resourcesAbout $6,000 will go toward paying for images and artwork,
manuscript development and editing, and miscellaneous fees and expenses
directly tied to making books (e.g., imprimatur and ISBN fees, print set-up
fees, and so on).
2. Mailing sample books to people who can spread the wordAbout $2,500 will pay for the cost of mailing sample copies
of books to 350 people who can spread the word: bookstore owners, top Catholic
bloggers, and key Church leaders at the parish, diocesan, and national levels.
3. Going viralOnline advertising is both affordable and easy to target to
relevant audiences. $1,500 will help us reach our goal of 5,000 “likes” on our
Facebook page and 1,500 subscriptions to The Bread within one year.
Let’s do even more:
Our “stretch” goals

families right away. Raising $2,500 more than our campaign goal will help us send
out another 350 books to people who can spread the word.

conferences, including the World Meeting of Families in Philadelphia
(September) and the National Catholic Youth Conference in Indianapolis (November).
$1,200 will get us to these conferences, which will undoubtedly spark ideas for
new ways to help Catholic families do the faith with kids at home. 
6. Acquire artwork for more children’s picture booksStorytelling is one of the key ways that parents and
grandparents pass the faith on to kids, which is why we’d like to follow up The Little Flower with another picture
book by CBN producer Audra Haney, Look
with Your Heart. $2,500 acquires the art we need to jumpstart this project.
Why people love

praying with the kids, we need a guide that is practical, simple, and easy to
incorporate. This book is that guide, and I cannot recommend it highly enough!  —Leila Miller,
Little Catholic Bubble
Solid, creative,
useful, practical and helpful. —Leif Kehrwald,
Vibrant Faith Ministries

story:
How You Can Help

  • Contribute $5 or $1,000, every penny helps! Our initial goal is $4,500 for the first 60 days of funding.
  • We are not a 501(c)3 organization yet, so instead of a tax deduction you can cash in on some pretty cool perks. Check them out!
  • Where will the funds go? The majority of the money raised will go to the first scholarship (future scholarships will most likely be sustained through sponsors and through a reasonable $10-$15 application fee) but we also need funds to maintain a website and apply for 501(c)3 status. 

The Impact

“Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one’s lifetime.” – Mark Twain

  • By donating you will be helping The Nagypapa Foundation award a scholarship (maybe two) for travel to a young person aged 18-26 who to further their education through travel.

story:
About cerebral palsy

Cerebral palsy (CP) is caused by brain damage in early life and is the most common physical disability in childhood, with 17 million people affected worldwide. In Australia, a child is born with CP every 15 hours. There is no known cure.  Learn more.
 

About CPtoys

It is a very exciting time for children with CP and their families. In some areas, research has moved beyond investigation of effective therapies. We know what works. Therapy needs to happen very early (in infancy) and therapy needs to be intensive. This means that toys and home-based programs undertaken by parents are an essential part of any therapy program. However, effective therapy is much more than simply “playing with toys”. In order to acquire new skills and learn, activities must be carefully matched to a child's goals, individual ability level and age. They should also be motivating and fun to provide opportunities for repetitive practice and learning. This is how the brain rewires itself and leads to lifelong improvements in function. 

Finding the right toy, for the right child, and the right goal is a continual challenge for therapists and families. This is why we created the CPtoys™ mobile App in 2014. Since then, we have had over 1700 downloads and translated CPtoys™ into English, French, Dutch, Norwegian, Italian and Spanish. Watch video or Download. 

“The CPtoys™ App is just what every parent needs. We now have a really clear idea of the goals we are working on for Rye and what toys we should be using to achieve these goals. It also saves a lot of time”.
Brooke Johnson, whose two-year-old son Rye has CP

How does CPtoys work?

CPtoys™ provides individualized and targeted upper limb therapy advice. It matches toys to a child’s age and specific upper limb goals. As a child’s abilities improve, new goals can be added and updated. It is the first App to provide individualized treatment advice for children with CP and is a major innovation and example of using technology to improve the effectiveness of treatment outcomes.

Who are we?

CPtoys™ was developed by Dr Brian Hoare, Occupational Therapist. Dr Hoare completed a PhD in Occupational Therapy at La Trobe University in 2010. He completed a post-doctoral fellowship at the Karolinska Institute, Sweden in 2011-12 and is currently an Honorary Research Fellow at Australian Catholic University, Melbourne. 
Learn more about the developer
 

What we want

We want to make CPtoys™ even better, more accessible and ultimately, continue to improve the lives of children with CP.  Due to ongoing child development and the rapid improvements made over short periods of time, specific toys used in therapy and home programs become obsolete very quickly. What may be an appropriate toy one week, is inappropriate the next week. This creates a strain on family finances and can often slow down or prevent the progression of skills in young children with CP. Based on parent feedback we want to create CPtoySwap. CPtoySwap is an global online community where families can securely post, share, donate or swap toys between themselves. This will ensure that toys can be used to improve outcomes for as many children with CP as possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $40,000 USD to fund a very clever software developer to create a new web-based CPtoys™ platform and to integrate the new CPtoySwap system. Project management will be undertaken by Dr Brian Hoare with no funds paid to him for any of this work. This is a not-for-profit project.

The Impact

Your contribution has the potential to improve the lives thousands of children with CP and their families. Care for a child with CP is estimated to cost an average of $43,431 AUD per person per year, of which approximately 37% is borne by their family. This includes purchasing large amounts of toys for use in therapy programs.  While most toys used for therapy and home programs are not considered "specialised", toys that are perfectly suited to these programs are often expensive, discontinued or extremely difficult to source. For the first time, CPtoyswap will ensure that these toys are not discarded and shared between as many families as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monetary contribution, you can still help us create CPtoySwap by spreading word of this campaign. If you have any questions or comments, please send us an email at brianhoare@cptoys.org

Lastly, a huge thank you for your support and generosity.

story:
Short Summary

Why the Idea

We want to create quality educational contents and facilitate the learning process. Our goal is to combine learning with having fun and so contribute to improve the learning techniques used in schools today. We use technology as a learning tool, because children learn best when they play, plus they love technology.

With our teaching experience, we create quality content suited to the individual development of each child.

With our games, we display the contents to the child in a simple and attractive way, improving the teaching methods used in schools.
Our inspiration are our children, we watch them play games, and we want to make quality games for all the children.

Game Description

Princesses for preschool is a project of  ITSimples Games where we create educational preschool video games for girls.
Princesses for preschool has features that will amaze every preschool girl from 3 to 6 years old. 
It has magic, princesses, fairies, among other amazing elements that are there to inspire the child's creativity and imagination.
We approach educational themes, such as letters, numbers, nature, healthy food choices, colors, music, sequences, among others,  in a simple and attractive way, with the main purpose to give the child a great time while learning at the same time. 
The Princesses for preschool game pack will be available on English, German and Portuguese.
The child gets rewarded for playing
For every learning game the child plays, she will receive hearts, that are the exchange coin in the game. 
She can exchange in-game earned hearts for dress-up items in the dress-up game. 
The child needs to play the learning games, in order to obtain her own hearts. 
It is not possible to buy hearts with money, because we think this is a bad practice in a learning game for children and the child needs to struggle and earn her own hearts. 

Meet the free princesses and the free games

Fairy Agnes and the Dress-up Game

Fairy Agnes is the main Princess of the Game, she will have a dress-up game associated. 

Princess Vitoria and the Letters Game

Princess Vitoria represents letters, the child can paint random letters from the alphabet with a flower texture. 
Princess Sofia and the Nature Game

Princess Sofia represents Nature, the child can solve a puzzle game made with nature elements.

Princess Maria and the Fruits and Vegetables Game

Princess Maria represents Fruits and Vegetables, the child needs to catch sequences of falling fruits and vegetables.

Princess Joana and the Animals Game

Princess Joana represents Animals, the child needs to feed the animals with the right food.

The Full Version Princesses

Princess Anna and the Music Game

Princess Anna represents Emotions, we mix color with music, and the child is challenged by reproducing sequences of tones associated to their colours. The child can hear and choose the sounds of different instruments.

Princess Leila and the Numbers Game

Princess Leila represents the Numbers, the child can learn the numbers by counting how many objects there are, add and subtract with objects, and match the numbers in the right form. 

Princess Silvana and the Forms Game

Princess Silvana represents Forms, the child can identify the different forms by clicking on the right ones.

What we've already achieved

We created the structure for the game with the princesses. Except for the princess Ines dress-up game and the Forms game,  the Princesses are already functional. 

Please watch some gameplay videos representing the Numbers Game and the Music Game. More videos of the development are available at the youtube channel and the Indiegogo campaign gallery.



Release date and future of the Princesses

The first release will be in March 2015 for android.
The Princesses game will be constantly improved and updated, we want to improve also some of the game features.

Team

We are two parents and game developers with teaching background experience and degree in Informatics Engineering. 

    Francisco Fernandes - Young spirit, creative and innovative, I like challenges!

    Carla Ventura - Ambitious dreamer and action oriented, I'm ready!

The characters art are designed by Rui Antunes a very talented designer. 
The music was produced by Bruno Alves from Associação Tempos Brilhantes.

Distribution

Our market will be International mobile and web. Princesses will be available for download first at 

and after Google Play, it will be adapted to iPad and available on the App Store

The Princesses will be free for download with many free features and games, you can have all Princesses if you purchase the full game version. 
The princesses demo will be available in a web version soon for any person who wants to try the game out.

What this project means to us 

This project is our life project. We are parents of two children , a boy with 1 year old and a girl wit 5 years old. We also worked with children directly in schools and preschools, it is a dream coming true, being able to contribute to and work for children. We want to facilitate the learning process by giving the child the tools to learn by herself and having fun at the same time.

We want to give back to the community

For each Princesses game – full version sold, 0,10€ will be donated to charity institutions which support children.

The Impact

Our game will improve the learning methods used in preschool and if we succeed we can help more children by creating quality learning content to them and by helping the community directly.

How you can help us

Contribute with a Donation to our project

You are contributing and helping us if you believe in our vision to create quality learning games.

Select a perk

The Perk #9 - Princess Agnes Handmade doll is being handmade by a fine artist and crafter.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Spread the word

The competition is enormous, there are so many video games out there for the mobile market, that even if we have a quality educational game, the final user will not see our game among all the others available.

So, we ask you to spread the word and share our project with your friends.

How will the funding be used

  • Company expenses - If the campaign succeeds we'll have to register ITSimples Games to satisfy the taxation and bureaucratic requirements. This adds extra initial and monthly expenses.
  • Marketing - Marketing the Princesses costs money, we need to register a mark, create a domain, a site for the game, flyers, participate in game or education conferences, among other activities. 
  • Design - We need to pay the designer for his great work.
  • Equipment - to develop and test our games.

Risks & Challenges

If we do nothing, we will not achieve anything. The first step and the hardest one has already been taken - which was to start the project.
We are creators of educational videogames with quality, our main obstacle is to continue creating without getting any revenue, and to continue supporting our expenses.
What can we do while we've not achieved success?
Support the expenses until the Princesses for preschool achieve a high number of downloads, and the revenues cover or pass the expenses taken until that date.
If we will not achieve what we want, we will restart, work hard to overcome our errors and mistakes, which are after all, an excellent form to learn.
We will not create the Princesses  for preschool and let them in a box, we will continue updating and improving them. We will create new content for them on a regular basis, this is just the start.
Of course, we cannot live from air, if the Princesses  for preschool and our educational games won't grow in visibility, we need to start freelancing in other activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what we're doing or if you want to help us with our dreams, regardless how much interest you have in the Princesses  for preschool, then please help us the following ways. 

  • Use Indiegogo share tools to spread the world
  • Tell your friends about the Princesses  for preschool
  • Like and follow us in Social Media
  • When the game is released, try the game or give them a child to try it out.
  • Send us your suggestions about the game, so we can continuously improve the game.

Thank you all for your time and support.
story_txt:
Short SummaryWhy the Idea

We want to create quality educational contents and facilitate the learning process. Our goal is to combine learning with having fun and so contribute to improve the learning techniques used in schools today. We use technology as a learning tool, because children learn best when they play, plus they love technology.
With our teaching experience, we create quality content suited to the individual development of each child.

With our games, we display the contents to the child in a simple and attractive way, improving the teaching methods used in schools.
Our inspiration are our children, we watch them play games, and we want to make quality games for all the children.
Game Description
Princesses for preschool is a project of  ITSimples Games where we create educational preschool video games for girls.

Princesses for preschool has features that will amaze every preschool girl from 3 to 6 years old. 
It has magic, princesses, fairies, among other amazing elements that are there to inspire the child's creativity and imagination.
We approach educational themes, such as letters, numbers, nature, healthy food choices, colors, music, sequences, among others,  in a simple and attractive way, with the main purpose to give the child a great time while learning at the same time. 
The Princesses for preschool game pack will be available on English, German and Portuguese.
The child gets rewarded for playing
For every learning game the child plays, she will receive hearts, that are the exchange coin in the game. 
She can exchange in-game earned hearts for dress-up items in the dress-up game. 
The child needs to play the learning games, in order to obtain her own hearts. 
It is not possible to buy hearts with money, because we think this is a bad practice in a learning game for children and the child needs to struggle and earn her own hearts. 
Meet the free princesses and the free games
Fairy Agnes and the Dress-up Game





Fairy Agnes is the main Princess of the Game, she will have a dress-up game associated. 


Princess Vitoria and the Letters Game





Princess Vitoria represents letters, the child can paint random letters from the alphabet with a flower texture. 

Princess Sofia and the Nature Game






Princess Sofia represents Nature, the child can solve a puzzle game made with nature elements.
Princess Maria and the Fruits and Vegetables Game


Princess Maria represents Fruits and Vegetables, the child needs to catch sequences of falling fruits and vegetables.
Princess Joana and the Animals Game




Princess Joana represents Animals, the child needs to feed the animals with the right food.



The Full Version Princesses
Princess Anna and the Music Game



Princess Anna represents Emotions, we mix color with music, and the child is challenged by reproducing sequences of tones associated to their colours. The child can hear and choose the sounds of different instruments.
Princess Leila and the Numbers Game



Princess Leila represents the Numbers, the child can learn the numbers by counting how many objects there are, add and subtract with objects, and match the numbers in the right form. 
Princess Silvana and the Forms Game



Princess Silvana represents Forms, the child can identify the different forms by clicking on the right ones.


What we've already achieved

We created the structure for the game with the princesses. Except for the princess Ines dress-up game and the Forms game,  the Princesses are already functional. 

Please watch some gameplay videos representing the Numbers Game and the Music Game. More videos of the development are available at the youtube channel and the Indiegogo campaign gallery.


Release date and future of the Princesses

The first release will be in March 2015 for android.
The Princesses game will be constantly improved and updated, we want to improve also some of the game features.
Team
We are two parents and game developers with teaching background experience and degree in Informatics Engineering. 

    Francisco Fernandes - Young spirit, creative and innovative, I like challenges!
    Carla Ventura - Ambitious dreamer and action oriented, I'm ready!

The characters art are designed by Rui Antunes a very talented designer. 
The music was produced by Bruno Alves from Associação Tempos Brilhantes.
Distribution
Our market will be International mobile and web. Princesses will be available for download first at 
and after Google Play, it will be adapted to iPad and available on the App Store


The Princesses will be free for download with many free features and games, you can have all Princesses if you purchase the full game version. 
The princesses demo will be available in a web version soon for any person who wants to try the game out.

What this project means to us 

This project is our life project. We are parents of two children , a boy with 1 year old and a girl wit 5 years old. We also worked with children directly in schools and preschools, it is a dream coming true, being able to contribute to and work for children. We want to facilitate the learning process by giving the child the tools to learn by herself and having fun at the same time.

We want to give back to the community
For each Princesses game – full version sold, 0,10€ will be donated to charity institutions which support children.
   
The Impact
Our game will improve the learning methods used in preschool and if we succeed we can help more children by creating quality learning content to them and by helping the community directly.
How you can help us

Contribute with a Donation to our project
You are contributing and helping us if you believe in our vision to create quality learning games.
Select a perk












The Perk #9 - Princess Agnes Handmade doll is being handmade by a fine artist and crafter.
If you have any questions, feel free to ask.
Spread the word

The competition is enormous, there are so many video games out there for the mobile market, that even if we have a quality educational game, the final user will not see our game among all the others available.
So, we ask you to spread the word and share our project with your friends.
How will the funding be used


Company expenses - If the campaign succeeds we'll have to register ITSimples Games to satisfy the taxation and bureaucratic requirements. This adds extra initial and monthly expenses.

Marketing - Marketing the Princesses costs money, we need to register a mark, create a domain, a site for the game, flyers, participate in game or education conferences, among other activities. 

Design - We need to pay the designer for his great work.

Equipment - to develop and test our games.


    Risks & Challenges
If we do nothing, we will not achieve anything. The first step and the hardest one has already been taken - which was to start the project.
We are creators of educational videogames with quality, our main obstacle is to continue creating without getting any revenue, and to continue supporting our expenses.
What can we do while we've not achieved success?
Support the expenses until the Princesses for preschool achieve a high number of downloads, and the revenues cover or pass the expenses taken until that date.
If we will not achieve what we want, we will restart, work hard to overcome our errors and mistakes, which are after all, an excellent form to learn.
We will not create the Princesses  for preschool and let them in a box, we will continue updating and improving them. We will create new content for them on a regular basis, this is just the start.
Of course, we cannot live from air, if the Princesses  for preschool and our educational games won't grow in visibility, we need to start freelancing in other activities.
    Other Ways You Can Help
If you like what we're doing or if you want to help us with our dreams, regardless how much interest you have in the Princesses  for preschool, then please help us the following ways. 

Use Indiegogo share tools to spread the world
Tell your friends about the Princesses  for preschool
Like and follow us in Social Media
When the game is released, try the game or give them a child to try it out.
Send us your suggestions about the game, so we can continuously improve the game.

Thank you all for your time and support.

story:
Harry Houdini. Kesha. Tim Howard. Drew Barrymore. 

Their common link: Hungarian ancestry!


Scratch the surface of an American, and you'll quickly find the Hungarian connection—at most two degrees of separation. Hungarians have contributed to practically every thread in the fabric of America. The Hungarian community in the U.S. is nearly as old as the country itself and numbers 1.5 million.
ReConnect Hungary is a unique cultural, educational and social immersion program for young adults aged 18–26 of Hungarian heritage, born in the U.S. or Canada. The birthright experience sets these young Hungarian Americans on a lifetime journey of understanding their heritage, connecting to each other and the global Hungarian community, fostering their traditions, and giving back to their home communities.

Every summer, a group of individually selected young adults begins a two-week journey of self-discovery to learn about their Hungarian roots in a totally different and new way.The program has been a continuous success since its launch in 2012. To date, 36 participants took part in the program, which has become so popular that last year we had to waitlist 19 applicants until Summer 2015, since the group size is limited and funds for a second trip were lacking.


Reconnecting American youth to their Hungarian roots is our mission. Make it yours!


We hope that with your generous support we will be able to expand the program and fulfill these deserving young people’s dream of discovering their Hungarian self! 


What We Need


ReConnect Hungary is a non-profit, public-private partnership with the Government of Hungary. Participants also contribute a self-pay portion of $1,300. To enhance the “private” part of the partnership, we need more supporters for this unique program! Current funding only allows us to provide this birthright trip to one group of 15 individuals.  

As interest is high, our goal is to raise enough to fund a second trip in 2015, the cost of which is $35,000. We don't want to turn away any deserving candidate!

The total value of the trip is $4,800 per participant, which covers basically everything—all accommodations, meals, transportation, entrance fees, and the pre-trip online orientation package.

If we meet our goal, a second group of lucky young adults will get to delve deeper into the treasures of their ancestral land. But even if we fall short, every dollar raised will be used toward growing and improving the program! 


How You Can Help


A gift of any size makes a difference. Every $5,000 we raise means that another young American or Canadian will have the chance to participate in this life-changing experience!  


Donate $10 to cover one participant’s experience of preparing an open-air meal from start to finish at the groundbreaking biofarm in Zsámbok.


Donate $25 and cover admission for 2 participants to the Széchenyi Thermal Baths, the largest outdoor medicinal bath in Europe since 1913.


Donate $50 and cover admission for 7 participants to the House of Terror—named one of the most powerful museums in Europe by Rick Steves, and the only museum in the world devoted to the victims of both fascism and communism.


Donate $100 and cover admission for a group of 15 to the Hospital in the Rock—a fully equipped and intact secret underground hospital from WWII hidden among six miles of caves and tunnels under Buda’s Castle Hill.


Donate $250 and cover the group’s one-day visit to the artist colony of Szentendre and the Skanzen Open Air Museum or Ópusztaszer Heritage Park, where the participants engage in various folk craft workshops.


Donate $500 and cover all meals for one participant for 2 weeks.


Donate $1,000 and cover the group’s one-day visit (incl. transportation, meals and accommodations) to a Hungarian minority community across the border in Slovakia, Serbia or Croatia.


Donate $5,000 and cover the entire group’s accommodations at City Hostel Budapest for 2 weeks.


Donors contributing $1,000 or more will get a chance to participate in the Welcome Dinner at the General Consulate of Hungary in New York on June 29, 2015, where they can personally meet all the participants and the organizers of the program.


The Impact

                                          Read about us in USA Today.

“Your support for this program reaches into the hearts and minds of young Hungarians who actually want to understand themselves and their families a little better—and that’s a rare thing in this world. This journey lets them do that with other Hungarian-Americans who all want the same thing, which allows an amazing bond to strengthen and creates a sense of community.” Alexandra Makk, 21, Hawai’i 


"ReConnect Hungary was both the trip of a lifetime and the start of something new. I feel a strengthened sense of ownership of the Hungarian spirit." David Bell, 26, Michigan


2014 participants meet State Secretary Árpád Potápi 


Other Ways You Can Help


Please spread the word and share this link with everyone that might be able and willing to help young Americans and Canadians join the growing circle of world citizens proudly reclaiming their Hungarian ancestry! 


For more information and to download our flyer, please visit us at reconnecthungary.org or call us at 1-844-4-MAGYAR.


Thank you for helping us reach the next level with your donation!

story:
Hello!  My name is Marlene Resnick Simons, and I am a children's author, educator, and parenting coach out of sunny Sarasota, Florida.  I am beginning a campaign to launch my series of children's books, and I need your help to realize this goal!

"Thea Dorable's Adventures" is a series of short books and companion videos that engage and empower children in making  healthier choices and better protecting themselves in a variety of situations, from using seat belts to dealing with conflicts. Providing immediately usable information results in new competencies for children. This engenders an excitement about learning to read, as well as sharing their newly learned skills.

The series includes short books and companion animations that range in time from 60 - 90 seconds. They are narrated by Thea Dorable... who is not your ordinary teddy bear!

Thea Dorable provides a broad range of health and safety information orally, visually and with subtitles, which promote early literacy and helps children, who are speakers of other languages learn English. (“Viewing text or captions appears to boost vocabulary acquisition, addressing skill deficits of struggling readers.” Readingrockets.org, article 35793)


******

Titles and Topics (Age Range 2 – 8):

1.  What About Lunch?:  Healthy eating and exercise

2.  Riding in Cars:  Using seat belts

3.  The Little Chicken That Could:  Self-esteem and the importance of learning 

4.  My First Day of School:  Resolving conflicts/Dealing with bullying

5.  Learning to Swim: Water safety for children

6.  Some Little Children Have Asthma:  Helping children to understand the challenges of the condition

7.  Gardens Grow: Growing and appreciating gardening 

8.  When I Get Big: Learning about the importance of rules

9.  A Vegetable’s Journey: Where food comes from

10.  A Day in an Apple Tree: Identifying poison ivy oak and sumac

11.  The Little Girl Who Couldn’t Sit Still:  Re-framing the issue of ADHD

12.  When I was Three: Learning and growing

Three of these books have been piloted in a Head Start Reading Program, with parents reading to their children. They were also piloted with first grade students, who after learning the rhyming text brought the books home to share with their families. In a school with 92% of children on the free or reduced lunch program and 60% in families where English was the second language, the children dramatically increased the use of seat belts for themselves, their teenaged siblings and their parents. In addition, children talked about the importance of healthy eating and exercise.

The point of view is that children are powerful catalysts in the arena of learning and in disseminating their knowledge and skills to family members and friends.



******


RELATIONSHIP - RELEVANCE - RIGOR:  The 3 R’s that truly make a difference in literacy outcomes...

Relationship – Connecting parents, children and teachers, connecting classroom and home

Relevance – Providing children with immediately usable information that they see as valuable

Rigor – Incorporating the literacy technique of scaffolding - the use of language a step above children’s current level of reading -  presented by a more experienced reader.



*******



TESTIMONIALS:

“These books combine the best strategies that brain research offers us to get young children excited about what they can do for themselves to be healthy and safe. In the process, they also get excited about becoming better readers. This is a far more effective approach than trying to undo years of accumulated bad habits and missed learning opportunities.” -  Daniel Watts, MD, Family Practice and Gynecology


“This is exactly what we are trying to teach; only it’s beautiful and it rhymes.” -  Nutrition Department review, Sarasota County Schools


“This book is beautifully illustrated, engaging and  easy for kids to follow and understand.  It delivers an important message. Congratulations!     I recommend it to all programs that deal with  preventing childhood obesity.” - Michael Hutton, Ph.D., Blue Foundation for a Healthy Florida


“Great delivery of very important information for kids. Find a way to get these  books into their hands.” - Norman Goldstein MD - Beloved Sarasota pediatrician



*******

BIO

Author and creator, Marlene Resnick Simons has more than 25 years of experience training teachers, parents, school administrators and other professionals in guiding children to become cooperative and responsible members of their families, classrooms and communities.

She is the author of If Only They Came With Instructions, A Guide for Parents, promoted by Healthy Families America. She also authored An Early Childhood Educators’ Guide to Parent Involvement. She taught in The College of Education at the University of South Florida for eight years, specializing in Child, Family, Teacher Relations.

She has authored more than 30 short books for children with a focus on health, safety and social skills for children. Those that you see are the first three to be illustrated and in print.

The books are based on the best of brain research regarding how children learn and what motivates children.

Marlene has a Master’s Degree in Family Studies from Goddard College, was trained at the Program on Negotiation at Harvard Law School and participated in a Ph.D. program in public policy and child welfare at Union Institute for three years.

She is a mother, grandmother and long distance swimmer and an accomplished grant writer. She lives in Sarasota, Florida with her husband, Dr. Clifford Simons.

WHY THIS PROJECT?

This project grew out of a concern for so many children, who with a bit of information and some skills, can dramatically improve their health, safety and survival in a broad variety of situations.

These books are supported by companion videos of 90 seconds each, which reinforce the books, as well as promote literacy. The books are short, beautifully illustrated and rhyme. They are perfect for classroom learning where children become familiar with the text and then bring the books home to share with family members.

The results of a pilot study, in one community, using the book “Riding In Cars” follows. How many lives were saved? How many injuries were prevented?

{{{Before and After Results of Seatbelt Use, for First Grade Students, with the book “Riding In Cars”....

Before Books:

79% of children used seatbelts

After Books: 

100% of children used seatbelts

Among Adults in homes of those children:

Before Books:

40% of adults used seatbelts

After books: 

75% of adults used seatbelts}}}

story:
Most parents and students of all ages in the USA today are ill-informed as to the complex systems and criteria that colleges use for evaluating applications, calculating financial aid, and ultimately deciding who is accepted and how much financial they will receive.  For parents, it’s like walking into a casino for the first time, not knowing what the games are or how to play the games, and not knowing how to win much less the odds of winning.  As a result, they can easily lose a lot of money quickly and maybe even jeopardize their own financial future.  What they didn’t know is the odds favor the house.

In too many cases, this parallel applies to the college systems as well - Parents and students will either find the application process to be just too overwhelming or will find the costs to be prohibitively high and not even apply; or, they will make the journey with an inflated personal investment, but jeopardize their entire financial future and lifestyle with enormous loan debt.

CFA’s proven proactive SmartPlanTM system revolutionizes the way parents and students of all ages can now approach these college systems.  By empowering them with knowledge and a comprehensive support structure furnished by CFA, they can literally turn the tables on the house in their favor so students can attend their chosen college with the least amount debt for the student and parents alike. 

Change the game – Remove the barriers to success and create new opportunities for students to reach for the stars.  Change the game – Parents can have Peace of Mind  knowing that their financial future is secure and their children have unchained opportunities to make the world a better place!

By College Funding of America (CFA)

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

The SmartPlanTM  systematic approach has been field tested over a three year period and the results have been phenomenal. 

Working with communities, we provide a Free One Hour College Planning Workshop to parents of high school students at community centers, schools, and other public (non-commercial) meeting areas.  At these workshops, they receive valuable information about the internal workings of each of the college systems – Selection, Applications, Financial Aid, Evaluation, and Awards. 

As part of our agreement with communities, each workshop participant is also invited to participate in a Free One Hour Private Consultation with a Senior College Planning Advisor (a $175 value) to discuss their specific family challenges, needs, and overall situation.  In the private consultation, the also receive additional specific knowledge, a preliminary estimate of their Expected Family Contribution (EFC) to their student's education, and a basic road map (GPS) as to what they need to do to maximize their probability of success within each system. 

At this point, parents are empowered and have the knowledge to manage the systems on their own if they choose to do so.  They can also request assistance from CFA if appropriate (no obligation) to help them with some or all of the challenges that they will encounter in support of their goals. Some of the typical reasons why parents request assistance are:

  • Time Available - With everything going on their life, parents don't have time to study & learn nuances, focus their attention, and/or implement a strategy - Parents both working and students in activities (especially single Moms);

  • Late Start, Time Crunch – Student is a senior in high school and college planning process just beginning to be a priority for parents;

  • Overwhelming – Parents overwhelmed already and fear of failing their children; and/or,

  • Parents or child think that there is no hope of getting a post-high school education.

CFA offers a number of support services packages at affordable rates that can assist the parents and further improve the parents and students chances of success throughout all four years of college beginning as early as the student’s high school freshmen year and lasting through the four years of college.  Siblings are automatically eligible to receive a substantial discount for the same services.

If required, CFA can also act as their authorized agent in managing every aspect of the entire college process and provide personal coaching to the students and the parents. 

It should be noted that everything that CFA does can also be directly applied to adults who want to start or just finish their college degree and also for those who have a degree but want to continue to expand the credentials with at the graduate level including medical school, etc.

The demand for this valuable information and support is growing exponentially as more parents are seeking answers and a pathway forward.  This project is designed to take this CFA SmartPlanTM system to the next level to satisfy that demand. 

By reaching more families and students and empowering them with both knowledge and support that they may need to confront the challenges imposed by the college systems, we know that we can have a significant positive impact on their lives and help them avoid unnecessary debt.

For students of all ages, it can be the difference between getting a college education and being saddled with debt for 10 - 20 years OR getting into the college that they want and graduating with the minimum manageable student loans. 

For parents and students - it is Peace of Mind!

Funding from this project will be used to expand the reach of the CFA SmartPlanTM program to be inclusive of parents and students of all ages across the entire country.  It will include two primary areas of focus:

  1. Expand the number of in-person local community workshops and support structure to support that demand; and,

  2. Implement a secure mirrored duplication of the in-person workshops and private consultations that are facilitated on-line by a CFA Professional Advisor. 

This is will allow us to reach out to more people In a shorter period of time and make it more inclusive, especially for those who live in rural areas of the country.

We know that we can make positive contributions to solving the challenges that prospective students and their parents face in the college systems. We believe that if we can help more people have the opportunity to get a college education, they will be empowered to not only pursue their dreams and career path but, as a result, they will be empowered and capable to solve society’s challenges social, economic, and environmental challenges for the greater good.  Perhaps one of these aspiring students will find the cure for cancer, develop a viable plan to solve poverty issues, solve complex environmental issues, or create a magnificent piece of music or art.

We welcome your support to empower parents and students so they take charge of their future.

Join us on this journey.  The clock is ticking not only for this campaign but for the futures of many!  Your donation will be most appreciated and you can select a special reward for your generosity.

CFA SmartplanTM  Get into College, Not Debt


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

CFA recognizes that there may be some challenges and risks along the way as we scale-up this program to a national level and we have put in place a viable plan to meet them.

1. Potential Risk (low-medium) - Demand may exceed capacity to support and provide quality service.

Risk Abatement

CFA has in-place a comprehensive Advisor SmartPlanTM Certification program which includes any applicable compliance issues.  This two-week program enables CFA to ramp-up the number of outbound servicing Certified SmartPlanTM Advisors in manner can expand to support the demand.

For those consumers who prefer in-person meetings in an office environment, CFA has established a network of offices on-demand in major cities in all 50 states.


2. Potential Risk (low) - Consumer dissatisfaction with services rendered.

Risk Abatement

CFA provides a written satisfaction money-back guarantee for services rendered.

Although this guarantee has not been used to-date by the clients that we serve, we believe it is a sound business practice to be prepared.  CFA has established a financial warranty reserve account to handle these situations in the unlikely event that they do occur.  The account is has been and will continue to be funded as a percentage of revenue acquired.


3. Potential Risk (very low) – US Government pays for college education for all high school students

Risk Abatement

CFA believes that this is extremely low probability of occurrence.  However, in the event that it does occur, most consumers will still depend on CFA for services for the application and admissions systems as well as to help their children to be successful in the in life.


PATRON AWARDS, DISCLOSURE

The purpose of Patron Rewards is to give back to the community and enable those families and students with economic challenges to obtain the same type of the counseling services as those who are financially more secure - This will provide a pathway for the students to get a college education and follow their dreams.

The Patron Rewards will be added to the College Funding of America Community Goodwill Program wherein the company provides the equivalent of three percent (3.00 %) of the after-tax profit each fiscal year to the communities that the company serves.

The Community Goodwill Program will require that all recipients be certifiable as either a Permanent Resident of the USA or a Citizen of the USA. Students and their families must both meet these criteria to be eligible.

story:
Our Goal

There is a global gap in education technology. Not all children are privileged enough to have a meaningful education. We want to bridge the gap and give these students the opportunity to receive the new global standard of education.
We believe that every boy and girl is entitled to a bright future and should not be hindered by the educational resources.  In places like the Democratic Republic of Congo, youth do not receive any practical computer training necessary to be competitive in the global economy. With the help of the Indiegogo community we want to give these children the future they deserve.


Our Plan


Through the development of an Educational Technology Centre (ETC), Nyantende Foundation will enhance the accessibility of computers and the Internet for the upper-level students it enrolls at local secondary schools in eastern DR Congo. The goal is to offer an extra-curricular, after-school program where students attain the vital technological skills their current education system cannot afford to provide them with. By teaching its sponsored students how, for example, to use word processing software, make excel sheets and navigate the Internet, Nyantende Foundation is providing students with some additional skills required to succeed in the modern, global economy.


The Educational Technology Centre 


Why build an Educational Technology Centre? 

In order to be competitive and informed in a technology driven, society, all Congolese students deserve basic computer literacy training. Having a practical understanding of computer technology enables access to more job opportunities and increases employable assets.

Nyantende Foundation has secured a centralized location at Adora College along with two qualified instructors with proven computer skills to act as coordinators. Nyantende Foundation will implement an after-school program to improve the students’ technological competency.


What will you teach?

The program will consist of three learning modules exploring different aspects of computers and the Internet. The first will introduce the students to the hardware and teach proper handling skills. The second will instruct students on basic software operating skills, such as navigating the desktop and using Microsoft Office. The third will focus on the Internet, more specifically, how to communicate, learn, and explore online. Upon accepting their offer to attend ETC classes, students will receive a curriculum workbook created by the Foundation exclusivlely for use by the ETC.

Although the initial impact of the project focuses on individual skill development for the students, over time, the ETC will become open to the public and other students in the community. The project will be implemented and evaluated over the course of one year. 


Our Story

Nyantende Foundation is a grassroots non-profit corporation established in 2010 at Queen’s University by two former undergraduate students and a Congolese refugee studying at St. Lawrence College in Kingston, Ontario. Each year since its initial ratification at Queen’s University, Nyantende Foundation has successfully continued to develop its domestic operations and increase its positive impact on Nyantende. Nyantende Foundation currently enrols 229 boys and girls in 15 primary, secondary and post-secondary schools throughout Nyantende and the surrounding area. It is registered as an official non-profit corporation in the provinces of Ontario, Canada and South Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo.

One of the reasons the Co-Founders felt compelled to start this organization was out of disenchantment with the big, multinational non-profits on the Queen’s campus. Organizations like UNICEF and World Vision, really couldn’t offer their volunteers the feeling of fulfillment everyone doing charity work inherently desires. It has always been the goal of Nyantende Foundation to ensure that everyone involved, regardless of their position, derives the same level of gratification and fulfillment from helping to enroll 200+ orphans in school.

The organization continues to be run by a small group of university students and funds go directly to the cause. No one is paid except our one Congolese Director of Operations who, with his $100/month is able to live above the poverty line and support his family.



Why in the Congo


The Eastern Region of Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) is an area of Central Africa regularly plagued by turmoil. The country is geographically large and with decades of stagnant and ineffective governance, many of its remote interior regions have been overtaken by various rebel militias. This has resulted in periods of lasting violence and instability directly harming communities across the country.

Over the last ten years however, and certainly since the formation of Nyantende Foundation in 2010, a selection of urban areas in Eastern Congo have witnessed an economic resurgence. Many people have returned to their homes there and new government contracts with companies like Canada’s Manitoba Hydro International promises new advances in civil infrastructure. What is now required is a complete social re-invigoration plan beginning with the education system.

According to UNICEF (2013), each year 77% of boys and 72% of girls in DRC enter into primary school. These numbers are significantly reduced for secondary school participation whereby only 35% of boys and 28% of girls attend. Internet access is limited to less than 2% of the overall population, suggesting that access to modern technology, including what is available in classrooms across the country is highly uncommon.

The quality of life for those living in DRC cannot begin to develop unless its youngest, freshest minds are off the streets and in classrooms. In addition, for the next generation of Congolese youth to be competitive in the workforce, they must have skills valuable to a modernizing economy, such as the capacity to communicate online, produce word documents, excel sheets, powerpoint presentations, and to print, scan and send documents.

In 2003, the Congolese Ministry of Education introduced computer technology into their curriculum stating that it is a national priority to begin educating youth in the area of information technology. Unfortunately, in addition to their dilapidated structural condition, many of DRC’s underfunded schools can neither afford to purchase computers, nor set up a power supply to utilize them. Thus, most students remain without access to what has become a critical area of student learning.


Why We Need Your Help


There are various, basic needs the room at Adora must be outfitted with in order to meet the ETC’s requirements, like tables, lockable cabinets and lights. Of these initial investments, installing and maintaining a reliable power source and wireless internet connection are expected to account for the highest percentage of start up funds. However, significant progress has already been achieved.

As part of the preliminary fundraising campaign during the first quarter of 2015, Nyantende was successful at delivering three laptop/tablet hybrid computers (Acer Switch Aspires) to the team to begin their training with the models. In addition, after preliminary discussions with the director of Adora College, immediate repairs were initiated on the prospective classroom’s interior. These included the installation of a solid, lockable door, completing cement work on the walls, and reinforcing the roof with a drop-down ceiling.



Creating and maintaining the Education Technology Centre is no small task. Here are what our expenses will look like.


Capital Expenditures

The hardware and software used at Education Technology Centre will be:

  • $3,065
Learning supplies, classroom fixtures, and power supply equipment will be:

  • $9,617
Therefore our Capital Expenditures come to a subtotal of:

  • $12,685

Operational Expenditures 
Internet usage and daily use of power supply equipment  will be approximately:
  • $6,000
Staff salaries will be:
  • $1,310
Therefore our Operational Expenditures come to a subtotal of:
  • $7,310
This brings us to a grand total of $19,995 to construct and maintain the Education Technology Centre for its trial phase.

FAQ

  • If you are a Canadian organization, why is this campaign raising money in US dollars?
Similar to Canada, the DR Congo actually accepts US dollars in addition to its own national currency. Unfortunately, the DR Congo does not accept Canadian dollars. As a majority of the costs associated with implementing the ETC will be paid for in USD, it is in the organization's best interest to maintain consistency in its budget planning and take donations in USD. 
  • Can I receive a tax receipt for my donation?
In order to receive a tax receipt, before donating you must first email nyantendefoundation@gmail.com 
  • What will happen to my donation if the ETC does not reach its fundraising goal?
As seen above, building the Education Technology Centre will not be easy.  If we are not able to raise the full amount needed then the construction process will be slowed or halted as we try to gather the funds to continue.  This will push back the Education Technology Centre's date of completion until we have raised the necessary funds.

story:
This is What Fixing the Debt Looks Like

Compact for America Education Foundation has the educational team to end the endless borrowing and mortgaging of our future. Who are we? Watch the video and see. We have an unmatched team of nationally known current and former legislators, constitutional scholars, historians, economists, fiscal policy and national security experts. 

The Impact

Nothing less than the preservation of our Republic is at stake. Why? Because so long as DC has a limitless credit card that never has to be repaid:

  • Priorities will never be set.
  • Programs will never be sustainable.
  • Unprincipled politicians will buy votes with boondoggles.
  • Principled politicians will be corrupted.
  • Federal overreach will be unstoppable.
  • Waste, fraud and abuse in government will spiral out-of-control.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign bluntly seeks funding in the exact dollar amount of our barebones 2016 budget for educating 15 states and DC on the most plausible push to cut Congress' credit card underway-the Compact for a Balanced Budget.

Please donate whatever you can afford!

Compact for America Educational Foundation has a "Gold" rating by Guidestar.

Only 7% out of nearly 40,000 non-profit organizations achieve the GuideStar Exchange Gold rating.
