story:
When we all speak the same language, integration has been done.


Every day thousands of refugees arrive in germany.

Do we really help them as soon as the arrive?


ONEWORLDINTEGRATION supports refugees to get integrated. We help them to learn our language. With your contribution we offer professional psychological support, language and integration courses for refugees. These services are free for refugees. 

What we offer:

A perspective for refugees!

With your contribution we build support centers in several cities in Germany (depends on the total contribution) and offer following services:

- Psychological support:

Their journey has been stressful and they experienced worse things. They arrive exhausted and burned out. They have to talk with psychologists about their experiences.

- Useful integration courses. Learning by doing!

Experience our culture. Learn what western mentality really is all about. Experience democracy and demography and understand how we live.

Half day courses with excursion. Full day courses 6 x 45 min and a maximum of 10 participants. Private lessons with 50 min.

- None crowded language courses. We offer courses with small groups!

Think about yourself: It would be easy for you to learn a new language in a small group. Interactive learning on the computer and specially adapted language courses. 

Full day courses 6 x 45 min and a maximum of 10 participants. Private lessons with 50 min. Individual lessons for refugees with language weakness.

We also try to offer food in those courses.

Our goal is to integrate refugees faster than ever! Give them a perspective and a chance to process their experiences. Nothing is worser than being homeless and marginalized.

We are in the planning phase until our crowdfunding ends.


What you get:




To be honest:

I´m shocked about the fact that my country has split into two groups: Most of the population understands that we have to help those people. But more and more people show their real face: They demonstrate against the admittance of refugees. Refugee institutions are set on fire. This is not acceptable!

We can`t sent them back. They`re going to be killed and murdered in their old country. Their homes have been burnt down. What they had is destroyed forever. 
All they have is their clothes and smartphones.

In order to live peacefully together in this country, we need to understand each other and speak the same language.

We have to give them a voice!


Think about yourself:

What would you do if there`s war in your country? You`re home is destroyed. Your family and friends are dead and your children kidnapped.

We would all escape!

We would all hope that a country gives us the opportunity to start a new and peaceful life.

Give them a chance to speak our language. Give them a voice and let them learn how we live our western mentality.

---

When we all speak the same language, communicate with each other and respect each other integration has been done.

ONEWORLDINTEGRATION can`t support and help all of those refugees. But we can integrate a lot of people and help them to weather their past.

Help us to integrate these people in our country and give them the opportunity to start a new life! We are one world. We are ONEWORLDINTEGRATION! 



About myself:

My name is Fabian Heuken. I´m 30 years old and married. Next to Matthias Heuken i´m one of the founders from ONEWORLDINTEGRATION.  I`m an entrepreneur and I live in Karlsruhe, a city with 300.000 citizens in southern germany.

How did I get the idea:

Whenever I´m on the way to my office I pass asylum institutions and buildings where refugees live. I see hopeless and exhausted people in the streets. That makes me sad.

I´m mad about the fact that they can`t live like normal people until their asylum wis approved.

I visited asylum insitutions and recognized, that those people have no perspective. They`re sitting arround and can`t do anything. They can`t apply for a job or visit integration courses until their asylum applications is approved. This is not acceptable! They want to work and live in europe like normal people. I want to change this fact!

I didn`t want to donate charities where only a small amount of money arrives at those people.

What I bring up by myself:

I`m going to invest all my time in this project. I´m working with my team to execute all those plans. I support this project with 1.000 euro.

What happens with your money:

We set up new support centers for refugees in several cities. We`re going to pay teachers and psychologics. We offer healthy food and take care of those people.

We offer individual psychological  lessons, group courses in German and English and group integration courses. These services are free for the refugees.

What happens if the full amount is not reached:

We`re going to start this project in any case and work with all financial resources. 
If we collect more money, we can help more people. And they need our help!


Some facts:

What the media tells us:

Millions of people flee due to destruction, persecution and war from their homes.

Families leave their destroyed villages and homes. Those people do not travel by car or train. They walk all the way trough Jordan and pay a lot of money for illegal tugs. In the hope of a better life without fear, war and persecution they cross the Mediterranean sea in small and  crowded dinghies to reach the EU. Many of them are exhausted and distraught when they arrive.

Refugees get picked up at the german border and brought by car or bus to collection points. Most of them need to continue their walk in germany. They get registered at these collection points.

Some of them have to stay in unheated tent camps. Others stay in old barracks or other buildings. Hundreds of them live there. They sleep on the floors and the worst thing is: There are not enough toilets or washrooms. This is pure torture, especially for the children.

After a few weeks they get an interview with authorities. During this time they don`t know what their future will be like in germany. But it takes even more months until they know if can stay in germany.

In 2015 1.500.000 refugees are expected to come to germany. 30 % of them are younger than 18 years.

10.000 of them arrive in germany every day. In the european union, germany ist the only country that allows so many refugees to stay.

81.000.000 people live in germany. 8.200.000 of them are foreign citizens. Germany has always been a country of immigration.

What really happens after their arrival:

As soon as they pass the border they can go to any public agency or police station to give an asylum application.

First they have to stay in special instiutions: Fenced areas that include police-stations, doctors and dorms for hundred of people. They get distributed to our federal states based on a distribution key.


Then they get registered. Every single one has to explain why he escaped from his home. They receive a permit of residence until a decision has been done about their asylum application.

After weeks in those instiutions they get assigned to local cities, based on another distribution key. The accomodation is not always the same: Some of them live in their own apartment, others in camps.

This is another psychological distress after all they have experienced. And certainly not what they expected by the western world.

What was offered so far:

As soon as their asylum application is accepted they have to take part in integration courses. Main part of the course is to learn the german language. Those courses are organised by the german government. All others have to take  care and pay for those courses for themselves. But they don`t have the money – they are not allowed to work and earn money.

- Refugees have to wait months until their application for asylum is approved.

- During this time they are not allowed to take part in a integration course and they are not allowed to apply for a job.

- Not every refugee has the right to take part in an integration course.

- Refugees have to pay 1.20 € per hour for courses that are organized by the government. But they don`t have the money, they are not allowed to work and earn money until they complete the course.

- Main part of the 600 hours course is learning the german language.

- They have to wait too long until they get a confirmation to take part in a course.

- Those courses are overcrowded.

- They learn small parts about our culture. There is no psychological support.

- There are only few volunteers. Most donations are submitted in the form of clothes and food.

Our government is changing laws quickly. But that won`t help anything. There isn`t much staff which can implement those laws.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

For English klick here: http://education-for-life.ch/ban-pa-nor-initiative/

40% der Bevölkerung in Laos haben noch nie eine Schule besucht. In nördlichen Provinzen sind es mehr als 60%.

Wir vom gemeinnützigen Verein "Education for Life" wollen dies ändern. In dem von den Minderheiten der "Khmu" bewohnten Dorf Ban Pa Nor in der Nähe von Luang Prabang im nördlichen Laos wurde bisher mit Hilfe privater Engagements und unserer Spenden eine Schule neu aufgebaut, die Trinkwasserversorgung verbessert, Mittagessen für die teilweise unterernährten Schulkinder organisiert, Schulmaterialien besorgt und Schulgebühren bezahlt. 

Damit die Schule künftig auch ohne Spenden betrieben werden kann, alle Kinder nachhaltigen Zugang zu einer Grundbildung erhalten, lesen und schreiben lernen, braucht das Dorf mehr Einkommen. Dorf- und Frauenrat von Ban Pa Nor haben entschieden, Blumenzucht und -verkauf auszuweiten - möglichst auf eine Hektare. Dazu braucht es Wasser, sprich eine Wasserleitung von der Quelle zu den Blumenbeeten, eine mit erneuerbarer Energie betriebene Pumpe, eine Bewässerungsanlage - und Ihre Unterstützung! 

Helfen Sie mit, die Finanzierung für eine Wasserleitung und ein ökologisches Bewässerungssystem auf die Beine zu stellen. Helfen Sie mit, diese kleine Projektfinanzierung Realität werden zu lassen, sodass Schulbetrieb und das ganze Dorf wirtschaftlich nachhaltig und spendenunabhängig werden.

Details

Wir brauchen 10'000EUR für das Bewässerungssystem, das sich wie folgt zusammensetzt:

-  300 Meter lange Wasserleitung aus einer tieferliegenden Quelle zu den Blumenbeeten

- Bewässerungssystem für die über eine Hektare angelegten Blumenbeete

- Wasserpumpe

- Photovoltaik / Solarzellen für den Antrieb der Wasserpumpe

Die Dorfbewohner legen die Beete selbst an. Die Bewässerungskomponenten werden von lokalen Zulieferern beschafft. 

Sollte das Fundingziel nicht erreicht werden, dann fliessen die Finanzmittel trotzdem in dieses Projekt. Wir sammeln, bis die Bewässerungsanlage steht.

Die Folgen

Mit insgesamt nur 10'000EUR wird eine Schule und ein ganzes Dorf mit 500 Einwohnern wirtschaftlich, sozial und ökologisch nachhaltig aufgestellt. Das Projekt hat Modellcharakter und soll planmässig auf umliegende Dörfer übertragen werden.

Bitte helfen Sie mit, dieses Projekt bekannt zu machen. Im Namen der wissbegierigen Kinder in Ban Pa Nor bedanken wir uns ganz herzlich für Ihr Engagement!

Spenden an Education for Life sind in der Schweiz ganz sicher und in Nachbarländern je nach Steuerbehörde von den Steuern absetzbar.

DANKE für Ihre Weiterempfehlung und Unterstützung!

story:
I visited this school in Kenya two months ago as it is doing a great work in rural Kenya. They are helping students who come from extremely poor families get an education and better life with food everyday and full boarding.  The school started three years ago and it has over two hundred pupils from 3 years old's up to 10. While I was there I gave out some prizes to the highest achieving pupils and said that we would be helping them by getting solar in there school, that way we would eradicate the need for dangerous kerosene.

 

The school performs very well both in academic, extra curricular and in sports. 30 pupils who come from extremely poor communities get free education and free board at the school with others that are supplemented. The families are extremely poor and cannot afford to have the children educated however at the school all their needs are provided. They have been supported fully with both board, food and activities that normally they wouldn't be able too do, due to the poverty their families are in.

My organisation GeNNex were going to be setting up a solar facility where we would replicate a project we run in the UK, which teaches youth how to design and build working Solar Lanterns. 

 

I was deeply, deeply moved to learn that the school boarding burnt down. They had to clear out several teaching classrooms and allow the children to sleep on the floor.

 

 

The fire has caused a huge delay to our project and we have to now address the immediate need which is to get the boarding rooms rebuilt and classrooms back in working order. 

The costs to rebuild the boarding is high, and in the region of 1 million Kenyan Shillings about £6500.00.

I am really reaching out to you all. We are in the 21st century children shouldn't have to use candles and kerosene to do their school work. Imagine if it were your son or daughter?

Please help us to rebuild this school we will be very grateful.

There are 3 million deaths per year and are attributed to indoor smoke from bio fuels such as cooking and used for light. If you can help we would really appreciate it. Looking for a team of fundraisers.

‪#‎HelpUsEndEnergyPoverty‬ #RunOnSun @gennex_

The name of the school is Bishop Ndambuki Education Centre, PO Box 94990100, Machakos, Kenya, Africa.

 

Please contact me via Facebook or twitter: @nathanielpeat or @gennex_ Nathaniel Peat.

story:
This was created by a friend who knows I am always the first to lend a helping hand, who knows with this move I could use one. Please take the time to read, share & hopefully donate. I am also looking for "proud partners" meaning contractors  electricians, plumbers, etc. to help with the build out to try & keep costs down. If  the build comes in under the money raised, all the extra money raised will go directly into "Helping Us Help Others". It'll go toward funds for the Food Bank Program & School Supplies Program among many of our other charitable efforts. With a Business model of trying to bring back a sense of community, there's no better name for this than Jay's Unity Project !

   Jay's Unity Project is an initiative to help a local business take the next big step towards achieving their goals. Thus, improving the local community in the process. But we can't do it alone. Help us in Renewing Our Sense of Community and continue our mission of Changing The World, One Cheesesteak At A Time! Please join us to make this dream a reality!

    

  Driven by a desire to grow a business into a vehicle for creating positive change, Jay's Steak & Hoagie Joint has become much more than just a Cheesesteak Shop. As a business, Jay's Joint provides quality food that's been voted the best in the area  3 years in a row . The owner, Jason Green, has used his business to fuel his desire to improve the local community & provide much more than delicious food for his customers. Donations to local charities & integrating ways to help others is built into their business operations. Now all that Jay has built & the future of his mission is in grave jeopardy.

  One huge obstacle has emerged creating the urgency to get JUP going full force- HIS LANDLORD!

   For years, Jay has struggled with his landlord to get leaks fixed on the roof which have caused expensive damage to his equipment, to repair a pothole-plagued parking lot that deters customers & a laundry list of other property issues that have seriously hurt his business. Despite all this, Jay's Joint has been the most robust business in the shopping center since he bought it over a decade ago. A few months ago, Jay confronted the landlord again about fixing the roof & some other minor property issues. Rather than doing what is right & taking care of the property & it's tenants, the landlord stubbornly lashed out. He told Jay he would refuse to renew his lease in June, 2016.

  Jay's hands are now tied by a landlord who won't renew his lease. He's facing the nightmare of permanently closing his doors this Summer. Or… somehow finding a way to raise enough money to help  fund a relocation.  EVERYTHING JAY HAS BUILT, ALL OF HIS CHARITABLE EFFORTS IN THE COMMUNITY & THE LIVELIHOOD OF HIS EMPLOYEES ARE CRITICALLY AT RISK!

         


   After months of back-breaking searches for a new location, Jay has found one that would not only accommodate the business needs but take them to a whole new level. They have only one obstacle- money! The new location is literally 300 yards up the street from his current location enabling him to maintain his existing loyal customer base & continue to grow. But a complete restaurant build out is needed.  The Property has. Sat empty for years but was previously a. wall paper store not a restaurant.  Moving to this new spot is a gateway to Jay's ultimate dream of building a completely self-funded not-for-profit business. Something where all of the profits would  be used to  helping people and businesses  in the local community. Supporting JUP is your way to become part of something bigger than yourself.

  So, we're asking you to help Jay & his staff do what few corporations & businesses care to do: Run a business for the benefit of the community rather than pocketing their profits.

  Jay's Unity Project is not just a campaign to help Jay's Joint relocate, it's a chance to save an indispensable local business! It's a rare chance to join a much bigger effort to directly impact your community! You'll not only help a local business take a huge step toward their dreams, but you'll be an integral part of preserving the heart of the neighborhood. Jay's has become a local staple & a huge engine for positive change in the area (http://levittownnow.com/2015/08/18/jays-steak-and-hoagie-joint-people-of-levittown-sandwich-shop-owner-give-back-to-community/). We want you to join us, other local institutions & fellow citizens who are mounting an effort to keep Jay's Joint & their crucial community efforts alive & well.

  Donate to Jay's Unity Project & not only will you help save a local business, but you will cement your place as a force for good in the community!

  See below just a sample of some of the amazing efforts Jay's has been involved in to help benefit their community.

• Over half of the menu is now Gluten-Free & Celiac-Friendly food

• Their in-house Pay It Forward Program

• Shared Meal Programs (feed the homeless every other month)

• Food Bank Program (providing  fresh fruits, veggies and meats for local families in need)

• "Help us Help..." (collecting school supplies, winter goods, clothing, etc. for local kids in need) 

• "Letters for Liam" program at Christmas time benefitting Autism

All of these have been a huge success for the community & the business. They recently added a food truck to host charity fundraisers & many other events.


                            


(see these links for the news stories: http://www.fox29.com/news/local-news/65593210-story,

http://levittownnow.com/2015/08/18/jays-steak-and-hoagie-joint-people-of-levittown-sandwich-shop-owner-give-back-to-community/

buckscountycouriertimes.com/videos/eat-this/videos/chuck-thomas/eat-this-jay-s-steak-and-hoagie-joint/html_de51fcaf-bad7-5ec6-a410-426b18995c77.html

 Jay's staff, the benefeciaries of their community programs & all of their loyal customers hope you'll join us in helping Jay take them to the next level!
story_txt:
This was created by a friend who knows I am always the first to lend a helping hand, who knows with this move I could use one. Please take the time to read, share & hopefully donate. I am also looking for "proud partners" meaning contractors  electricians, plumbers, etc. to help with the build out to try & keep costs down. If  the build comes in under the money raised, all the extra money raised will go directly into "Helping Us Help Others". It'll go toward funds for the Food Bank Program & School Supplies Program among many of our other charitable efforts. With a Business model of trying to bring back a sense of community, there's no better name for this than Jay's Unity Project !

story:
Welcome to Digital Freedom Foundation(DFF) <www.dff.org.in> India, Non Profit Organisation  for digital empowerment of underprivileged through use and development of Free Software.

I am Krishnakant Mane. I  along with Chartered Accountant(CA) Arun Kelkar founded DFF. 
I am a visually disabled (totally blind) software engineer from India.


       http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxKL-Krishnakant-Mane-6309

                                 CA Arun Kelkar


The vision behind setting up this organisation in Mumbai was to initiate and boost digital empowerment of people with blindness and other disabilities and rural community and develop free software.

The unique aspect of this vision is that we make exclusive use of Free /Open Source Software for achieving our goal. The reason behind this approach is to use extremely cost effective and localized software to raise the education and  employment opportunities without putting financial burdens on the said communities and the potential employers. Moreover the proprietary assistive technologies like screen readers are so costly that disabled people or their potential employers find it extremely difficult to afford its procurement, thus significantly lowering the employment of the disabled. Hence Free and Open Source Software(FOSS) becomes the only way in which employment can be made easy and affordable.
I have been advocating the use of FOSS over 12+ years of my experience which makes me believe that there are advantages which I have extensively propagated while working with various government and private organisations.



http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-karnataka/i-am-ashamed-to-use-proprietary-software/article1198012.ece


In addition to training the said underprivileged community for employment we also develop Free and Open Source Software(FOSS) particularly in the field of finance and education .
DFF had a lab till September 2015 where training and development activities mentioned above were carried out on a moderate scale , however we wish to scale up particularly for the employment oriented training of blind community using Free screen readers such as ORCA<https://help.gnome.org/users/orca/stable/> on Linux and NVDA<http://www.nvaccess.org/> on windows.
This would result in large scale employment of visually disabled people in various organisations for a variety of jobs.

GNUKhata: Free Accounting software

 In addition, our efforts in developing  a free, accessible and localized book keeping software for accountants and rural banking, also needs  a proper workplace.
< https://www.gnukhata.in >will give you more details on GNUKhata, the on going project for developing a free book keeping/accounting  software which can also be used by blind people.

Collaboration, Contribution for Digital Freedom

Since all this done on a non profit base we wish to involve different communities and experts in the field of rural education, accessibility and micro finance to further our cause. Thus making it a complete community mission open for all ideas for different people.

Current challenge and need for fund raising

We are now out of workplace due to dearth of funds resulting in non extension of the lease. This has resulted in considerable slowing down of our FOSS development activities and complete halt on the schedule of free training courses for the blind community. For this reason we are doing a fund raising campaign for procuring a new premises for one year to begin with. We understand that given our goals, next one year will be extremely crucial  in making our NGO self sustained.

Utilization of funds

The immediate priority after procurement of the premises would be to speed up the development of the free accounting software(GNUKhata ), starting the IT training courses for the blind community using orca screen reader under the project
Digital Drishti.   

              Digital Drishti (Drishti means sight)

In addition to basic computing and data management we aim to mentor blind programmers and employ them in different companies by creating programming course under my guidance , given my own visual disability and the software engineering background.Thus Digital Drishti will create a major improvement in education, employment and lifestyle of the blind community(estimated population being over 1 million in India).  

              This idea was inspired by a project called "TRUE VISION"


 which was led by yours truly and executed by government of Tamil Nadu (southern state of INDIA).
While the said project aimed at training teachers and high school blind school students in basic computing, we now aim to do this on a larger scale. This would imply that we would train young college students and graduate and make them ready to be employed by various organisations on different jobs.
The funding raised will not just be used for procuring a workplace as well as computers and recording equipments such as condenser mics for creating audio tutorials as a free course material for blind people, developing free course materials for rural IT training and to carry out recurring expenses including internet and electricity bills. This would result in an uninterrupted and comfortable execution of our training and development projects in free and open source software.

              Bare Foot Accountants

In addition with the set-up of the lab premises from the funds raised we will be able to finish developing a major version of the free accounting software thus allowing us to start the Bare Foot Accountants project. in the rural areas of our state.While this program would generate self-employment avenues for the rural youth by learning basic book keeping , it would also help the visually disabled people take commerce base careers(which they could rarely do before) given the accessibility of the said software. 
We understand that nearly training the disabled and rural community will not be sufficient for achieving our goal, however our plan encompasses not just training and development but to showcase the skill-sets to potential employers. Given our expertise in pedagogy in accessibility and finance  we are confidant enough to make a significant start and achieve fair part of our mission in the coming year.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ali and I run 45Storm, I'm an Artist, Activist & Livestreamer based in Glasgow.   
It's been a fantastic 1st year for 45storm and long may it continue .
You a make it work and I thank you sincerely for that !

The aim of 45storm is to give people a voice and to encourage self expression. To create a space where you can freely speak out against the lies and abuse of the government and the manipulation of news in the main stream media. Our new website will be a hub for creative expression with livestreams, interviews, articles, music, poetry, and art. A place where people can share and express their truths, share their experiences, a place where we make the news.

We have the power to create an exciting new media, where we speak truth not lies!

To move forward to the next level I need your help. The crowdfunder will enable me to continue and to create and run the new website, Livestream & YouTube channels and make a short documentary. Now, more than ever, we need a strong alternative media in Scotland that gives a platform to voices of ordinary people and challenges the old broken system. We will also cover issues in the rest of the U.K. and in other parts of the world. Help us create a BRAVE NEW MEDIA!
   

The documentary with be called "IndyRef:: The Afternath". It will include interviews with people who voted Yes and No in the Scottish referendum, and how they feel about being "Better Together". The funds will be used to make the documentary, travel costs to live stream events, equipment, and anything else that helps our cause  ( it does not provide wages to anyone ) All involved are voluntary. Please donate if you can, or contribute by writing something, sharing an experience, photograph, painting, poem or any way you choose to express yourself. 

(DETAILS SOON ON HOW TO SUBMIT ARTICLES ETC)

No matter what, your support , your input and even your presence is appreciated.
We value any help whether monetary or otherwise.
UPDATE: We have just launched our new livestream channel 45Storm LIVESTREAM CHANNEL

story:
Our campaign has now ended. More information, and instructions on how you can donate are here.


If you haven't liked us on facebook, we can be found here.



Be a part of our journey from Missoula to Berlin, where we will document the historic movement of people from Syria to Germany – a country that, itself, caused millions to flee during World War II.

Support us as we bring you stories of kindness and rejection, bureaucracy and ingenuity, past and future, change and personal growth – including our own.


 

Our program costs are $33,700 for a three-week reporting trip. Our fundraising goal of $6,500 is just a fraction of that. Any funds we raise will go toward students’ lodging, transportation, instruction and newsroom facilities. Raising this money is critical to the outcome of our trip so each member of our small team can afford the expenses and contribute to the project in their unique way. 


 

We are a group of 18 multi-talented students, led by two faculty advisers from the University of Montana School of Journalism. As students, we have acquired deep knowledge of Germany’s role in the refugee crisis – and skills that range from writing to photography, video, audio and digital programming. We are intensely passionate about telling true stories that give a human face to history in the making.


 

As a group, we appreciate anything you can contribute to our project. Individuals donating to our cause will receive a range of different perks, from personalized postcards to beautiful prints shot by our trip photographers, and more! Even if we don't reach our goal of $6,500 ($300 for each student) every cent you donate will help set our journey into motion.


 

  • Visit us on Facebook. We'll be posting events, updates and progress as we prepare for our trip and links to our work we produce once we arrive in Berlin.
  • Share this campaign with anyone that may be interested in supporting student journalism and is interested and passionate about the refugee crisis. Anything helps! 

Danke sehr! شكرا جزيلا 
Thank you very much!

story:
Public Good Project is an ALL-VOLUNTEER NETWORK of researchers, analysts and journalists based in the United States and Canada. We've stood together for over twenty years informing media thought leaders, mentoring scholars, and preparing activists in the war of ideas between indigenous nations and modern states.

Our work is centered on promoting informational public health. By providing facts that help people make sense of social conflict, Public Good correspondents empower them to engage more safely and effectively in public affairs.

Through investigative research, we collect primary documents that can be used as evidence in court. These in turn create a larger context of history and policy analysis, that serves as the basis for informed opinion based on knowledge.

Our consultations, introductions and interventions have saved lives of activists, and scuttled the careers of fascists, racists and frauds. To remain independent, though, we take NO GOVERNMENT, CORPORATE OR FOUNDATION FUNDING.

Keeping our indispensable body of work available, however, costs us $1,800 a year. That's where YOU come in. With your support, we can continue to provide this FREE PUBLIC SERVICE.



Putting together COHERENT AND COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS of social conflict requires monitoring situations, and discussing them with colleagues, in order to advise and mentor people on how to be safe and effective. Our ongoing monitoring of CERA -- the "Ku Klux Klan of Indian Country" -- and the Tea Party, as well as Wise Use political action committees and front groups, has, over the last four years, enabled us to routinely provide the public with key information in a timely manner.

Out of our collegial networking come ideas for new approaches in the applied research we are called on to conduct. Often, valuable information comes to us as a result of our LONG-STANDING ONLINE PRESENCE, our renowned expertise, and our extensive network. Our Netwar Reader, anticipated Winter 2016, examines five case studies illustrating in practice the theories we presented in the 2013 publication Communications in Conflict.

At present, our network is monitoring the netwar between Coast Salish Nation and fossil fuel developers in British Columbia and Washington State, advising editors and journalists, church groups, environmental organizations and tribal leaders. Since 2007, we have monitored, consulted, and intervened in the conflict between indigenous nations and modern states within the context of the United Nations. Right now, we are involved in production of Mandates from God--a groundbreaking documentary film about WHITE POWER, INDIGENOUS PEOPLES and FOSSIL FUEL EXPORT.


With the convergence of Wall Street and the Tea Party, the resurgence of right-wing paramilitary organizing in the United States has made our work more important than ever.  Few human rights organizations are paying attention to CERA, despite the fact that they are actively working with the Tea Party to terminate American Indian tribes. Likewise, few are paying attention to the monstrous movement of INDUSTRIAL-SPONSORED TERRORISM called Wise Use.

By prioritizing INTELLIGENCE OVER EMOTION, we expose progressive fantasies about political power, and reveal how donor elites set the civil society agenda.

With your donation, We can continue to lead the pack--informing and empowering all movements, organizations, networks, and activists across the continent who are committed to defending democracy. You can take pride in knowing you helped!
story_txt:
Public Good Project is an ALL-VOLUNTEER NETWORK of researchers, analysts and
journalists based in the United States and Canada. We've stood together for
over twenty years informing media thought leaders, mentoring scholars, and
preparing activists in the war of ideas between indigenous nations and modern
states.
Our work
is centered on promoting informational public health. By
providing facts that help people make sense of social conflict, Public Good correspondents empower them
to engage more safely and effectively in public affairs. 
Through investigative research, we collect primary documents that can be used as evidence in court. These in turn create a larger context of history and policy analysis, that serves as the
basis for informed opinion based on knowledge.

Our
consultations, introductions and interventions have saved lives of activists,
and scuttled the careers of fascists, racists and frauds. To remain independent, though, we take NO GOVERNMENT, CORPORATE OR FOUNDATION FUNDING.
Keeping our indispensable body of work available, however, costs us $1,800 a year. That's where YOU come in. With your support, we can continue to provide this FREE PUBLIC SERVICE.








Putting
together COHERENT AND COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS of social conflict requires monitoring
situations, and discussing them with colleagues, in order to advise and mentor
people on how to be safe and effective. Our ongoing monitoring of CERA -- the
"Ku Klux Klan of Indian Country" -- and the Tea Party, as well as
Wise Use political action committees and front groups, has, over the last four
years, enabled us to routinely provide the public with key information in a
timely manner.
Out of
our collegial networking come ideas for new approaches in the applied research
we are called on to conduct. Often, valuable information comes to us as a
result of our LONG-STANDING ONLINE PRESENCE, our renowned expertise, and our extensive
network. Our Netwar Reader, anticipated Winter 2016, examines five case
studies illustrating in practice the theories we presented in the 2013
publication Communications in Conflict.
At
present, our network is monitoring the netwar between Coast
Salish Nation and fossil fuel developers in British Columbia and
Washington State, advising editors and journalists, church groups,
environmental organizations and tribal leaders. Since 2007, we have monitored,
consulted, and intervened in the conflict between indigenous nations and modern
states within the context of the United Nations. Right now, we are involved in
production of Mandates from God--a groundbreaking documentary film about WHITE POWER, INDIGENOUS PEOPLES and FOSSIL FUEL EXPORT. 




With the convergence of Wall Street and the Tea Party, the resurgence of right-wing paramilitary organizing in the United States has made our work more important than ever.  Few human rights organizations are paying attention to CERA, despite the fact that they are actively working with the Tea Party to terminate American Indian tribes. Likewise, few are paying attention to the monstrous movement of INDUSTRIAL-SPONSORED TERRORISM called Wise Use. 
By prioritizing INTELLIGENCE OVER EMOTION, we expose progressive fantasies about political power, and reveal how donor elites set the civil society agenda.
With your donation, We can continue to lead the pack--informing and empowering all movements, organizations, networks, and activists across the continent who are committed to defending democracy. You can take pride in knowing you helped!

story:
Hey there! Thank you for stopping by and checking out our Ireland - Imagine That! study abroad trip fundraiser. My sister and I love to travel and decided that we should get some college credits while we're at it so we picked a study abroad trip to ...*drum roll* IRELAND! The land of potatoes as one of the trip leaders described it. The trip is to take place in May 2016! This will probably be the only time we can go on a study abroad trip together because I (Brettany) will graduate before my sister! Our goal is to raise as much money as we can in this short period of time toward the study abroad trip. So every dollar is very appreciated!

Rissy - Art Major

Brettany - Communications: Television & Cinema

story:
There is a BIG PROBLEM

in our high school educational system today. Over 40% of students are chronically disengaged from school.



This is a waste of over 6.5 million talented young minds in the United States alone! You can read the news reports and get lost in the statistics, but a quick conversation with the youths around you will reveal that the obvious reasons for their lack of interest in school has to do with the archaic and uninspired model of cramming academic knowledge into their minds. This teaching method doesn't suit humans, who are born to to think outside the box and solve the problems we face creatively. 

Founder of lean://gap, Eddy Zhong, clearly illustrates the immensity of this issue in his TED Talk about “How School Makes Kids Less Intelligent.”


And he's not the only one, many young leaders expresses the same experiences about the deficiencies of our current high school educational system. If the goal of any society is to grow and educate the next generation of citizens who will be responsible for the well being of the world, then the investments of today should be aimed at the present through believing in the talents in all young people and supporting the growth of that talent by entrusting them to be leaders today.



Definition of Entrepreneur: a person who organizes and manages any enterprise, usually with considerable initiative and risk. a Leader.

Truth is, we are ALL entrepreneurs. Since birth, everything we did, every decision we made, we are taking initiative to understand the world and risking ourselves all the time to make progress in our lives. Why stop? What happened? When did life turn into autopilot?


What is lean://gap ?


Eddy is pursuing a mission to empower high school students to create their own futures, and we students from all over the world support this vision by committing ourselves to lean://gap, the first and only high school entrepreneurship accelerator in the world that brings students' ideas to life through an intensive 6-week summer session. At lean://gap, we'll have the opportunity to work alongside professional engineers, designers, Harvard & MIT professors, and other successful young entrepreneurs. Just like the competitions Eddy spoke about in his TED Talk, we will be executing our ideas by building prototypes and competing against other projects to acquire funding and launch our start ups. Throughout this intensive learning experience, we would emerge as battle-hardened veterans with the necessary skills and resources to confirm, create, test, and build companies that bring valuable solutions to the world.



Who are the lean://gap Stars?

Out of the 1000 applicants, and over 200 interviews, lean://gap Stars are the 40 of us chosen to participate in this revolutionary new concept of HS education. This program has a lower acceptance rate than Harvard.  We were chosen because we've demonstrated the entrepreneurial spirit by persevering with our projects and our vision to better the world despite the lack of support. Each one of us have many great ideas with immense potential but unable to act upon these ideas due to the limited resources, connections, and capabilities of our unfavorable educational environments. 

Meet the Students


Dixon Magister wants to invent a wearable interface that allows users to feel the 3D objects created in the virtual world.
Jason Lu and Ariful Islam wants to work on a non-profit to bring bicycle to children in third-world countries who live too far to walk to school.
Olivia Ross wants to change the way we see important topics such as war, disability, education and race through innovative mobile applications, RPG games and even hardware.
Eric Chen wants to create something audacious, something people will call it stupid, quixotic. And then he will work tirelessly to prove them wrong, to change the world and make it a better place.
Akanksha Kataria wants to merge her passion for business with music, dance and social reform. 
Phillip Chao wants to create a graphene supercapacitor portable power bank that has integrated swappable wall outlet prongs, with the addition of wireless charging for phones and a sim card slot for a wifi hotspot.
For more information, please visit our website: leangapstars.weebly.com

Still unsure how or why Entrepreneurship is a gratifying path to success and happiness?

Check out these success stories from others our age when they started out on their entrepreneurial journey:





How can you support us?

Leangap is a phenomenal opportunity for the cost of only $6,000 per student. However, without financial assistance, a number of us are unable to participate even though we worked tirelessly to be accepted. While many campaigns may have had months in advance for preparation, we Leangapstars on the other hand, have less than 2 weeks to build this campaign from scratch and raise enough fund to grasp this opportunity of a lifetime. We already see the revolutionary potential of this educational platform and we are unwilling to give up no matter how small the window of opportunity is.

Although the true cost of funding some of the students approaches $30,000, we are aiming for $13,000, because we are making efforts to acquire funds from those closest to us. However if this campaign goes beyond our goal, every bit goes to the living costs of attending the program as well as alleviating the burdens from our families and friends.



When you support us

you are not only putting these brilliant students through a revolutionary educational platform that will help create their futures, you are also validating lean://gap as a effective tool to train and educate the leaders of tomorrow. You become a visionary and an entrepreneur, just like the founders of Leangap, who see that in the near future, all high school students would have the opportunity to become the creative contributors of society that they are and not only through the path of a traditional education. 

It's bigger than us. If our campaign is successful, together we will have created a chain reaction for more young aspiring entrepreneurs founding their own companies and creating new futures for themselves. We will have played a major role in creating the new face of education.


Perks! -------> ^


and other ways to help:

1: Follow us on Twitter: @leangap_start

2: Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/leangapstars

3: Buy us coffee! 

4: Buy us a lot of coffee! XD

5: Visit our website! Share that too if you want ;)


About the coffee...

[No really. We're serious.]

If each person who visited this campaign, donated $4.45, that's enough to get a Java Chip Frappuccino from Starbucks. How easy is that? That's why it's so important that we share this campaign. If we can get at least 2,697 people to buy us coffee, we would have enough money to fund all six of our applicants.


THANK YOU

from the deepest of our hearts!

story:
The App - EVENTS4FREE

Creating a simple multi-category app for users worldwide introducing and promoting awareness of creative, mind-expanding, fun and educational events that do not charge entry or admission fees:

  • It's All-In-One & All-Year-Round!
  • Dozens of free events in every city - everyday!!
  • Add your own free event to the app!!!
  • Activism, Art, Comedy, Dance, Educational, Fashion, Kids & Family, Health & Fitness, Theater & Film, etc.  


Short Summary

Darryl Hill / Founder & Creator:   Has over a decade of experience in business analysis, requirements definition, design and development and decided to put those skills to work building products to help connect us socially and further causes that often seem to get left behind in this ever increasing technological landscape.  He holds a masters from USC but has close UCLA friends as well.   :-)

Matt Williams / Sales, Marketing & Advertising: Matt’s 20 years in the digital  publishing business and wanted to apply all that experience to building something with meaning and that he would actually use himself.  

How we came together:  Darryl came up with the idea based on lots of travel and hours surfing the web trying to figure out fun stuff to do in various cities.  He presented Matt with the idea and sparks flew. In fact, we actually met at a free event - Stevie Wonder in downtown LA.   We figured this was a great way to share experiences that families, students, couples, world travelers and inquisitive minds everywhere would want to know about and share. 

The Events-4-Free App is your all in one app for world class fun!  It was built to support cities all over the globe with music, dance, food, fairs, educational events,  art shows, flash mobs and activism. The app is big, bold,  beautiful and built.  Find it in the app store by searching for  EVENTS4FREE.   No more searching all over the place to find free stuff or feeling bad when you missed out and more importantly for educators or parents what a great way to get your kids/students to find enriching things to do for FREE. 

*You can find a quick Hyperlink to the app on the Twitter page www.twitter.com/FreeEventsApp 


What We Need & Why

We are trying to raise money for additional marketing, legal fees (copyrights and such),  and to have even more timely free events in the app so YOU don't have to search for them or worse miss out on the fun.   Besides more free events, we're trying to increase our user base (more downloads) so that we can be self sustaining by charging big promoters who want to pay to be on the suggested event list and of course from advertising dollars.

 Additionally,  we are trying to include  another 36 cities from Amsterdam to Zurich so the money will help us go global since as of now we only support London, Los Angeles, New York and San Francisco.   And finally, any user can submit a free event for review so the app will start to sustain itself as people start entering cool events they are hosting, attending or just want to spread the word about.  

Your generous help with donations will ensure our success so thanks so much for reading this. Will you please make a contribution today?


How the funds will be used

Labor for data entry of events & app developmental updates average $15 per hour at 160 hours per month is $2,400.00 for the next 6 mos.  This is for all cities worldwide. $14,400. 

Advertising costs for press release and mobile-marketing are budgeted for 6 months  $4,575.00. 

Legal protection: copyright, trademark search and appropriate patent applications and registrations are well over $6,000.00.

App upgrades:  Twitter & instagram image feeds as well as adding iAds for generating revenue.  $4,800.

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be allocated exclusively for data entry of the free events for the upcoming year for all cities worldwide.  

PERKS:

Fund contributions of $25 receive a gigantic THANK YOU and a really cool Events–4-Free T-Shirt in your choice of red or yellow (100% cotton).  

$100 donations gets your choice of a red or yellow T-Shirt. Plus a free event of your choice listed in the Suggested Event List for a year. These could be yours or someone else's event. A big heartfelt THANK YOU!

$500 donations. Thank you for your generous efforts to help promote artful, creative, and mind-expanding community events available to everyone via mobile devices worldwide. 5 events in the Suggested Event List for a year and 2 T-shirts and a meadow blanket. 

“Be generous. Give to those you love; give to those who love you, give to the fortunate, give to the unfortunate — yes, give especially to those you don’t want to give. You will receive abundance for your giving. The more you give, the more you will have.” W. Clement Stone


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for viewing our campaign and if you are unable to help with a contribution, we kindly ask to tell two of your coolest friends about the app and it's benefits and to follow us on twitter.   (EVENTS4FREE)     Thank you!

Sincerely & Gratefully,

Darryl & Matt

Events-4-Free Global App

"The Coolest App in Town.  No, Seriously."

story:
Our story

This year the National Institute of Organisation Dynamics Australia (NIODA) is applying for registration and accreditation as a higher education provider.

Since 2010, we have been operating as a small non-profit educational institute in the field of systems psychodynamics. Although relatively new, our educational programs, research and consultancy have grown from a long tradition and practice in systems psychodynamics in Australia. Our flagship three year Leadership, Management and Organisation Dynamics (LMOD) program launched in 2014 builds on a 35-year history in Australia and a 65-year history internationally.

We are now entering a new stage of growth and development. We have added research and consultancy to our service offerings. Achieving TEQSA accreditation will enable us to offer post graduate qualifications, strengthening our position as an alternative provider of excellence in leadership and management education in Australia.

Calling all alumni & friends of NIODA – we need your help!

The TEQSA application process is expensive. We need $65,000 to fund it. Without this money, there is a very real risk that we will not be able to continue the LMOD program. If you are a former student of the programs at Swinburne, RMIT or NIODA or a friend of NIODA, please consider supporting our campaign. If we get 1000 donations of just $65 each, we'll hit our target and future leaders, managers and consultants will continue to have access to this fantastic program.

In recognition of your contribution, those who donate will be invited to a special seminar "Unconscious Processes in Organisations" presented by Dr Susan Long to be held in Melbourne on Monday 31 August from 6pm - 8pm. This will be a great opportunity to get the latest thinking in this field and connect with the NIODA community.

Other ways you can help

We’re running a 3 day Insightful Leadership – The Organisational Role Analysis Approach workshop in Melbourne from 17 – 19 September (cost is $2500 or $2100 for early birds by 31 July). Learn how to become more effective in your role or help others do the same. Download the brochure for more information or register online by 4 September. All proceeds will contribute towards our registration application.

And, in this era of social media, please share our campaign with your family and friend networks. Join us on Facebook or subscribe to our mailing list.

Thanks for your support!

story:
This organization exists because the need to empower girls and young women is still very important. While strides have been made to educate and encourage girls to do more and be more, years and years of separation and inequality still exists when it comes to visibility, opportunities, and economic success.  It is important for all of us to continue to promote empowerment and encouragement to girls and young women to create new identities,  forge new paths, and embrace their journey to self- actualization.  The G.I.R.L Project is dedicated to the guidance and wisdom and effort it will take to facilitate this very process.

The G.I.R.L. Project is a purposeful effort towards empowering girls to do more and be more in every aspect of their lives, their communities and the world via  personal empowerment, explosive exposure, creative innovation and leadership cultivation.

Self-Actualization, a key concept to The G.I.R.L. Project emphasizing the achievement of one's full potential through creativity, independence, spontaneity, and a grasp of  the real world. In order for girls and women to achieve value and equality, it is important to help them self-actualize.

Why This Campaign Method??

The G.I,R,L, Project is at its infant stage. Some people feel in order to get started doing this hard work and giving girls a place to become more is impossible without the money and non-profit legal status, but the reality is that being teachers, while having resources is invaluable, I and my colleagues are capable to begin the process of shaping futures.  And yet, we want to get this effort started the right way.  I recently directed a middle school initiative, my employer fully funding my idea and praised by the children and parents; the initiative showed so much promise, but my passion needed more room to grow as well as needed to focus on girls as I watched the girls in this program struggle with their confidence among the boys. One girl, an only child, quiet and extremely shy came to me and asked was I really going away, and that she really wanted to be a part of my new girl's project.  Very directly she stated that it cannot cost because her parents could not afford it.  I told her that I would be back for her and the others no matter what...it was determined at that very moment...My organization must exist and must be a non-profit!

The impact of this program is going to be huge to the population of the DMV area and their efforts globally. These girls are located in the nation's capital, but are still struggling to maximize their full potential.  There is so much at their disposal, but they need help and encouragement to take advantage. I need to get started now, and honestly I need the funds to begin this effort strong.  Teens have so much access to technology and innovation that beginning this organization with only the resources I can afford would short change the big idea being instituted.  THEY NEED YOUR HELP!

I need $5000.00 to get the word out, register any girl interested, provide t-shirts for the registration, rent conference and workshop space for our first conference and purchase materials to hold three of the enrichment programs all by October 31, 2015. Please visit the site to get more information: www.thegirlproject.me .

Your contribution helps girls to supplement their education with enrichment programs and experiences that will allow them to think big, dream big and be big.

I have a lot ahead of me. I am working diligently and extremely hard to prepare work to become a legal non-profit, form curriculum, schedule space, lock in activities and encourage volunteer support to give shape and credibility to this effort, while working full-time, being a om to my teen girl and doing it alone. Recently, I took a self-inventory to evaluate if this was my purpose, and it was confirmed that everything I have done since third grade showed a girl who could innovate, organize, encourage, create, lead strong, delegate with respect, institute first time quality, persevere, and motivate...a skill set for success. I am confident The G.I.R.L. Project can be an asset in the movement for girl change.

Your contribution to The G.I.R.L. Project will free up my money to pay for the non profit registration process which will be greatly appreciated. And, if you love the idea of the The G.I.R.L. Project, I am happy for ideas of free activities, donations of technology and other resources, and would be very appreciative for helping us to get the word out using your mouth and Indiegogo. If you have a heart for a better future for girls, please find it in that heart to support this effort.

Thank you!

If you have a heart for a better future for girls, please find it in that heart to support this effort.
Thank you!

story:
Future Sound Music - Learning with a difference

We have built the perfect place to learn, collaborate and further your musical journey or career. Now we need your help to write the next chapter in our story.

We are Alan and Matthew, we have been best friends since we were kids and have begun to realise our dream of helping people of all abilities and backgrounds to become thriving musicians. 

  • We provide 1-2-1 Tuition in Guitar, Bass, Drums, Piano, Vocals & Banjo
  • Percussion Groups
  • Singing Experiences
  • workshops and classes in music and video production
  • Performance opportunities!

What We Need

We have been working for months on our new studio and have put our savings into the project. We're now open and already teaching new musicians everyday. We're really excited about our project and want to be able to get as many people learning and collaborating as possible. In order to do this require funding for

  • Essential signage for the front of the studio
  • Further soundproofing
  • Enhancing our online presence
  • Essential equipment

The Impact

Music is so important and Longridge has a great community of music lovers. With your help we can integrate ourselves into the music community and help to support

  • Aspiring musicians
  • Community based projects
  • Building careers for musicians
  • Creating new jobs in the music industry
  • Live performances and collaborations

Perks

We've come up with some really cool perks to give back to our contributors. Read them carefully, there is something for everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that some people may not be able to contribute financially but want to help us on our journey. You can do this by:

  • Sharing our campaign on social networks.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us and follow us on Facebook and twitter!

story:
Empowering Inner-city & At-Risk Students

We can all make a BIG difference…

Are you aware that we have an “illiteracy epidemic” in the United States?  It’s true.  Far too many students are graduating from high school reading at only a 4th or 5th grade reading level...this is functionally illiterate!

Why is this happening?  Good question.

Many years ago, there was an organized campaign to remove the standard, tried and true method to effectively teach reading skills through phonics, replacing this with sight-word and whole-word, which are documented and dismal failures!

It’s not really fair to blame the teachers, because they aren’t being taught how to teach systematic and explicit phonics.

What we did.

In 2001, we jumped in and created an easy to use, foolproof phonics™ program to do just that…teach PHONICS correctly.  Students around the country have been moving up to their age and grade level in reading proficiency using our Smart Way Reading™ methodology, the Gold Standard of Phonics Programs™.

How YOU can help.

To really impact this epidemic a more concerted effort is needed to halt, and reverse, this long-term decline, and especially to reach inner-city and at-risk students who too often turn to gangs or criminality, due, primarily, to a lack of their fundamental right to READ!  Join the Campaign to Eradicate Illiteracy Now!

In this first campaign, we have 200 sets of Smart Way Reading program materials in our warehouse that we would like to send to youth groups, community centers and churches in some of the neediest areas that we know can most effectively use them.  The organizations will receive them free of charge.  Doing this, those materials will help thousands of students every year read fluently and thus have a real chance at getting a good job and living a productive life.

 If you care about the future of our children please help us send these materials to as many cities as possible.  The kids may not know who we are, but, together, WE will know that we will have changed many, many lives for the better!

Become an Official Sponsor of Literacy today.

For every $250 received a full kit of Smart Way Reading, along with additional materials, will be sent to an inner-city community center, church or youth group.

Educators, parents and students alike have expressed how well the program works and the results that have been achieved. A variety of comments may be viewed at Testimonials.

“I must say, without reservation, that I find the Bright Sky Learning program to be the most effective in teaching children to read at or above grade level. I have seen children become excited about learning and their self-esteem raised.”  MR, After-School Program Director

story:
Chess is fun! An educational tool, too.

     

My dream is to create a book that will bring chess to primary school children all over the world. It is called Chess and English with Judit Polgar. I am a chess player and a teacher of English, my name is George Angyan.

21000 USD for production

I am asking for 21000 USD which will cover production costs such as writing scripts and poems, visual editing, illustration, music, and the website of the book, photos and videos. In case more is donated, I will spend it on the Spanish edition: Ajedrez y Espanol con Judit Polgar.

You will receive one of the first copies of Chess and English with Judit Polgar signed by the best female chess player of the world, Judit Polgar.

Why is it important that the book comes through?

Chess has immense educational value.  We are looking for new ways to educate our children to help them co-operate and adopt to the ever-changing conditions of the 21st century better. This is why chess is being recognized as an educational tool by educational experts, politicians and the society at large. Chess and English with Judit Polgar  is important to provide teachers a methodologically sound and globally applicable chess book, so that they can start learning chess with their students right away.

How can you help? 

Tell your friends about Chess and English with Judit Polgar. Let´s bring chess to children all over the world! Share this campaign and www.chessandenglish.com with them.

story:
THE STORY:

Hi Everyone! I am raising money for a school being built in Nicaragua. Please read about the project's mission below. If you feel it is a worthy cause, I would appreciate a donation!

If I reach $5000 - 100% of which will go to the building fund - I will win a bid to attend the trip and actually be able to participate in building it with my own hands. This is something that I've always wanted to do and you can help me get there!

I was born and raised in a small town outside Albany, NY. I am a mom of one son and I am currently serving in the NY National Guard as a Blackhawk Helicopter Mechanic. I was in the US Army for 6 years before I joined the National Guard and have deployed twice to the Middle East. This trip is another way for me to give back. I have always wanted to go on a trip of this sort and directly, profoundly and positively impact the lives of people

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, I would appreciate it if you can share with your connections - the more people that know about the campaign, the better chance I have of reaching my goal.

PLEASE read more about the project below and consider a donation - even $10 will help me reach my goal. Thanks for listening! :)
 

RANDOM ACTS wrote -

In Nicaragua, being born in a rural community often precludes access to high school education and all the opportunities in life that come with it, especially for women. Many rural families practice subsistence farming and do not generate enough income to meet their basic needs even excluding education. These and other individuals such as women who are pregnant or have children, anyone over 18, and people who must work during weekdays are excluded from regular schools.

The Free High School of San Juan del Sur gives these students a chance at secondary education and a better life. In 2012, Random Acts fundraised to help them purchase a bus. Now, we are taking on a much bigger dream: a Center for Human Development which will serve as a campus for the Free High School. Without their own campus, the Free High School students are second class citizens in the eyes of the state, their community, and even themselves. These older adolescents and adults squeeze themselves into elementary school desks and chairs every Saturday, they have very little access to a computer lab that’s far away, and they are treated as lower class students; the discountable.

It’s time to give these deserving students a beautiful campus of their own, complete with a library and a computer lab. Doing so not only gives the school a home, but also teaches the students – some for the first time in their lives – that they are equal to their peers, and valued citizens of the world.

Please join us in turning this dream into reality!

The first 25 people who raise $5,000 between now and July 31st, along with one lucky drawing winner, will be able to join the Random Acts team on the trip of a lifetime to San Juan del Sur this November 20-28.

For more details about the Dreams to Acts: Nicaragua project, including requirements for joining the trip, please visit our Dreams to Acts: Nicaragua website.

Important information regarding the funds you raise or donate: All donations raised through the Dreams to Acts: Nicaragua fundraising campaign will go to Random Acts, a division of The Art Department, Inc. The primary commitment for these funds is to construct the Center for Human Development in San Juan del Sur, Nicaragua and to support any other local organizations with whom Random Acts may choose to partner (this includes administrative and operational expenses associated with our D2A: Nicaragua project). Should funds from this campaign be available after our commitment is satisfied, we reserve the right to re-allocate them to past or future development projects or special initiatives.

story:
Our Story

"The fact that you cannot do everything cannot be an excuse for not doing everything you can."  Unknown

                 After the devastating earthquake in Nepal on April 25, 2015, many good people struggled with shock, sadness and hopelessness. Such an enormous tragedy seemed overwhelming. Many asked the question- what can I do? We have answered that question by seeking out a community that needs a new school. in Nepal's Nuwakot District, where, according to the Red Cross, 50,000 families were displaced, 45,000 homes completely destroyed, and another 5000 partially damaged. In addition, over 900 people were killed and 1300 were injured. To quote a recent Facebook post, "Read and weep first. And then if you can, think what you can do." THIS is what you can do - help us rebuild the  Shree Bindu Kesher Higher Secondary School in Nuwakot District and  connect with a small mountain village not unlike our own.

From Our Small Village to Theirs -  After such a tragedy our children wondered how to help. As teachers and parents we  wanted to create an opportunity for our kids to reach out beyond our small valley in response to the need of children and their families who, in spite of the great distance, are not really so different from themselves. Frustrated with large nonprofits that take months to distribute donations to people in desperate need, our group decided to create our own non-profit in which 100% of the funds go directly and quickly where they are intended to go.  With the help of a few connections in Nepal, we have partnered with a school in the district of Nuwakot, and will be helping to create temporary structures for the people and their livestock, as well as rebuilding the school.  Funds donated through indiegogo will be used first for purchasing roofing materials and then for cleaning rubble from the school site and rebuilding the school.  


Why Choose Valley to Village? - Our group was started by a former Peace Corps volunteer who lived in Nepal for two years, working as a nurse educator. After the earthquake she reached out to friends still living there, and asked what she could do to help.  Valley to Village is the result of their responses.  The people of Taskar have told us what they need, and we are responding.  

Our Challenge

We value humanity, education and the right to learn. It doesn't get more important than this.

  • We are students, parents, educators and dedicated individuals who believe in hard work
  • Through networking and local connections, we will make this happen

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Watch for our  updates - spread our mission!
  • Please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” - Eleanor Roosevelt.

A friend of mine has recently finished her certification to become a CMA Clinical Medical Assistant. This lovely lady told me that I should never loose hope because hope is what keep us going and going. With that in mind, here I am making plans so I can start classes on July. I am being 100% hopeful that some people out there might be willing to help me. And if that person is you, your contribution will cover expenses like mainly tuition and the certifications fee so I can be a Certified Clinical Medical Assistant.

Tuition: $4250  /  Certifications for Phlebotomy, EKG and CMA: $500

 I am living a life of purpose with this new upcoming experience. The benefits to obtaining a Clinical Medical Assistant Certification would give me more job opportunities in a near future. This is only step one right now in my life since I am setting my mind to go even further in this field, maybe even becoming a RN Registered Nurse.

So please, pretty please with a cherry on top, share this on your social networks and remember no amount that you choose to give is too little.

Life itself is our only purpose, be part of mine.


For Anonymous donors that would like to make their donations with BTC:

story:
I would use these funds to partly fund the property and purchase resources to provide amenities - camp kitchens/toilets/showers, a tractor to maintain the property and stock the dam or water courses with appropriate fish.

Thus providing a low cost space for people get away from it all and have the run of a few hundred acres to themselves, where they can run, ride, fish,drive and camp while getting close to nature and spending time as a family or with friends:).

story:
In its fourth year Elemental Arts & Culture Festival will return to Limerick in September 2015. Elemental Festival was created by people with a passion for Limerick with the purpose of animating the city through the arts. Over the last four years Elemental has supported community projects to encourage creativity while working with innovative technologies, eco projects, traditional skills to educate inform and inspire through the arts.
Elemental Arts and Culture Festival 2015 will include visual art, music, film, theatre, Forgotten Skills, eco-workshops, street performers and more. 

Why Fund Us?
Elemental is a volunteer led festival and all funding goes directly to the programme to pay artists, venues, technicians, equipment hire, accommodation, transport, printing (which is huge!) and insurance.
By supporting this crowdfunding campaign, you are directly helping to maintain the high quality we have achieved over the past three years which includes winning Best Programme at the National Festival Awards (AOIFE) and being shortlisted for Best Website and Best Merchandise. We were also shortlisted for the National Green Awards. We are an award winning Festival and we want you involved.
Elemental is Limerick's Arts Festival, help us to grow.

Tell me More:

One element of our mission statement is to use Elemental as a platform for supporting artists but also charities and the local community. Past collaboration includes:
  • The Blue Box
  • Special Olympics
  • The Children's Ark
  • Ger McDonnell Memorial Fund
  • Limerick's Buzzing
  • Fairtrade Limerick

We need to raise a minimum of €2000. 

We want you to invest in our festival and these are the options available:

Earth Element: €10 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media and a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge.

(Badges can be collected during the Festival)

Air Element: €15 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media and a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge AND signed archive postcard and bookmark.

(Items can be collected during the Festival)

Metal Element: €25 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media, a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge, signed archive postcard & bookmark AND a pass for the film screenings.

(Items can be collected from Festival office during the festival)

Wind Element: €50 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media, a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge, signed archive postcard, bookmark, a pass for the film screenings AND entry to the exclusive launch of the sign-artists event, 'Love Letters from Limerick'.

(Items can be collected from the Festival office during the festival)

Fire Element: €100 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media, a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge, signed archive postcard, bookmark, 2 x passes for the film screenings, 2 x entry to the exclusive launch of the sign-artists event 'Love Letters from Limerick' AND a signed Mark Nixon 'Much Loved' book AND 2 x theatre tickets  to award winning play CHAROLAIS on Sept 12.

(Items can be collected from the Festival office during the festival)

Elemental Dragon: €250 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media, a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge, signed archive postcard, bookmark, 2 x passes for the film screenings, 2 x entry to the exclusive launch of the sign-artists event, 'Love Letters from Limerick' AND a limited edition festival themed signed Jacob Stack original print AND gelato for 4 people at Gusto d'Italia, William Street, Limerick.

(All items can be collected from the Festival office during the festival)

Elemental Angel: €500 gets you a thank you on our website and on our social media, a Jacob Stack designed Elemental badge, signed archive postcard, bookmark, 2 x passes for the film screenings, 2 x entry to the exclusive launch of the sign-artists event 'Love Letters from Limerick', a limited edition festival themed signed Jacob Stack original print AND a puppet show for a children's party with Honest Arts (subject to agreeable dates)

All funds collected on this campaign will go directly to Elemental. 

Please read the perks carefully as the incentives offered are unique to the donation and may be different to previous perks.

Thank you to everyone who has sponsored the perks for this fundraising initiative.

Risks & Challenges

Elemental receives no Arts Council Funding at this stage and we are grateful for the in-kind support to date as Elemental would not have happened. In order to organise our events in 2015, we need to fund-raise.

Crowdfunding is an open and transparent means of raising the funds needed and it fits with the ground up ethos of our festival. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that funds are limited these days and if you can't directly fund us, then a share on Facebook or an RT on Twitter or an email to friends and family will be a huge help!
