story:
Truth Walk 9/11 is a walking trek, covering hundreds of miles, in the footsteps of our Founding Fathers as well as sites which were involved in the crimes of 9/11.  We plan to embark from Shanksville, PA, then following the Potomac River to our nation's capital in Washington, DC, then from DC we'll walk to the Pentagon 9/11 Memorial in Arlington, VA and then back to DC and on into the historic sites of Baltimore, MD, Philidelphia, PA, Trenton, Morristown, Princeton, and Newark, NJ then on into NYC to the site of 9/11 Museum Memorial at Ground Zero, as well as to the 9/11 Survivor's Tree. *1

David Meiswinkle at the Trenton State Museum, 9/11 Memorial Exhibition.


Our mission ~ is to investigate all aspects of the crimes of 9/11, on film, in light of the very real fact that since 9/11 no genuine criminal investigation has taken place. We intend to explore everything...no taboos! There isn't anything which should be ignored, for this is the very thing which has kept 9/11 from being properly investigated in the first place.


Dr. Cornel West and Pamela Senzee in front of the White House after the historic March Against Drones

We also want to create a documentary which explores our nation’s founding principles and the relationship between the current losses of Constitutional freedoms and the apparent official 9/11 government fictions.

We recognize that the Constitution is a living document embodying spiritual principles and truths which are eternal. During the walk we intend to explore all aspects of what may be required to generate and manifest true freedom in our own nation and inspire its birth and growth in other nations as well.

There are many subversive, influential forces including financial powers which endeavor to undermine these divine liberties. Our goal by doing the walk and in making our documentary is to bring light to this dark situation and expose the corrupt system so that we as a people can overcome.

Truth Walk also has another mission as well, one of transformation. Our online radio/podcast Quantum Matrix Radio deals with these serious issues while also focusing on both the science and the inspiration of that which has the genuine power to change the paradigm of a post 9/11 world; in this spirit we’ll also explore what quantum physicists are saying about changing the world paradigm.

If every man, woman and child, regardless of race, color, creed, or nationality were known to be a powerful spiritual being, how could the masses be controlled for profit and be duped so easily? Could it be that the most subversive measures of oppressive and tyrannical forces are those which obscure our true spiritual nature and self empowerment? 

We also hope to build a bridge between the peace, Constitutional, and truth movements. We'll interview leaders from both movements and from others, as well as varied experts, professionals, scholars, political leaders, religious leaders, and just people, the people who make up this country and the world.

We want to change this paradigm, but we need your help. We believe that together, we can do it!                                                                                                                                             Thank you,                                                                                                                         David and Pam

A message from the Truth Walk 9/11 Team:

Please support former police officer and practicing criminal defense attorney David R. Meiswinkle, president and founder of NewJersey 9/11 Aware a nonprofit 501C(3) organization, whose mission is to educate the public and facilitate in the realization of a genuine criminal investigation into 9/11 based on the nexus of jurisdiction in New Jersey; NJ911Aware has been featured on world renown AE911Truth as activist news.

David teams up, on this historic walk, with artist, author, peace activist, cross country trekker, and practicing yogi Pamela Senzee, author of the book Quantum Trek: a Post 9/11 Journey of Transformation, a book documenting her cross country trek for AE911Truth, and which also documents her spiritual insights along the way. Pamela's inspiring book has been reviewed by Richard Gage, AIA, Dr. Niels Harrit, Dr. Graeme MacQueen, and David Meiswinkle, JD.

How We'll Utilize Your Donation

Pam will travel from AZ to NJ to meet with David and begin the journey, embarking from Shanksville, PA. 

Pamela's standard living expenses and bills must be paid during the course of the walk as well as a buffer fund as she transitions back into life afterward, after having left her course of work, etc in order to perform the walk. David may draw from funds raised, as well for ongoing expenses which he must cover during his participation in the walk.

Materials for the trek such as camping gear, walking bobs, food, water, special shoes, etc. Also we would like to organize events, in particular at Shanksville, the Pentagon, DC and at Ground Zero in NYC.

Funds will also cover filmmaking equipment, editing software, the entire filmmaking process and materials needed from beginning to end. We hope to produce a final film product which is film festival worthy, thanks to you!

We will to write about our experiences and observations as well and to document these in a co-authored book.

Our film Truth Walk 9/11! Do You Want to Live in a World Based in Truth? and our book Truth Walk 9/11! Reflections on Road (titles are subject to change) will both be sent to all donors of gifts of $500 or more.

David and Pam will be walking hundreds of miles for the sake of truth and to document on film an investigation into 9/11 as has never been done before, and to highlight the core of our nation, the law of the land, our One Law, the U.S. Constitution and its Bill Of Rights. The success of this endeavor is up to you; please help us on our journey, join the Truth Walk 9/11! funding and support team on Indiegogo!

Risks and challenges

When partaking on a physical journey, there will always be obstacles. Weather, fatigue, and unexpected events are sure to crop up (as they did on Pam's first journey!).

David and Pam are set on completing the journey, and on creating a great film!

Truth Walk 9/11 is sponsored in part by Quantum Matrix Alternative Media (home of Quantum Matrix Radio) both are at www.qmamedia.com

*The walks duration is subject to change dependent upon David’s legal practice and other unforeseeable circumstances.

story:
Short Summary

The Art of Living Foundation in Greece has been running a project with refugees boys for the last three years. These boys, known as ‘endangered minors’ are either separated from or have lost their parents and are now alone in Athens. They come from a variety of countries – Syria, Afghanistan, Pakistan and Eritrea. 

These boys are part of The Art of Living Greece family and every summer we provide them a Yoga Holiday in the island of Mytiline (Greece).

YOUR SUPPORT will support more refugees boys to have a bright future ahead 

With your support we can fund the holiday for more refugees boys and give them the opportunity to participate to the workshop called YES! (Youth Empowerment Seminar) based on Yoga, Meditation, Breathing Exercise, Fun, Processes to help them to overcome their traumas and give the opportunity to face the future with a big smile. 

OUR GOAL

We want to raise at least 500€ to provide the full holiday for 2 teenagers.
This is just the beginning:  more money we raise,  more life of these boys we can impact.  

With the recent events in Syria we have more boys to support.

Along with these holiday with provide them daily support in Athens with weekly yoga lesson, parties and various events.

If you do not want to send your contribution online, you can instead make a direct contribution. Please contact info@theartofliving.gr.


OUR YOGA HOLIDAY 

  

We have a great venue on the island of Mytiline in Greece, we can host many boys. 
The Yoga holiday will happen from 3th to 8th July.

We will provide them:

  • Art of Living YES! course;
  • full accommodation and food;
  • Fun, day and night healthy parties.

THE YES! WORKSHOP 

The Youth Empowerment Seminar - YES! (Ages 13-17)

The Youth Empowerment Seminar (YES!) from ages 13-17 is dedicated to providing youth with a healthy body, a healthy mind and a healthy lifestyle.  We do this by offering youth practical tools and life skills to manage stress and emotions.  When students learn how to manage their stress in a healthy way, they exhibit greater confidence and motivation to succeed in school and make healthy choices when faced with life's challenges. 

Young people face emotional issues such as low self-esteem, depression and anxiety that are a source of great stress, which inhibits learning.  Without a healthy alternative, students often turn to unhealthy strategies to cope with these problems including: smoking, alcohol or drugs, aggression and violence, and withdrawal from social interaction.  As students learn to reduce stress and manage emotions they gain the ability to focus and perform well academically at school, as well as the ability to build more positive relationships with their peers, parents and teachers. 


OUR MISSION

THE TEAM

The team is a powerful combination of skills and deep passion for what we are going to do for these boys. We will teach them Yoga, cook for them, play with them and all as Seva (volunteering).

JUDI MILES  (Art of Living Greece head)
ALESSANDRO TROTTA (Art of Living faculty)
Many Volunteers from all over Europe

story:
About Karina Carmen Velasco

I am a professional multidisciplinary artist in the genres of dance, music, acting and writing. Born in Spain of Spanish and Cuban heritage I was raised on the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. My childhood was a constant myriad of moves, countries and changes. Something I had once feared was a liability, would actually become an enormous asset. Having spent important and significant time and experiences in the Caribbean, United States, Spain, France, Greece, Cyprus, and Mexico and having traveled extensively, the gift has been to truly be a citizen of our one World. 

About the Campaign

Through the benefits of this campaign I intend to complete and publish my first two books for adults and children on the subject of Arts as the Universal Language of Humanity. As well as to expand on other elevating benefits of connection, healing, joy and peace through the arts. As a performance artist, educator and avid musicologist, I have shared my work with countless persons of all ethnic backgrounds and beliefs. Through the gift of their responses, I have been able to clearly see the undeniable thread of connection throughout humanity and how the arts provide us a forum for sharing in our oneness. Furthermore, as a tool for education understanding the historical journeys of the arts and its creators as well as the implements, such as instruments, provides us with an excellent means to understand the shared experience of culture and the constant co-creations that occur throughout their journey. As a collaborative experience the arts in all its manifestations provide us all with a means to express, unite and work together. 

My goal is to release both books and continue expanding the dialogue of how to actively implement arts and share in culture as a tool, not only of beauty and creativity, but of language, self-realization and multicultural understanding.

As the project progresses I would like to develop a documentary film to follow this process.

And finally my greatest wish is that all of these projects will culminate in a foundation that will encourage the awareness of our oneness and the work of unification and understanding through the arts around the World.  

What I Need & What You Get

In this first phase I need to have the books, edited, proofed, visually designed, printed and published. I also need to keep building infrastructure for the project itself.

Arts: One Planet, One Humanity, One Language A story of the first and shared language of humanity.  Is a book for adults. A personal journey of experience and awareness as well as archeological, historical and scientific information that provides a manual for expanding the understanding of our connection and the multifaceted benefits of arts and culture.

You Dance, I Dance, We All Dance Around the Globe A children's guide of dance around the World. With a unique surprise that allows children to hand to each other from country to country a shared dance implement utilized across the globe, it is both a creative book and an instructional book. Providing knowledge of the arts, culture and geography with a message of our connection and combined contributions that create them.

With your investment you are allowing me the ability to complete the work, finish creative, go to print and promote the message! 

As an investor you are pre buying a copy of the books and will receive either a copy of the childrens’ book or adult book or both as preferred. 

And please make sure to visit the perks section where you may contribute by purchasing dance fans, beautiful orginal works of art, photography, or even live musical events! 

10 % of Funds Donated

I will be donating 10% of the campaign proceeds to organizations providing arts development to under-served communities and humanitarian aid. Their will be tranpserency about these donations. E-mails will be sent to contributors letting them know when donations are made and exactly where they are made. 

The Impact

Arts and culture are our universal language. Beyond the experience we feel as recipients of the arts, they truly do allow us an avenue to our collectiveness. In areas of strain and conflict, trauma and loss they provide the least non-threatening means towards understanding, dialogue, reconciliation and healing. Through my work I have found that they are indispensable to show the globe and humanity as they are, one.

I am a successful dance company director and producer and have extensive experience working in development, production, management and promotion.  I have worked as a free-lance writer and among other writing projects have translated, edited and proofed Tamales a Children's Guide, a book sponsored by the LAPCA Foundation Los Angeles and funded by The Smithsonian. I am a member of the International Dance Council, UNESCO and have been performing since child hood for about 41 years now and as a professional for 25 years. 

Risks & Challenges

All ventures face risks. Whatever the outcome of the campaign, which ever amount is raised the funds will go towards continuing to move the work and the projects forward and sharing the message. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Not everyone can contribute monetarily. Instead let people know! Enjoy art and culture. Seek moments where you can experience or create work and share in our oneness through our shared language. And finally connect with the wonder the arts provide us. Where else can you deeply find yourself while also being allowed to lose yourself when necessary! 

“Art is humanity’s most essential, most universal language. It is not a frill, but a necessary part of communication. The quality of civilization can be measured through its music, dance, drama, architecture, visual art and literature. We must give ourselves and our children knowledge and understanding of civilizations most profound works.” –Ernest L. Boyer

In gratitude, muchas gracias, thank you!

story:
About Us

Coach André Morton is owner of Rhythm and Stroke LLC, an Aquatics organization focusing on water safety, swim survival, stroke refinement and aquatic exercise. He has been an Aquatics Instructor for over ten years. who has exploded the fitness scene with his water classes.  

Coach André swam competitively for several years. Now he shares his experience and expertise with others. Teaching everyone from fearful newcomers to the water in his Free ‘Do it Afraid Program’, to more advanced swimmers who have a desire to enhance their swim skills. Teaching infants,  seasoned seniors, Navy recruits and certifying aspiring and current lifeguards. Coach André is WSI and LGI certified and holds a Master's degree from Bowling Green State University. 

He and his Queen, Kimberly, work together to push their Swim Like Me initiative. It is their mission to help others inhale confidence & exhale fear in the water, especially in the African-American and Hispanic communities where the drowning rates are the highest.

With your help, our 3D animated characters, Splash and Friends, will educate children and adults of all ages and cultures on the importance of water safety and learning to swim.  

What We Need 

  • We are raising $25,000.00 to create 5 animated episodes of Splash and Friends. Each episode will cover the myths and facts of swimming and water safety.
  • For your donation, you will receive unique Rhythm and Stroke gear such as our state of the art Swim Cap.
  • Once we reach our entire goal, funds will go to the production of the characters and the animated episodes so children and adults alike can have a new perspective of swimming and eliminate negative myths of swimming

The Impact

We have successfully done our part decreasing the high drowning rates by training over 600 people annually on water safety and learning to swim. This animation will help us reach the masses with 'educ-tainment', while entertaining we will also educate children and adults on water safety.  

We are promoting this project because we feel:

  • Representation is important. In order to change the negative stereotypes among all races that Blacks and Hispanics can't swim,  representation of these same cultures swimming is encouraging and empowering.  
  • Everyone loves to go to the water,  Pool, ocean or cruises, but 87%  of these same people cannot swim. The animation is a fun way to get people to Splash Safely.  Education will help decrease the high drowning rates. 

Risks & Challenges

Once the project is complete, we will have to promote it to production companies to get it into syndication, The challenge of others seeing value in the importance of children and adults learning to swim and practicing proper water safety techniques is something we have faced for years and continue to face in and outside of our communities. We also have the challenge of renting other facilities to hold our classes. 

Our Solutions: 

  • We are working diligently on purchasing our own facility 
  • We have begun and will continue to build relationships with individuals and companies that understand the importance of decreasing drowning rates who will take an interest in our mission. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is priceless. No Financial Contribution is too small, but we understand if you can't contribute at this time. So, How Can you help? 

Help us get the word out by helping us make some noise! 

  • Share our campaign from Indiegogo on Facebook, Twitter, Snap Chat, Instagram and YouTube
  • Share our campaign in Email Blasts
  • Share our campaign in text messages and phone calls
  • SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN!

Thank you in Advance!

story:
Greetings from Madagascar!

My name is Lalatiana Rahariniaina. I am the co-founder and head of Go4initiative association. Our non-profit organization aims at promoting access to education in Madagascar.

Last year, I had the great opportunity to visit Amberomena, a small village in the rural area of Moramanga, in Alaotra-Mangoro region. When exchanging with its inhabitants, I discovered that the children of the village really want to go to school. Unfortunately, most parents who make their living from small farming cannot afford it. That is why, on behalf of my association, I set up this fundraising page to raise money for sending the children of Amberomena to school. These kids really need your help and support to fulfill their dream and right to education.

Our goal is to raise $1,500. This money will keep 40 children in school for one year. It will be used for their school fees and supplies.

“Ny erikerika mahatondra-drano”, a Malagasy proverb which means ‘a little rain everyday will make the river flood’. Indeed, there is no small contribution, each of your effort counts and makes a big difference. With $1, you offer a child a copy book and 3 pens. With $5, you buy a school bag. With $10, you support his/her school fees of a year. With $35, you give the chance to a child to attend school for one year by paying for his/her school fees and supplies.  

Thank you so much for your support and please, we would really appreciate if you share this campaign across your social networks and encourage your friends and family to donate.

story:
Do you DIG the Junkins family?

The JFA, founded in 1984, is a non-profit educational organization whose purpose is: To honor and perpetuate the memory of Robert Junkins and Sarah Smyth; To preserve the history of their lives; And to foster a spirit of fellowship among all Junkins descendants. - Association details -

Robert, a Scottish prisoner of war, settled in York Maine in the late 1600's and his children and grandchildren built and occupied a farmstead in the Scotland Bridge district. This garrison style homestead has been documented through many illustrations, but today only exists as a cellar hole, a brick chimney foundation, and a nearby burial ground. - Historical details -

Noted New England archaeologist and historian Neill De Paoli spoke to the Association at our last reunion in 2014, and laid the groundwork for a research dig at the site of the garrison house. The goal of the project is monumental:

Building on the results of the investigations carried out by previous archaeologists, to conclusively determine the identity and antiquity of the Junkins' garrison house.

The JFA, through your generous contributions, will be funding this research. But we can ONLY accomplish this with your help. - Proposal details -

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal to get started is $3000, and every little contribution will help. $2500 will fund the initial part of the archaeological dig. Everything above that, our stretch goals, will extend the work that Neill and his crew can do. <Dig details>

Your donations can be small or large. And you can be rewarded by the pleasure of knowing about our good work, or you can choose one of the gifts shown at the right based on your level of giving ==>

Your donations are risk free. If we do NOT reach our goal of $3000, your individual donations will be returned to you in full. So help us get there!

The Impact

By determining the age of the garrison, and its modifications, we add to the historical story of the Junkins family. We might find important artifacts. We might determine who lived there, and when. We will fill in gaps in Junkins history and York history and see where our ancestors fit in.

In the past the JFA, through contributions, has preserved family burial grounds and placed permanent markers commemorating our ancestors. - Marker detail -

Risks & Challenges

There is no guarantee what Neill and his crew will find. All we know is that by leaving the cellar hole unexplored for the next couple of decades we will lose whatever stories are there now for us to discover.

story:
I am Sam Newman, a 4-year varsity golfer at Falmouth High School.  I have noticed a need at our school for a college scholarship for graduating seniors from the golf team. Almost every other sport at our school has at least one local scholarship to support the student athletes, but so far, not golf!  As my senior community service project, I have taken on the challenge of creating this scholarship to be awarded to a college-bound graduating student or students, excluding myself.

Thank you for your donations!  Between these online contributions and donations directly to the Scholarship Association of Falmouth, nearly $2000 has been raised as of late August. 

While the online donations are wrapping up now, there is still time to contribute via check!  Send donations to the Scholarship Association of Falmouth (with the word GOLF in the subject line) and mail to S.A.F., PO Box 369, Falmouth, MA 02541.   The tax ID# is 04-2463819. 

Coming this fall --- a fundraising golf tournament!  Check my golf scholarship Facebook page for details.
